module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.AutomaticTapeCreationRule

-- | An automatic tape creation policy consists of automatic tape creation
--   rules where each rule defines when and how to create new tapes. For
--   more information about automatic tape creation, see <a>Creating Tapes
--   Automatically</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutomaticTapeCreationRule</a> smart constructor.
data AutomaticTapeCreationRule
AutomaticTapeCreationRule' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> Integer -> Natural -> AutomaticTapeCreationRule

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to indicate that tapes are to be archived as
--   write-once-read-many (WORM). Set to <tt>false</tt> when WORM is not
--   enabled for tapes.
[$sel:worm:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'] :: AutomaticTapeCreationRule -> Maybe Bool

-- | A prefix that you append to the barcode of the virtual tape that you
--   are creating. This prefix makes the barcode unique.
--   
--   The prefix must be 1-4 characters in length and must be one of the
--   uppercase letters from A to Z.
[$sel:tapeBarcodePrefix:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'] :: AutomaticTapeCreationRule -> Text

-- | The ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving.
--   The tape in this pool is archived in the Amazon S3 storage class that
--   is associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
[$sel:poolId:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'] :: AutomaticTapeCreationRule -> Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tape capacity.
[$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'] :: AutomaticTapeCreationRule -> Integer

-- | The minimum number of available virtual tapes that the gateway
--   maintains at all times. If the number of tapes on the gateway goes
--   below this value, the gateway creates as many new tapes as are needed
--   to have <tt>MinimumNumTapes</tt> on the gateway. For more information
--   about automatic tape creation, see <a>Creating Tapes
--   Automatically</a>.
[$sel:minimumNumTapes:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'] :: AutomaticTapeCreationRule -> Natural

--   fields omitted.

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.BandwidthRateLimitInterval

-- | Describes a bandwidth rate limit interval for a gateway. A bandwidth
--   rate limit schedule consists of one or more bandwidth rate limit
--   intervals. A bandwidth rate limit interval defines a period of time on
--   one or more days of the week, during which bandwidth rate limits are
--   specified for uploading, downloading, or both.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBandwidthRateLimitInterval</a> smart constructor.
data BandwidthRateLimitInterval
BandwidthRateLimitInterval' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> NonEmpty Natural -> BandwidthRateLimitInterval

-- | The average upload rate limit component of the bandwidth rate limit
--   interval, in bits per second. This field does not appear in the
--   response if the upload rate limit is not set.
[$sel:averageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> Maybe Natural

-- | The average download rate limit component of the bandwidth rate limit
--   interval, in bits per second. This field does not appear in the
--   response if the download rate limit is not set.
[$sel:averageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> Maybe Natural

-- | The hour of the day to start the bandwidth rate limit interval.
[$sel:startHourOfDay:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> Natural

-- | The minute of the hour to start the bandwidth rate limit interval. The
--   interval begins at the start of that minute. To begin an interval
--   exactly at the start of the hour, use the value <tt>0</tt>.
[$sel:startMinuteOfHour:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> Natural

-- | The hour of the day to end the bandwidth rate limit interval.
[$sel:endHourOfDay:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> Natural

-- | The minute of the hour to end the bandwidth rate limit interval.
--   
--   The bandwidth rate limit interval ends at the end of the minute. To
--   end an interval at the end of an hour, use the value <tt>59</tt>.
[$sel:endMinuteOfHour:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> Natural

-- | The days of the week component of the bandwidth rate limit interval,
--   represented as ordinal numbers from 0 to 6, where 0 represents Sunday
--   and 6 represents Saturday.
[$sel:daysOfWeek:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> NonEmpty Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>BandwidthRateLimitInterval</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   to start the bandwidth rate limit interval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startMinuteOfHour:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'</a>,
--   <a>bandwidthRateLimitInterval_startMinuteOfHour</a> - The minute of

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.CacheAttributes

-- | The refresh cache information for the file share or FSx file systems.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCacheAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data CacheAttributes
CacheAttributes' :: Maybe Int -> CacheAttributes

-- | Refreshes a file share's cache by using Time To Live (TTL). TTL is the
--   length of time since the last refresh after which access to the
--   directory would cause the file gateway to first refresh that
--   directory's contents from the Amazon S3 bucket or Amazon FSx file
--   system. The TTL duration is in seconds.
--   
--   Valid Values:0, 300 to 2,592,000 seconds (5 minutes to 30 days)
[$sel:cacheStaleTimeoutInSeconds:CacheAttributes'] :: CacheAttributes -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CacheAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheStaleTimeoutInSeconds:CacheAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>cacheAttributes_cacheStaleTimeoutInSeconds</a> - Refreshes a file
--   share's cache by using Time To Live (TTL). TTL is the length of time
--   since the last refresh after which access to the directory would cause
--   the file gateway to first refresh that directory's contents from the
--   Amazon S3 bucket or Amazon FSx file system. The TTL duration is in
--   seconds.
--   
--   Valid Values:0, 300 to 2,592,000 seconds (5 minutes to 30 days)
newCacheAttributes :: CacheAttributes

-- | Refreshes a file share's cache by using Time To Live (TTL). TTL is the
--   length of time since the last refresh after which access to the
--   directory would cause the file gateway to first refresh that
--   directory's contents from the Amazon S3 bucket or Amazon FSx file
--   system. The TTL duration is in seconds.
--   
--   Valid Values:0, 300 to 2,592,000 seconds (5 minutes to 30 days)
cacheAttributes_cacheStaleTimeoutInSeconds :: Lens' CacheAttributes (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.CacheAttributes.CacheAttributes

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.CaseSensitivity.CaseSensitivity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.CaseSensitivity.CaseSensitivity


module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.ChapInfo

-- | Describes Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP)
--   information that supports authentication between your gateway and
--   iSCSI initiators.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChapInfo</a> smart constructor.
data ChapInfo
ChapInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> ChapInfo

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume.
--   
--   Valid Values: 50 to 500 lowercase letters, numbers, periods (.), and
--   hyphens (-).
[$sel:targetARN:ChapInfo'] :: ChapInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The secret key that the initiator (for example, the Windows client)
--   must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the target.
[$sel:secretToAuthenticateInitiator:ChapInfo'] :: ChapInfo -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The iSCSI initiator that connects to the target.
[$sel:initiatorName:ChapInfo'] :: ChapInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The secret key that the target must provide to participate in mutual
--   CHAP with the initiator (e.g., Windows client).
[$sel:secretToAuthenticateTarget:ChapInfo'] :: ChapInfo -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>ChapInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetARN:ChapInfo'</a>, <a>chapInfo_targetARN</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume.
--   
--   Valid Values: 50 to 500 lowercase letters, numbers, periods (.), and
--   hyphens (-).
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretToAuthenticateInitiator:ChapInfo'</a>,
--   <a>chapInfo_secretToAuthenticateInitiator</a> - The secret key that
--   the initiator (for example, the Windows client) must provide to
--   participate in mutual CHAP with the target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:initiatorName:ChapInfo'</a>, <a>chapInfo_initiatorName</a> -
--   The iSCSI initiator that connects to the target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretToAuthenticateTarget:ChapInfo'</a>,
--   <a>chapInfo_secretToAuthenticateTarget</a> - The secret key that the
--   target must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the initiator
--   (e.g., Windows client).
newChapInfo :: ChapInfo

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume.
--   
--   Valid Values: 50 to 500 lowercase letters, numbers, periods (.), and
--   hyphens (-).
chapInfo_targetARN :: Lens' ChapInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The secret key that the initiator (for example, the Windows client)
--   must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the target.
chapInfo_secretToAuthenticateInitiator :: Lens' ChapInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The iSCSI initiator that connects to the target.
chapInfo_initiatorName :: Lens' ChapInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The secret key that the target must provide to participate in mutual
--   CHAP with the initiator (e.g., Windows client).
chapInfo_secretToAuthenticateTarget :: Lens' ChapInfo (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.ChapInfo.ChapInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.ChapInfo.ChapInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.ChapInfo.ChapInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.ChapInfo.ChapInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.ChapInfo.ChapInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.ChapInfo.ChapInfo


module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.DeviceiSCSIAttributes

-- | Lists iSCSI information about a VTL device.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeviceiSCSIAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data DeviceiSCSIAttributes
DeviceiSCSIAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> DeviceiSCSIAttributes

-- | Specifies the unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that encodes the iSCSI
--   qualified name(iqn) of a tape drive or media changer target.
[$sel:targetARN:DeviceiSCSIAttributes'] :: DeviceiSCSIAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether mutual CHAP is enabled for the iSCSI target.
[$sel:chapEnabled:DeviceiSCSIAttributes'] :: DeviceiSCSIAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | The network interface identifier of the VTL device.
[$sel:networkInterfaceId:DeviceiSCSIAttributes'] :: DeviceiSCSIAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The port used to communicate with iSCSI VTL device targets.
[$sel:networkInterfacePort:DeviceiSCSIAttributes'] :: DeviceiSCSIAttributes -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeviceiSCSIAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetARN:DeviceiSCSIAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>deviceiSCSIAttributes_targetARN</a> - Specifies the unique Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) that encodes the iSCSI qualified name(iqn) of a
--   tape drive or media changer target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:chapEnabled:DeviceiSCSIAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>deviceiSCSIAttributes_chapEnabled</a> - Indicates whether mutual
--   CHAP is enabled for the iSCSI target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInterfaceId:DeviceiSCSIAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>deviceiSCSIAttributes_networkInterfaceId</a> - The network
--   interface identifier of the VTL device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInterfacePort:DeviceiSCSIAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>deviceiSCSIAttributes_networkInterfacePort</a> - The port used to
--   communicate with iSCSI VTL device targets.
newDeviceiSCSIAttributes :: DeviceiSCSIAttributes

-- | Specifies the unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that encodes the iSCSI
--   qualified name(iqn) of a tape drive or media changer target.
deviceiSCSIAttributes_targetARN :: Lens' DeviceiSCSIAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether mutual CHAP is enabled for the iSCSI target.
deviceiSCSIAttributes_chapEnabled :: Lens' DeviceiSCSIAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | The network interface identifier of the VTL device.
deviceiSCSIAttributes_networkInterfaceId :: Lens' DeviceiSCSIAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The port used to communicate with iSCSI VTL device targets.
deviceiSCSIAttributes_networkInterfacePort :: Lens' DeviceiSCSIAttributes (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.DeviceiSCSIAttributes.DeviceiSCSIAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.DeviceiSCSIAttributes.DeviceiSCSIAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.DeviceiSCSIAttributes.DeviceiSCSIAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.DeviceiSCSIAttributes.DeviceiSCSIAttributes

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Disk

-- | Represents a gateway's local disk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDisk</a> smart constructor.
data Disk
Disk' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Disk

-- | The iSCSI qualified name (IQN) that is defined for a disk. This field
--   is not included in the response if the local disk is not defined as an
--   iSCSI target. The format of this field is
--   <i>targetIqn::LUNNumber::region-volumeId</i>.
[$sel:diskAllocationResource:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text
[$sel:diskAllocationType:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The device node of a local disk as assigned by the virtualization
--   environment.
[$sel:diskNode:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The path of a local disk in the gateway virtual machine (VM).
[$sel:diskPath:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The local disk size in bytes.
[$sel:diskSizeInBytes:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Integer

-- | A value that represents the status of a local disk.
[$sel:diskStatus:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique device ID or other distinguishing data that identifies a
--   local disk.
[$sel:diskId:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text
[$sel:diskAttributeList:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>Disk</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskAllocationResource:Disk'</a>,
--   <a>disk_diskAllocationResource</a> - The iSCSI qualified name (IQN)
--   that is defined for a disk. This field is not included in the response
--   if the local disk is not defined as an iSCSI target. The format of
--   this field is <i>targetIqn::LUNNumber::region-volumeId</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskAllocationType:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_diskAllocationType</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskNode:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_diskNode</a> - The device node of
--   a local disk as assigned by the virtualization environment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskPath:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_diskPath</a> - The path of a local
--   disk in the gateway virtual machine (VM).
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskSizeInBytes:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_diskSizeInBytes</a> - The
--   local disk size in bytes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskStatus:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_diskStatus</a> - A value that
--   represents the status of a local disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskId:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_diskId</a> - The unique device ID or
--   other distinguishing data that identifies a local disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskAttributeList:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_diskAttributeList</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
newDisk :: Disk

-- | The iSCSI qualified name (IQN) that is defined for a disk. This field
--   is not included in the response if the local disk is not defined as an
--   iSCSI target. The format of this field is
--   <i>targetIqn::LUNNumber::region-volumeId</i>.
disk_diskAllocationResource :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
disk_diskAllocationType :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The device node of a local disk as assigned by the virtualization
--   environment.
disk_diskNode :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The path of a local disk in the gateway virtual machine (VM).
disk_diskPath :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The local disk size in bytes.
disk_diskSizeInBytes :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Integer)

-- | A value that represents the status of a local disk.
disk_diskStatus :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique device ID or other distinguishing data that identifies a
--   local disk.
disk_diskId :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
disk_diskAttributeList :: Lens' Disk (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Disk.Disk
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Disk.Disk
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Disk.Disk

--   is required.

--   is required.

--   system is available.

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.GatewayInfo

-- | Describes a gateway object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGatewayInfo</a> smart constructor.
data GatewayInfo
GatewayInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> GatewayInfo

-- | The Region where the Amazon EC2 instance is located.
[$sel:ec2InstanceRegion:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways
--   operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
[$sel:gatewayARN:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EC2 instance that was used to launch the gateway.
[$sel:ec2InstanceId:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the gateway.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>DISABLED</tt> | <tt>ACTIVE</tt>
[$sel:gatewayOperationalState:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the gateway.
[$sel:gatewayName:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier assigned to your gateway during activation. This
--   ID becomes part of the gateway Amazon Resource Name (ARN), which you
--   use as input for other operations.
[$sel:gatewayId:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the gateway.
[$sel:gatewayType:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GatewayInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2InstanceRegion:GatewayInfo'</a>,
--   <a>gatewayInfo_ec2InstanceRegion</a> - The Region where the Amazon EC2
--   instance is located.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:GatewayInfo'</a>, <a>gatewayInfo_gatewayARN</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways
--   operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2InstanceId:GatewayInfo'</a>,
--   <a>gatewayInfo_ec2InstanceId</a> - The ID of the Amazon EC2 instance
--   that was used to launch the gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayOperationalState:GatewayInfo'</a>,
--   <a>gatewayInfo_gatewayOperationalState</a> - The state of the gateway.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>DISABLED</tt> | <tt>ACTIVE</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayName:GatewayInfo'</a>, <a>gatewayInfo_gatewayName</a> -
--   The name of the gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayId:GatewayInfo'</a>, <a>gatewayInfo_gatewayId</a> - The
--   unique identifier assigned to your gateway during activation. This ID
--   becomes part of the gateway Amazon Resource Name (ARN), which you use
--   as input for other operations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayType:GatewayInfo'</a>, <a>gatewayInfo_gatewayType</a> -
--   The type of the gateway.
newGatewayInfo :: GatewayInfo

-- | The Region where the Amazon EC2 instance is located.
gatewayInfo_ec2InstanceRegion :: Lens' GatewayInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways
--   operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
gatewayInfo_gatewayARN :: Lens' GatewayInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon EC2 instance that was used to launch the gateway.
gatewayInfo_ec2InstanceId :: Lens' GatewayInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The state of the gateway.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>DISABLED</tt> | <tt>ACTIVE</tt>
gatewayInfo_gatewayOperationalState :: Lens' GatewayInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the gateway.
gatewayInfo_gatewayName :: Lens' GatewayInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier assigned to your gateway during activation. This
--   ID becomes part of the gateway Amazon Resource Name (ARN), which you
--   use as input for other operations.
gatewayInfo_gatewayId :: Lens' GatewayInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the gateway.
gatewayInfo_gatewayType :: Lens' GatewayInfo (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.GatewayInfo.GatewayInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.GatewayInfo.GatewayInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.GatewayInfo.GatewayInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.GatewayInfo.GatewayInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.GatewayInfo.GatewayInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.GatewayInfo.GatewayInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.GatewayInfo.GatewayInfo

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NFSFileShareDefaults

-- | Describes Network File System (NFS) file share default values. Files
--   and folders stored as Amazon S3 objects in S3 buckets don't, by
--   default, have Unix file permissions assigned to them. Upon discovery
--   in an S3 bucket by Storage Gateway, the S3 objects that represent
--   files and folders are assigned these default Unix permissions. This
--   operation is only supported for S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNFSFileShareDefaults</a> smart constructor.
data NFSFileShareDefaults
NFSFileShareDefaults' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> NFSFileShareDefaults

-- | The Unix file mode in the form "nnnn". For example, <tt>0666</tt>
--   represents the default file mode inside the file share. The default
--   value is <tt>0666</tt>.
[$sel:fileMode:NFSFileShareDefaults'] :: NFSFileShareDefaults -> Maybe Text

-- | The default owner ID for files in the file share (unless the files
--   have another owner ID specified). The default value is
--   <tt>nfsnobody</tt>.
[$sel:ownerId:NFSFileShareDefaults'] :: NFSFileShareDefaults -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Unix directory mode in the form "nnnn". For example, <tt>0666</tt>
--   represents the default access mode for all directories inside the file
--   share. The default value is <tt>0777</tt>.
[$sel:directoryMode:NFSFileShareDefaults'] :: NFSFileShareDefaults -> Maybe Text

-- | The default group ID for the file share (unless the files have another
--   group ID specified). The default value is <tt>nfsnobody</tt>.
[$sel:groupId:NFSFileShareDefaults'] :: NFSFileShareDefaults -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>NFSFileShareDefaults</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileMode:NFSFileShareDefaults'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareDefaults_fileMode</a> - The Unix file mode in the form
--   "nnnn". For example, <tt>0666</tt> represents the default file mode
--   inside the file share. The default value is <tt>0666</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ownerId:NFSFileShareDefaults'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareDefaults_ownerId</a> - The default owner ID for files
--   in the file share (unless the files have another owner ID specified).
--   The default value is <tt>nfsnobody</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:directoryMode:NFSFileShareDefaults'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareDefaults_directoryMode</a> - The Unix directory mode in
--   the form "nnnn". For example, <tt>0666</tt> represents the default
--   access mode for all directories inside the file share. The default
--   value is <tt>0777</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupId:NFSFileShareDefaults'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareDefaults_groupId</a> - The default group ID for the
--   file share (unless the files have another group ID specified). The
--   default value is <tt>nfsnobody</tt>.
newNFSFileShareDefaults :: NFSFileShareDefaults

-- | The Unix file mode in the form "nnnn". For example, <tt>0666</tt>
--   represents the default file mode inside the file share. The default
--   value is <tt>0666</tt>.
nFSFileShareDefaults_fileMode :: Lens' NFSFileShareDefaults (Maybe Text)

-- | The default owner ID for files in the file share (unless the files
--   have another owner ID specified). The default value is
--   <tt>nfsnobody</tt>.
nFSFileShareDefaults_ownerId :: Lens' NFSFileShareDefaults (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Unix directory mode in the form "nnnn". For example, <tt>0666</tt>
--   represents the default access mode for all directories inside the file
--   share. The default value is <tt>0777</tt>.
nFSFileShareDefaults_directoryMode :: Lens' NFSFileShareDefaults (Maybe Text)

-- | The default group ID for the file share (unless the files have another
--   group ID specified). The default value is <tt>nfsnobody</tt>.
nFSFileShareDefaults_groupId :: Lens' NFSFileShareDefaults (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NFSFileShareDefaults.NFSFileShareDefaults
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NFSFileShareDefaults.NFSFileShareDefaults
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NFSFileShareDefaults.NFSFileShareDefaults
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NFSFileShareDefaults.NFSFileShareDefaults
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NFSFileShareDefaults.NFSFileShareDefaults
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NFSFileShareDefaults.NFSFileShareDefaults
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NFSFileShareDefaults.NFSFileShareDefaults
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NFSFileShareDefaults.NFSFileShareDefaults


module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NetworkInterface

-- | Describes a gateway's network interface.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkInterface</a> smart constructor.
data NetworkInterface
NetworkInterface' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkInterface

-- | The Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) address of the interface.
--   <i>Currently not supported</i>.
[$sel:ipv6Address:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe Text

-- | The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the interface.
--   
--   This is currently unsupported and will not be returned in output.
[$sel:macAddress:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe Text

-- | The Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) address of the interface.
[$sel:ipv4Address:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkInterface</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipv6Address:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_ipv6Address</a> - The Internet Protocol version 6
--   (IPv6) address of the interface. <i>Currently not supported</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:macAddress:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_macAddress</a> - The Media Access Control (MAC)
--   address of the interface.
--   
--   This is currently unsupported and will not be returned in output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipv4Address:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_ipv4Address</a> - The Internet Protocol version 4
--   (IPv4) address of the interface.
newNetworkInterface :: NetworkInterface

-- | The Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) address of the interface.
--   <i>Currently not supported</i>.
networkInterface_ipv6Address :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the interface.
--   
--   This is currently unsupported and will not be returned in output.
networkInterface_macAddress :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) address of the interface.
networkInterface_ipv4Address :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NetworkInterface.NetworkInterface
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NetworkInterface.NetworkInterface
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NetworkInterface.NetworkInterface
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NetworkInterface.NetworkInterface
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NetworkInterface.NetworkInterface
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NetworkInterface.NetworkInterface
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NetworkInterface.NetworkInterface

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Tag

-- | A key-value pair that helps you manage, filter, and search for your
--   resource. Allowed characters: letters, white space, and numbers,
--   representable in UTF-8, and the following characters: + - = . _ : /.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Tag key. The key can't start with aws:.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Value of the tag key.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - Tag key. The key can't start
--   with aws:.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - Value of the tag key.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Tag key. The key can't start with aws:.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | Value of the tag key.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Tag.Tag


module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.SMBFileShareInfo

-- | The Windows file permissions and ownership information assigned, by
--   default, to native S3 objects when S3 File Gateway discovers them in
--   S3 buckets. This operation is only supported for S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMBFileShareInfo</a> smart constructor.
data SMBFileShareInfo
SMBFileShareInfo' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CacheAttributes -> Maybe ObjectACL -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CaseSensitivity -> Maybe [Tag] -> SMBFileShareInfo

-- | Indicates whether <tt>AccessBasedEnumeration</tt> is enabled.
[$sel:accessBasedEnumeration:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that have
--   administrator rights to the file share. A group must be prefixed with
--   the @ character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
[$sel:adminUserList:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for audit logs.
[$sel:auditDestinationARN:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:fileShareStatus:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are not allowed
--   to access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @
--   character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
[$sel:invalidUserList:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe [Text]
[$sel:kmsKey:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are allowed to
--   access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @ character.
--   Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>,
--   <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if
--   Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
[$sel:validUserList:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe [Text]
[$sel:gatewayARN:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The file share path used by the SMB client to identify the mount
--   point.
[$sel:path:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the DNS name for the VPC endpoint that the SMB file share
--   uses to connect to Amazon S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
[$sel:vPCEndpointDNSName:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:authentication:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Refresh cache information for the file share.
[$sel:cacheAttributes:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe CacheAttributes
[$sel:objectACL:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe ObjectACL

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:kmsEncrypted:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool
[$sel:fileShareId:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:fileShareARN:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
[$sel:defaultStorageClass:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
[$sel:fileShareName:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:role':SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, it indicates that access
--   control list (ACL) is enabled on the SMB file share. If it is set to
--   <tt>false</tt>, it indicates that file and directory permissions are
--   mapped to the POSIX permission.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Using Microsoft Windows ACLs to control
--   access to an SMB file share</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:sMBACLEnabled:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether opportunistic locking is enabled for the SMB file
--   share.
--   
--   Enabling opportunistic locking on case-sensitive shares is not
--   recommended for workloads that involve access to files with the same
--   name in different case.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:oplocksEnabled:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
[$sel:notificationPolicy:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:requesterPays:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool
[$sel:locationARN:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:readOnly:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the SMB file share stores
--   files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
[$sel:bucketRegion:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The case of an object name in an Amazon S3 bucket. For
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client determines the case sensitivity.
--   For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the gateway determines the case
--   sensitivity. The default value is <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
[$sel:caseSensitivity:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe CaseSensitivity

-- | A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the SMB file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair. For a
--   gateway with more than 10 tags assigned, you can view all tags using
--   the <tt>ListTagsForResource</tt> API operation.
[$sel:tags:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>SMBFileShareInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:accessBasedEnumeration:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,

--   <a>$sel:auditDestinationARN:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,

--   guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects based on file
--   extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable MIME type
--   guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value is
--   <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:readOnly:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_readOnly</a> - A value that sets the write status
--   of a file share. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to set the write
--   status to read-only, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketRegion:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_bucketRegion</a> - Specifies the Region of the S3
--   bucket where the SMB file share stores files.

--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.

--   <a>$sel:caseSensitivity:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_caseSensitivity</a> - The case of an object name
--   in an Amazon S3 bucket. For <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client
--   determines the case sensitivity. For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the
--   gateway determines the case sensitivity. The default value is
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>, <a>sMBFileShareInfo_tags</a> - A
--   list of up to 50 tags assigned to the SMB file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair. For a
--   gateway with more than 10 tags assigned, you can view all tags using
--   the <tt>ListTagsForResource</tt> API operation.
newSMBFileShareInfo :: SMBFileShareInfo

sMBFileShareInfo_accessBasedEnumeration :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

sMBFileShareInfo_caseSensitivity :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe CaseSensitivity)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the SMB file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair. For a
--   gateway with more than 10 tags assigned, you can view all tags using
--   the <tt>ListTagsForResource</tt> API operation.
sMBFileShareInfo_tags :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.SMBFileShareInfo.SMBFileShareInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.SMBFileShareInfo.SMBFileShareInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.SMBFileShareInfo.SMBFileShareInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.SMBFileShareInfo.SMBFileShareInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.SMBFileShareInfo.SMBFileShareInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.SMBFileShareInfo.SMBFileShareInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.SMBFileShareInfo.SMBFileShareInfo


module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.NFSFileShareInfo

-- | The Unix file permissions and ownership information assigned, by
--   default, to native S3 objects when an S3 File Gateway discovers them
--   in S3 buckets. This operation is only supported in S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNFSFileShareInfo</a> smart constructor.
data NFSFileShareInfo
NFSFileShareInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CacheAttributes -> Maybe ObjectACL -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> NFSFileShareInfo
[$sel:fileShareStatus:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:kmsKey:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:gatewayARN:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:path:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the DNS name for the VPC endpoint that the NFS file share
--   uses to connect to Amazon S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
[$sel:vPCEndpointDNSName:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Refresh cache information for the file share.
[$sel:cacheAttributes:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe CacheAttributes
[$sel:objectACL:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe ObjectACL

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:kmsEncrypted:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool
[$sel:fileShareId:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:fileShareARN:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
[$sel:defaultStorageClass:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
[$sel:fileShareName:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:role':NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
[$sel:notificationPolicy:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:squash:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:requesterPays:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool
[$sel:nFSFileShareDefaults:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults
[$sel:locationARN:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:clientList:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:readOnly:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the NFS file share stores
--   files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
[$sel:bucketRegion:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the NFS file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair. For a
--   gateway with more than 10 tags assigned, you can view all tags using
--   the <tt>ListTagsForResource</tt> API operation.
[$sel:tags:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>NFSFileShareInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationPolicy:NFSFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareInfo_notificationPolicy</a> - The notification policy

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.FileSystemAssociationInfo

-- | Describes the object returned by
--   <tt>DescribeFileSystemAssociations</tt> that describes a created file
--   system association.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFileSystemAssociationInfo</a> smart constructor.
data FileSystemAssociationInfo
FileSystemAssociationInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CacheAttributes -> Maybe EndpointNetworkConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> FileSystemAssociationInfo

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for the audit logs.
[$sel:auditDestinationARN:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file system association.
[$sel:fileSystemAssociationARN:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:gatewayARN:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:cacheAttributes:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe CacheAttributes

-- | Specifies network configuration information for the gateway associated
--   with the Amazon FSx file system.
--   
--   If multiple file systems are associated with this gateway, this
--   parameter's <tt>IpAddresses</tt> field is required.
[$sel:endpointNetworkConfiguration:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe EndpointNetworkConfiguration

-- | The ARN of the backend Amazon FSx file system used for storing file
--   data. For information, see <a>FileSystem</a> in the <i>Amazon FSx API
--   Reference</i>.
[$sel:locationARN:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the file system association. Valid Values:
--   <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> | <tt>CREATING</tt> | <tt>DELETING</tt> |
--   <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> | <tt>UPDATING</tt> | <tt>ERROR</tt>
[$sel:fileSystemAssociationStatus:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the SMB file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair.
[$sel:tags:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>FileSystemAssociationInfo</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:auditDestinationARN:FileSystemAssociationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>fileSystemAssociationInfo_auditDestinationARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for the audit logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileSystemAssociationARN:FileSystemAssociationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>fileSystemAssociationInfo_fileSystemAssociationARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the file system association.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:FileSystemAssociationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>fileSystemAssociationInfo_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheAttributes:FileSystemAssociationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>fileSystemAssociationInfo_cacheAttributes</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointNetworkConfiguration:FileSystemAssociationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>fileSystemAssociationInfo_endpointNetworkConfiguration</a> -
--   Specifies network configuration information for the gateway associated
--   with the Amazon FSx file system.
--   
--   If multiple file systems are associated with this gateway, this
--   parameter's <tt>IpAddresses</tt> field is required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:locationARN:FileSystemAssociationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>fileSystemAssociationInfo_locationARN</a> - The ARN of the backend
--   Amazon FSx file system used for storing file data. For information,
--   see <a>FileSystem</a> in the <i>Amazon FSx API Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileSystemAssociationStatus:FileSystemAssociationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>fileSystemAssociationInfo_fileSystemAssociationStatus</a> - The
--   status of the file system association. Valid Values:
--   <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> | <tt>CREATING</tt> | <tt>DELETING</tt> |
--   <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> | <tt>UPDATING</tt> | <tt>ERROR</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:FileSystemAssociationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>fileSystemAssociationInfo_tags</a> - A list of up to 50 tags
--   assigned to the SMB file share, sorted alphabetically by key name.
--   Each tag is a key-value pair.
newFileSystemAssociationInfo :: FileSystemAssociationInfo

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for the audit logs.
fileSystemAssociationInfo_auditDestinationARN :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file system association.
fileSystemAssociationInfo_fileSystemAssociationARN :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
fileSystemAssociationInfo_gatewayARN :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
fileSystemAssociationInfo_cacheAttributes :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe CacheAttributes)

-- | Specifies network configuration information for the gateway associated
--   with the Amazon FSx file system.
--   
--   If multiple file systems are associated with this gateway, this
--   parameter's <tt>IpAddresses</tt> field is required.
fileSystemAssociationInfo_endpointNetworkConfiguration :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe EndpointNetworkConfiguration)

-- | The ARN of the backend Amazon FSx file system used for storing file
--   data. For information, see <a>FileSystem</a> in the <i>Amazon FSx API
--   Reference</i>.
fileSystemAssociationInfo_locationARN :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the file system association. Valid Values:
--   <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> | <tt>CREATING</tt> | <tt>DELETING</tt> |
--   <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> | <tt>UPDATING</tt> | <tt>ERROR</tt>
fileSystemAssociationInfo_fileSystemAssociationStatus :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the SMB file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair.
fileSystemAssociationInfo_tags :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.FileSystemAssociationInfo.FileSystemAssociationInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.FileSystemAssociationInfo.FileSystemAssociationInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.FileSystemAssociationInfo.FileSystemAssociationInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.FileSystemAssociationInfo.FileSystemAssociationInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.FileSystemAssociationInfo.FileSystemAssociationInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.FileSystemAssociationInfo.FileSystemAssociationInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.FileSystemAssociationInfo.FileSystemAssociationInfo


module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.Tape

-- | Describes a virtual tape object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTape</a> smart constructor.
data Tape
Tape' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Tape

-- | The barcode that identifies a specific virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeBarcode:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of the virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeStatus:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Text
[$sel:kmsKey:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeARN:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Text

-- | For archiving virtual tapes, indicates how much data remains to be
--   uploaded before archiving is complete.
--   
--   Range: 0 (not started) to 100 (complete).
[$sel:progress:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Double

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tape capacity.
[$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Integer

-- | The virtual tape library (VTL) device that the virtual tape is
--   associated with.
[$sel:vTLDevice:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the pool that contains tapes that will be archived. The
--   tapes in this pool are archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
[$sel:poolId:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of data stored on the virtual tape.
--   
--   This value is not available for tapes created prior to May 13, 2015.
[$sel:tapeUsedInBytes:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date the virtual tape was created.
[$sel:tapeCreatedDate:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date that the tape enters a custom tape pool.
[$sel:poolEntryDate:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe POSIX

-- | If the tape is archived as write-once-read-many (WORM), this value is
--   <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:worm:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date that the tape is first archived with tape retention lock
--   enabled.
[$sel:retentionStartDate:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>Tape</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeBarcode:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_tapeBarcode</a> - The barcode
--   that identifies a specific virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeStatus:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_tapeStatus</a> - The current
--   state of the virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_kmsKey</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_tapeARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:progress:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_progress</a> - For archiving
--   virtual tapes, indicates how much data remains to be uploaded before
--   archiving is complete.
--   
--   Range: 0 (not started) to 100 (complete).
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_tapeSizeInBytes</a> - The
--   size, in bytes, of the virtual tape capacity.

--   library (VTL) device that the virtual tape is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolId:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_poolId</a> - The ID of the pool that
--   contains tapes that will be archived. The tapes in this pool are
--   archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with the pool.
--   When you use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is
--   archived directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier
--   Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeUsedInBytes:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_tapeUsedInBytes</a> - The
--   size, in bytes, of data stored on the virtual tape.
--   
--   This value is not available for tapes created prior to May 13, 2015.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeCreatedDate:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_tapeCreatedDate</a> - The
--   date the virtual tape was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolEntryDate:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_poolEntryDate</a> - The date
--   that the tape enters a custom tape pool.
--   
--   <a>$sel:worm:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_worm</a> - If the tape is archived as
--   write-once-read-many (WORM), this value is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionStartDate:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_retentionStartDate</a> -
--   The date that the tape is first archived with tape retention lock
--   enabled.
newTape :: Tape

-- | The current state of the virtual tape.
tape_tapeStatus :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
tape_kmsKey :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape.
tape_tapeARN :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Text)

-- | For archiving virtual tapes, indicates how much data remains to be
--   uploaded before archiving is complete.
--   
--   Range: 0 (not started) to 100 (complete).
tape_progress :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Double)

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tape capacity.
tape_tapeSizeInBytes :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Integer)

-- | The virtual tape library (VTL) device that the virtual tape is
--   associated with.
tape_vTLDevice :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the pool that contains tapes that will be archived. The
--   tapes in this pool are archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
tape_poolId :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of data stored on the virtual tape.
--   
--   This value is not available for tapes created prior to May 13, 2015.
tape_tapeUsedInBytes :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date the virtual tape was created.
tape_tapeCreatedDate :: Lens' Tape (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date that the tape enters a custom tape pool.
tape_poolEntryDate :: Lens' Tape (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If the tape is archived as write-once-read-many (WORM), this value is
--   <tt>true</tt>.
tape_worm :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date that the tape is first archived with tape retention lock
--   enabled.
tape_retentionStartDate :: Lens' Tape (Maybe UTCTime)

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.TapeArchive

-- | Represents a virtual tape that is archived in the virtual tape shelf
--   (VTS).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTapeArchive</a> smart constructor.
data TapeArchive
TapeArchive' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> TapeArchive

-- | The barcode that identifies the archived virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeBarcode:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of the archived virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeStatus:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Text
[$sel:kmsKey:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an archived virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeARN:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the archived virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Integer

-- | The time that the archiving of the virtual tape was completed.
--   
--   The default timestamp format is in the ISO8601 extended
--   YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
[$sel:completionTime:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ID of the pool that was used to archive the tape. The tapes in
--   this pool are archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with
--   the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
[$sel:poolId:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of data stored on the virtual tape.
--   
--   This value is not available for tapes created prior to May 13, 2015.
[$sel:tapeUsedInBytes:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date the virtual tape was created.
[$sel:tapeCreatedDate:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time that the tape entered the custom tape pool.
--   
--   The default timestamp format is in the ISO8601 extended
--   YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
[$sel:poolEntryDate:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> if the archived tape is stored as
--   write-once-read-many (WORM).
[$sel:worm:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Bool

-- | If the archived tape is subject to tape retention lock, the date that
--   the archived tape started being retained.
[$sel:retentionStartDate:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the tape gateway that the virtual
--   tape is being retrieved to.
--   
--   The virtual tape is retrieved from the virtual tape shelf (VTS).
[$sel:retrievedTo:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TapeArchive</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeBarcode:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_tapeBarcode</a> -
--   The barcode that identifies the archived virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeStatus:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_tapeStatus</a> -
--   The current state of the archived virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_kmsKey</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_tapeARN</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an archived virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:TapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>tapeArchive_tapeSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in bytes, of the
--   archived virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:TapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>tapeArchive_completionTime</a> - The time that the archiving of the
--   virtual tape was completed.
--   
--   The default timestamp format is in the ISO8601 extended
--   YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolId:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_poolId</a> - The ID of
--   the pool that was used to archive the tape. The tapes in this pool are
--   archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeUsedInBytes:TapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>tapeArchive_tapeUsedInBytes</a> - The size, in bytes, of data
--   stored on the virtual tape.
--   
--   This value is not available for tapes created prior to May 13, 2015.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeCreatedDate:TapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>tapeArchive_tapeCreatedDate</a> - The date the virtual tape was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolEntryDate:TapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>tapeArchive_poolEntryDate</a> - The time that the tape entered the
--   custom tape pool.
--   
--   The default timestamp format is in the ISO8601 extended
--   YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:worm:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_worm</a> - Set to
--   <tt>true</tt> if the archived tape is stored as write-once-read-many
--   (WORM).
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionStartDate:TapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>tapeArchive_retentionStartDate</a> - If the archived tape is
--   subject to tape retention lock, the date that the archived tape
--   started being retained.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retrievedTo:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_retrievedTo</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the tape gateway that the virtual
--   tape is being retrieved to.
--   
--   The virtual tape is retrieved from the virtual tape shelf (VTS).
newTapeArchive :: TapeArchive

-- | The barcode that identifies the archived virtual tape.
tapeArchive_tapeBarcode :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of the archived virtual tape.
tapeArchive_tapeStatus :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
tapeArchive_kmsKey :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an archived virtual tape.
tapeArchive_tapeARN :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of the archived virtual tape.
tapeArchive_tapeSizeInBytes :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time that the archiving of the virtual tape was completed.
--   
--   The default timestamp format is in the ISO8601 extended
--   YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
tapeArchive_completionTime :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the pool that was used to archive the tape. The tapes in
--   this pool are archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with
--   the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
tapeArchive_poolId :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of data stored on the virtual tape.
--   
--   This value is not available for tapes created prior to May 13, 2015.
tapeArchive_tapeUsedInBytes :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date the virtual tape was created.
tapeArchive_tapeCreatedDate :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time that the tape entered the custom tape pool.
--   
--   The default timestamp format is in the ISO8601 extended
--   YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
tapeArchive_poolEntryDate :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> if the archived tape is stored as
--   write-once-read-many (WORM).
tapeArchive_worm :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Bool)

-- | If the archived tape is subject to tape retention lock, the date that
--   the archived tape started being retained.
tapeArchive_retentionStartDate :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the tape gateway that the virtual
--   tape is being retrieved to.
--   
--   The virtual tape is retrieved from the virtual tape shelf (VTS).
tapeArchive_retrievedTo :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.TapeInfo

-- | Describes a virtual tape.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTapeInfo</a> smart constructor.
data TapeInfo
TapeInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> TapeInfo

-- | The barcode that identifies a specific virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeBarcode:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the tape.
[$sel:tapeStatus:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeARN:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways
--   operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
[$sel:gatewayARN:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of a virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe Integer

-- | The ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving.
--   The tape in this pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
[$sel:poolId:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The date that the tape entered the custom tape pool with tape
--   retention lock enabled.
[$sel:poolEntryDate:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date that the tape became subject to tape retention lock.
[$sel:retentionStartDate:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>TapeInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeBarcode:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_tapeBarcode</a> - The
--   barcode that identifies a specific virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeStatus:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_tapeStatus</a> - The
--   status of the tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_tapeARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of a virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_gatewayARN</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways
--   operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_tapeSizeInBytes</a>
--   - The size, in bytes, of a virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolId:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_poolId</a> - The ID of the
--   pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving. The tape in this
--   pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with the
--   pool. When you use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape
--   is archived directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier
--   Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolEntryDate:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_poolEntryDate</a> -
--   The date that the tape entered the custom tape pool with tape
--   retention lock enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionStartDate:TapeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>tapeInfo_retentionStartDate</a> - The date that the tape became
--   subject to tape retention lock.
newTapeInfo :: TapeInfo

-- | The barcode that identifies a specific virtual tape.
tapeInfo_tapeBarcode :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the tape.
tapeInfo_tapeStatus :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a virtual tape.
tapeInfo_tapeARN :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways
--   operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
tapeInfo_gatewayARN :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of a virtual tape.
tapeInfo_tapeSizeInBytes :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe Integer)

-- | The ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving.
--   The tape in this pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
tapeInfo_poolId :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The date that the tape entered the custom tape pool with tape
--   retention lock enabled.
tapeInfo_poolEntryDate :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date that the tape became subject to tape retention lock.
tapeInfo_retentionStartDate :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.TapeInfo.TapeInfo
