module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.TapeRecoveryPointInfo

-- | Describes a recovery point.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTapeRecoveryPointInfo</a> smart constructor.
data TapeRecoveryPointInfo
TapeRecoveryPointInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> TapeRecoveryPointInfo

-- | The status of the virtual tapes.
[$sel:tapeStatus:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'] :: TapeRecoveryPointInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The time when the point-in-time view of the virtual tape was
--   replicated for later recovery.
--   
--   The default timestamp format of the tape recovery point time is in the
--   ISO8601 extended YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
[$sel:tapeRecoveryPointTime:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'] :: TapeRecoveryPointInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeARN:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'] :: TapeRecoveryPointInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tapes to recover.
[$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'] :: TapeRecoveryPointInfo -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>TapeRecoveryPointInfo</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeStatus:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'</a>,
--   <a>tapeRecoveryPointInfo_tapeStatus</a> - The status of the virtual
--   tapes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeRecoveryPointTime:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'</a>,
--   <a>tapeRecoveryPointInfo_tapeRecoveryPointTime</a> - The time when the
--   point-in-time view of the virtual tape was replicated for later
--   recovery.
--   
--   The default timestamp format of the tape recovery point time is in the
--   ISO8601 extended YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'</a>,
--   <a>tapeRecoveryPointInfo_tapeARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'</a>,
--   <a>tapeRecoveryPointInfo_tapeSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in bytes, of
--   the virtual tapes to recover.
newTapeRecoveryPointInfo :: TapeRecoveryPointInfo

-- | The status of the virtual tapes.
tapeRecoveryPointInfo_tapeStatus :: Lens' TapeRecoveryPointInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The time when the point-in-time view of the virtual tape was
--   replicated for later recovery.
--   
--   The default timestamp format of the tape recovery point time is in the
--   ISO8601 extended YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
tapeRecoveryPointInfo_tapeRecoveryPointTime :: Lens' TapeRecoveryPointInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape.
tapeRecoveryPointInfo_tapeARN :: Lens' TapeRecoveryPointInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tapes to recover.
tapeRecoveryPointInfo_tapeSizeInBytes :: Lens' TapeRecoveryPointInfo (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.TapeRecoveryPointInfo.TapeRecoveryPointInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.TapeRecoveryPointInfo.TapeRecoveryPointInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.TapeRecoveryPointInfo.TapeRecoveryPointInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.TapeRecoveryPointInfo.TapeRecoveryPointInfo

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.PoolInfo

-- | Describes a custom tape pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPoolInfo</a> smart constructor.
data PoolInfo
PoolInfo' :: Maybe RetentionLockType -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TapeStorageClass -> Maybe PoolStatus -> Maybe Text -> PoolInfo

-- | Tape retention lock type, which can be configured in two modes. When
--   configured in governance mode, accounts with specific IAM permissions
--   are authorized to remove the tape retention lock from archived virtual
--   tapes. When configured in compliance mode, the tape retention lock
--   cannot be removed by any user, including the root account.
[$sel:retentionLockType:PoolInfo'] :: PoolInfo -> Maybe RetentionLockType

-- | Tape retention lock time is set in days. Tape retention lock can be
--   enabled for up to 100 years (36,500 days).
[$sel:retentionLockTimeInDays:PoolInfo'] :: PoolInfo -> Maybe Natural

-- | The name of the custom tape pool. <tt>PoolName</tt> can use all ASCII
--   characters, except '/' and '\'.
[$sel:poolName:PoolInfo'] :: PoolInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The storage class that is associated with the custom pool. When you
--   use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is archived
--   directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep
--   Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
[$sel:storageClass:PoolInfo'] :: PoolInfo -> Maybe TapeStorageClass

-- | Status of the custom tape pool. Pool can be <tt>ACTIVE</tt> or
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>.
[$sel:poolStatus:PoolInfo'] :: PoolInfo -> Maybe PoolStatus

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom tape pool. Use the
--   ListTapePools operation to return a list of custom tape pools for your
--   account and Region.
[$sel:poolARN:PoolInfo'] :: PoolInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PoolInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionLockType:PoolInfo'</a>,
--   <a>poolInfo_retentionLockType</a> - Tape retention lock type, which
--   can be configured in two modes. When configured in governance mode,
--   accounts with specific IAM permissions are authorized to remove the
--   tape retention lock from archived virtual tapes. When configured in
--   compliance mode, the tape retention lock cannot be removed by any
--   user, including the root account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionLockTimeInDays:PoolInfo'</a>,
--   <a>poolInfo_retentionLockTimeInDays</a> - Tape retention lock time is
--   set in days. Tape retention lock can be enabled for up to 100 years
--   (36,500 days).
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolName:PoolInfo'</a>, <a>poolInfo_poolName</a> - The name of
--   the custom tape pool. <tt>PoolName</tt> can use all ASCII characters,
--   except '/' and '\'.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:PoolInfo'</a>, <a>poolInfo_storageClass</a> - The
--   storage class that is associated with the custom pool. When you use
--   your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is archived
--   directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep
--   Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolStatus:PoolInfo'</a>, <a>poolInfo_poolStatus</a> - Status
--   of the custom tape pool. Pool can be <tt>ACTIVE</tt> or
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolARN:PoolInfo'</a>, <a>poolInfo_poolARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the custom tape pool. Use the ListTapePools
--   operation to return a list of custom tape pools for your account and
--   Region.
newPoolInfo :: PoolInfo

-- | Tape retention lock type, which can be configured in two modes. When
--   configured in governance mode, accounts with specific IAM permissions
--   are authorized to remove the tape retention lock from archived virtual
--   tapes. When configured in compliance mode, the tape retention lock
--   cannot be removed by any user, including the root account.
poolInfo_retentionLockType :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe RetentionLockType)

-- | Tape retention lock time is set in days. Tape retention lock can be
--   enabled for up to 100 years (36,500 days).
poolInfo_retentionLockTimeInDays :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe Natural)

-- | The name of the custom tape pool. <tt>PoolName</tt> can use all ASCII
--   characters, except '/' and '\'.
poolInfo_poolName :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The storage class that is associated with the custom pool. When you
--   use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is archived
--   directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep
--   Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
poolInfo_storageClass :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe TapeStorageClass)

-- | Status of the custom tape pool. Pool can be <tt>ACTIVE</tt> or
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>.
poolInfo_poolStatus :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe PoolStatus)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom tape pool. Use the
--   ListTapePools operation to return a list of custom tape pools for your
--   account and Region.
poolInfo_poolARN :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.PoolInfo.PoolInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.PoolInfo.PoolInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.PoolInfo.PoolInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.PoolInfo.PoolInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.PoolInfo.PoolInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.PoolInfo.PoolInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.PoolInfo.PoolInfo

data VTLDevice

[$sel:deviceiSCSIAttributes:VTLDevice'] :: VTLDevice -> Maybe DeviceiSCSIAttributes

--   emulates.

--   drive or media changer).

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.VolumeInfo

-- | Describes a storage volume object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeInfo</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeInfo
VolumeInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> VolumeInfo
[$sel:gatewayARN:VolumeInfo'] :: VolumeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | One of the VolumeStatus values that indicates the state of the storage
--   volume.
[$sel:volumeAttachmentStatus:VolumeInfo'] :: VolumeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the storage volume. For example,
--   the following is a valid ARN:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/volume/vol-1122AABB
--   </pre>
--   
--   Valid Values: 50 to 500 lowercase letters, numbers, periods (.), and
--   hyphens (-).
[$sel:volumeARN:VolumeInfo'] :: VolumeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The size of the volume in bytes.
--   
--   Valid Values: 50 to 500 lowercase letters, numbers, periods (.), and
--   hyphens (-).
[$sel:volumeSizeInBytes:VolumeInfo'] :: VolumeInfo -> Maybe Integer

-- | The unique identifier assigned to the volume. This ID becomes part of
--   the volume Amazon Resource Name (ARN), which you use as input for
--   other operations.
--   
--   Valid Values: 50 to 500 lowercase letters, numbers, periods (.), and
--   hyphens (-).
[$sel:volumeId:VolumeInfo'] :: VolumeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier assigned to your gateway during activation. This
--   ID becomes part of the gateway Amazon Resource Name (ARN), which you
--   use as input for other operations.
--   
--   Valid Values: 50 to 500 lowercase letters, numbers, periods (.), and
--   hyphens (-).
[$sel:gatewayId:VolumeInfo'] :: VolumeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | One of the VolumeType enumeration values describing the type of the
--   volume.
[$sel:volumeType:VolumeInfo'] :: VolumeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding

--   <a>$sel:volumeARN:VolumeInfo'</a>, <a>volumeInfo_volumeARN</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the storage volume. For example, the
--   following is a valid ARN:
--

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.VolumeRecoveryPointInfo

-- | Describes a storage volume recovery point object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeRecoveryPointInfo</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeRecoveryPointInfo
VolumeRecoveryPointInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> VolumeRecoveryPointInfo

-- | The time the recovery point was taken.
[$sel:volumeRecoveryPointTime:VolumeRecoveryPointInfo'] :: VolumeRecoveryPointInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume target.
[$sel:volumeARN:VolumeRecoveryPointInfo'] :: VolumeRecoveryPointInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The size of the volume in bytes.
[$sel:volumeSizeInBytes:VolumeRecoveryPointInfo'] :: VolumeRecoveryPointInfo -> Maybe Integer

-- | The size of the data stored on the volume in bytes.
--   
--   This value is not available for volumes created prior to May 13, 2015,
--   until you store data on the volume.
[$sel:volumeUsageInBytes:VolumeRecoveryPointInfo'] :: VolumeRecoveryPointInfo -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeRecoveryPointInfo</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeRecoveryPointTime:VolumeRecoveryPointInfo'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecoveryPointInfo_volumeRecoveryPointTime</a> - The time the
--   recovery point was taken.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeARN:VolumeRecoveryPointInfo'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecoveryPointInfo_volumeARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the volume target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeSizeInBytes:VolumeRecoveryPointInfo'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecoveryPointInfo_volumeSizeInBytes</a> - The size of the
--   volume in bytes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeUsageInBytes:VolumeRecoveryPointInfo'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecoveryPointInfo_volumeUsageInBytes</a> - The size of the
--   data stored on the volume in bytes.
--   
--   This value is not available for volumes created prior to May 13, 2015,
--   until you store data on the volume.
newVolumeRecoveryPointInfo :: VolumeRecoveryPointInfo

-- | The time the recovery point was taken.
volumeRecoveryPointInfo_volumeRecoveryPointTime :: Lens' VolumeRecoveryPointInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume target.
volumeRecoveryPointInfo_volumeARN :: Lens' VolumeRecoveryPointInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the volume in bytes.
volumeRecoveryPointInfo_volumeSizeInBytes :: Lens' VolumeRecoveryPointInfo (Maybe Integer)

-- | The size of the data stored on the volume in bytes.
--   
--   This value is not available for volumes created prior to May 13, 2015,
--   until you store data on the volume.
volumeRecoveryPointInfo_volumeUsageInBytes :: Lens' VolumeRecoveryPointInfo (Maybe Integer)

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.VolumeiSCSIAttributes

-- | Lists iSCSI information about a volume.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeiSCSIAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeiSCSIAttributes
VolumeiSCSIAttributes' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> VolumeiSCSIAttributes

-- | The logical disk number.
[$sel:lunNumber:VolumeiSCSIAttributes'] :: VolumeiSCSIAttributes -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume target.
[$sel:targetARN:VolumeiSCSIAttributes'] :: VolumeiSCSIAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether mutual CHAP is enabled for the iSCSI target.
[$sel:chapEnabled:VolumeiSCSIAttributes'] :: VolumeiSCSIAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | The network interface identifier.
[$sel:networkInterfaceId:VolumeiSCSIAttributes'] :: VolumeiSCSIAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The port used to communicate with iSCSI targets.
[$sel:networkInterfacePort:VolumeiSCSIAttributes'] :: VolumeiSCSIAttributes -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeiSCSIAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lunNumber:VolumeiSCSIAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>volumeiSCSIAttributes_lunNumber</a> - The logical disk number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetARN:VolumeiSCSIAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>volumeiSCSIAttributes_targetARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the volume target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:chapEnabled:VolumeiSCSIAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>volumeiSCSIAttributes_chapEnabled</a> - Indicates whether mutual
--   CHAP is enabled for the iSCSI target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInterfaceId:VolumeiSCSIAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>volumeiSCSIAttributes_networkInterfaceId</a> - The network
--   interface identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInterfacePort:VolumeiSCSIAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>volumeiSCSIAttributes_networkInterfacePort</a> - The port used to
--   communicate with iSCSI targets.
newVolumeiSCSIAttributes :: VolumeiSCSIAttributes

-- | The logical disk number.
volumeiSCSIAttributes_lunNumber :: Lens' VolumeiSCSIAttributes (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume target.
volumeiSCSIAttributes_targetARN :: Lens' VolumeiSCSIAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether mutual CHAP is enabled for the iSCSI target.
volumeiSCSIAttributes_chapEnabled :: Lens' VolumeiSCSIAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | The network interface identifier.
volumeiSCSIAttributes_networkInterfaceId :: Lens' VolumeiSCSIAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The port used to communicate with iSCSI targets.
volumeiSCSIAttributes_networkInterfacePort :: Lens' VolumeiSCSIAttributes (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.VolumeiSCSIAttributes.VolumeiSCSIAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.VolumeiSCSIAttributes.VolumeiSCSIAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.VolumeiSCSIAttributes.VolumeiSCSIAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.VolumeiSCSIAttributes.VolumeiSCSIAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.VolumeiSCSIAttributes.VolumeiSCSIAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.VolumeiSCSIAttributes.VolumeiSCSIAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.VolumeiSCSIAttributes.VolumeiSCSIAttributes


module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.StorediSCSIVolume

-- | Describes an iSCSI stored volume.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStorediSCSIVolume</a> smart constructor.
data StorediSCSIVolume
StorediSCSIVolume' :: Maybe VolumeiSCSIAttributes -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StorediSCSIVolume

-- | An VolumeiSCSIAttributes object that represents a collection of iSCSI
--   attributes for one stored volume.
[$sel:volumeiSCSIAttributes:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe VolumeiSCSIAttributes

-- | One of the VolumeStatus values that indicates the state of the storage
--   volume.
[$sel:volumeStatus:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | If the stored volume was created from a snapshot, this field contains
--   the snapshot ID used, e.g. snap-78e22663. Otherwise, this field is not
--   included.
[$sel:sourceSnapshotId:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates if when the stored volume was created, existing data on the
--   underlying local disk was preserved.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:preservedExistingData:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Bool
[$sel:kmsKey:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that indicates whether a storage volume is attached to,
--   detached from, or is in the process of detaching from a gateway. For
--   more information, see <a>Moving your volumes to a different
--   gateway</a>.
[$sel:volumeAttachmentStatus:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage volume.
[$sel:volumeARN:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | Represents the percentage complete if the volume is restoring or
--   bootstrapping that represents the percent of data transferred. This
--   field does not appear in the response if the stored volume is not
--   restoring or bootstrapping.
[$sel:volumeProgress:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Double

-- | The size of the volume in bytes.
[$sel:volumeSizeInBytes:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Integer

-- | The size of the data stored on the volume in bytes. This value is
--   calculated based on the number of blocks that are touched, instead of
--   the actual amount of data written. This value can be useful for
--   sequential write patterns but less accurate for random write patterns.
--   <tt>VolumeUsedInBytes</tt> is different from the compressed size of
--   the volume, which is the value that is used to calculate your bill.
--   
--   This value is not available for volumes created prior to May 13, 2015,
--   until you store data on the volume.
[$sel:volumeUsedInBytes:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date the volume was created. Volumes created prior to March 28,
--   2017 dont have this timestamp.
[$sel:createdDate:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique identifier of the volume, e.g., vol-AE4B946D.
[$sel:volumeId:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the local disk that was specified in the
--   CreateStorediSCSIVolume operation.
[$sel:volumeDiskId:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | One of the VolumeType enumeration values describing the type of the
--   volume.
[$sel:volumeType:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
[$sel:targetName:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StorediSCSIVolume</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   VolumeiSCSIAttributes object that represents a collection of iSCSI

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCachediSCSIVolume</a> smart constructor.
data CachediSCSIVolume

-- | An VolumeiSCSIAttributes object that represents a collection of iSCSI
--   attributes for one stored volume.
[$sel:volumeiSCSIAttributes:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe VolumeiSCSIAttributes

--   volume.

--   the snapshot ID used, e.g., snap-78e22663. Otherwise, this field is
--   not included.
[$sel:sourceSnapshotId:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

--   bootstrapping that represents the percent of data transferred. This
--   field does not appear in the response if the cached volume is not
--   restoring or bootstrapping.
[$sel:volumeProgress:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Double

-- | The size, in bytes, of the volume capacity.
[$sel:volumeSizeInBytes:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Integer

-- | The size of the data stored on the volume in bytes. This value is
--   calculated based on the number of blocks that are touched, instead of
--   the actual amount of data written. This value can be useful for
--   sequential write patterns but less accurate for random write patterns.
--   <tt>VolumeUsedInBytes</tt> is different from the compressed size of
--   the volume, which is the value that is used to calculate your bill.

cachediSCSIVolume_volumeARN :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | Represents the percentage complete if the volume is restoring or
--   bootstrapping that represents the percent of data transferred. This
--   field does not appear in the response if the cached volume is not
--   restoring or bootstrapping.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeProgress :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Double)

-- | The size, in bytes, of the volume capacity.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeSizeInBytes :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Integer)

-- | The size of the data stored on the volume in bytes. This value is
--   calculated based on the number of blocks that are touched, instead of
--   the actual amount of data written. This value can be useful for
--   sequential write patterns but less accurate for random write patterns.
--   <tt>VolumeUsedInBytes</tt> is different from the compressed size of
--   the volume, which is the value that is used to calculate your bill.
--   
--   This value is not available for volumes created prior to May 13, 2015,
--   until you store data on the volume.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeUsedInBytes :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date the volume was created. Volumes created prior to March 28,
--   2017 dont have this timestamp.
cachediSCSIVolume_createdDate :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique identifier of the volume, e.g., vol-AE4B946D.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeId :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | One of the VolumeType enumeration values that describes the type of
--   the volume.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeType :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
cachediSCSIVolume_targetName :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.CachediSCSIVolume.CachediSCSIVolume
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.CachediSCSIVolume.CachediSCSIVolume
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.CachediSCSIVolume.CachediSCSIVolume
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.CachediSCSIVolume.CachediSCSIVolume
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.CachediSCSIVolume.CachediSCSIVolume
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.CachediSCSIVolume.CachediSCSIVolume
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Types.CachediSCSIVolume.CachediSCSIVolume

--   information, see the error and message fields.

-- | Information about the gateway's automatic tape creation policies,
--   including the automatic tape creation rules and the gateway that is
--   using the policies.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo
AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty AutomaticTapeCreationRule) -> AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo
[$sel:gatewayARN:AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo'] :: AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | An automatic tape creation policy consists of a list of automatic tape
--   creation rules. This returns the rules that determine when and how to
--   automatically create new tapes.
[$sel:automaticTapeCreationRules:AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo'] :: AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo -> Maybe (NonEmpty AutomaticTapeCreationRule)

-- | Create a value of <a>AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>automaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:automaticTapeCreationRules:AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>automaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo_automaticTapeCreationRules</a> - An
--   automatic tape creation policy consists of a list of automatic tape
--   creation rules. This returns the rules that determine when and how to
--   automatically create new tapes.
newAutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo :: AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo

-- | Undocumented member.
automaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo_gatewayARN :: Lens' AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | An automatic tape creation policy consists of a list of automatic tape
--   creation rules. This returns the rules that determine when and how to
--   automatically create new tapes.
automaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo_automaticTapeCreationRules :: Lens' AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo (Maybe (NonEmpty AutomaticTapeCreationRule))

-- | An automatic tape creation policy consists of automatic tape creation
--   rules where each rule defines when and how to create new tapes. For
--   more information about automatic tape creation, see <a>Creating Tapes
--   Automatically</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutomaticTapeCreationRule</a> smart constructor.
data AutomaticTapeCreationRule
AutomaticTapeCreationRule' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> Integer -> Natural -> AutomaticTapeCreationRule

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to indicate that tapes are to be archived as
--   write-once-read-many (WORM). Set to <tt>false</tt> when WORM is not
--   enabled for tapes.
[$sel:worm:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'] :: AutomaticTapeCreationRule -> Maybe Bool

-- | A prefix that you append to the barcode of the virtual tape that you
--   are creating. This prefix makes the barcode unique.
--   
--   The prefix must be 1-4 characters in length and must be one of the
--   uppercase letters from A to Z.
[$sel:tapeBarcodePrefix:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'] :: AutomaticTapeCreationRule -> Text

-- | The ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving.
--   The tape in this pool is archived in the Amazon S3 storage class that
--   is associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
[$sel:poolId:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'] :: AutomaticTapeCreationRule -> Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tape capacity.
[$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'] :: AutomaticTapeCreationRule -> Integer

-- | The minimum number of available virtual tapes that the gateway
--   maintains at all times. If the number of tapes on the gateway goes
--   below this value, the gateway creates as many new tapes as are needed
--   to have <tt>MinimumNumTapes</tt> on the gateway. For more information
--   about automatic tape creation, see <a>Creating Tapes
--   Automatically</a>.
[$sel:minimumNumTapes:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'] :: AutomaticTapeCreationRule -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AutomaticTapeCreationRule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:worm:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'</a>,
--   <a>automaticTapeCreationRule_worm</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt> to
--   indicate that tapes are to be archived as write-once-read-many (WORM).
--   Set to <tt>false</tt> when WORM is not enabled for tapes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeBarcodePrefix:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'</a>,
--   <a>automaticTapeCreationRule_tapeBarcodePrefix</a> - A prefix that you
--   append to the barcode of the virtual tape that you are creating. This
--   prefix makes the barcode unique.
--   
--   The prefix must be 1-4 characters in length and must be one of the
--   uppercase letters from A to Z.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolId:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'</a>,
--   <a>automaticTapeCreationRule_poolId</a> - The ID of the pool that you
--   want to add your tape to for archiving. The tape in this pool is
--   archived in the Amazon S3 storage class that is associated with the
--   pool. When you use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape
--   is archived directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier
--   Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'</a>,
--   <a>automaticTapeCreationRule_tapeSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in bytes,
--   of the virtual tape capacity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimumNumTapes:AutomaticTapeCreationRule'</a>,
--   <a>automaticTapeCreationRule_minimumNumTapes</a> - The minimum number
--   of available virtual tapes that the gateway maintains at all times. If
--   the number of tapes on the gateway goes below this value, the gateway
--   creates as many new tapes as are needed to have
--   <tt>MinimumNumTapes</tt> on the gateway. For more information about
--   automatic tape creation, see <a>Creating Tapes Automatically</a>.
newAutomaticTapeCreationRule :: Text -> Text -> Integer -> Natural -> AutomaticTapeCreationRule

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to indicate that tapes are to be archived as
--   write-once-read-many (WORM). Set to <tt>false</tt> when WORM is not
--   enabled for tapes.
automaticTapeCreationRule_worm :: Lens' AutomaticTapeCreationRule (Maybe Bool)

-- | A prefix that you append to the barcode of the virtual tape that you
--   are creating. This prefix makes the barcode unique.
--   
--   The prefix must be 1-4 characters in length and must be one of the
--   uppercase letters from A to Z.
automaticTapeCreationRule_tapeBarcodePrefix :: Lens' AutomaticTapeCreationRule Text

-- | The ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving.
--   The tape in this pool is archived in the Amazon S3 storage class that
--   is associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
automaticTapeCreationRule_poolId :: Lens' AutomaticTapeCreationRule Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tape capacity.
automaticTapeCreationRule_tapeSizeInBytes :: Lens' AutomaticTapeCreationRule Integer

-- | The minimum number of available virtual tapes that the gateway
--   maintains at all times. If the number of tapes on the gateway goes
--   below this value, the gateway creates as many new tapes as are needed
--   to have <tt>MinimumNumTapes</tt> on the gateway. For more information
--   about automatic tape creation, see <a>Creating Tapes
--   Automatically</a>.
automaticTapeCreationRule_minimumNumTapes :: Lens' AutomaticTapeCreationRule Natural

-- | Describes a bandwidth rate limit interval for a gateway. A bandwidth
--   rate limit schedule consists of one or more bandwidth rate limit
--   intervals. A bandwidth rate limit interval defines a period of time on
--   one or more days of the week, during which bandwidth rate limits are
--   specified for uploading, downloading, or both.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBandwidthRateLimitInterval</a> smart constructor.
data BandwidthRateLimitInterval
BandwidthRateLimitInterval' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> NonEmpty Natural -> BandwidthRateLimitInterval

-- | The average upload rate limit component of the bandwidth rate limit
--   interval, in bits per second. This field does not appear in the
--   response if the upload rate limit is not set.
[$sel:averageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> Maybe Natural

-- | The average download rate limit component of the bandwidth rate limit
--   interval, in bits per second. This field does not appear in the
--   response if the download rate limit is not set.
[$sel:averageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> Maybe Natural

-- | The hour of the day to start the bandwidth rate limit interval.
[$sel:startHourOfDay:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> Natural

-- | The minute of the hour to start the bandwidth rate limit interval. The
--   interval begins at the start of that minute. To begin an interval
--   exactly at the start of the hour, use the value <tt>0</tt>.
[$sel:startMinuteOfHour:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> Natural

-- | The hour of the day to end the bandwidth rate limit interval.
[$sel:endHourOfDay:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> Natural

-- | The minute of the hour to end the bandwidth rate limit interval.
--   
--   The bandwidth rate limit interval ends at the end of the minute. To
--   end an interval at the end of an hour, use the value <tt>59</tt>.
[$sel:endMinuteOfHour:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> Natural

-- | The days of the week component of the bandwidth rate limit interval,
--   represented as ordinal numbers from 0 to 6, where 0 represents Sunday
--   and 6 represents Saturday.
[$sel:daysOfWeek:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'] :: BandwidthRateLimitInterval -> NonEmpty Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>BandwidthRateLimitInterval</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:averageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'</a>,

--   The average upload rate limit component of the bandwidth rate limit
--   interval, in bits per second. This field does not appear in the
--   response if the upload rate limit is not set.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:averageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'</a>,
--   <a>bandwidthRateLimitInterval_averageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec</a>
--   - The average download rate limit component of the bandwidth rate
--   limit interval, in bits per second. This field does not appear in the
--   response if the download rate limit is not set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startHourOfDay:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'</a>,
--   <a>bandwidthRateLimitInterval_startHourOfDay</a> - The hour of the day
--   to start the bandwidth rate limit interval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startMinuteOfHour:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'</a>,
--   <a>bandwidthRateLimitInterval_startMinuteOfHour</a> - The minute of
--   the hour to start the bandwidth rate limit interval. The interval
--   begins at the start of that minute. To begin an interval exactly at
--   the start of the hour, use the value <tt>0</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endHourOfDay:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'</a>,
--   <a>bandwidthRateLimitInterval_endHourOfDay</a> - The hour of the day
--   to end the bandwidth rate limit interval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endMinuteOfHour:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'</a>,
--   <a>bandwidthRateLimitInterval_endMinuteOfHour</a> - The minute of the
--   hour to end the bandwidth rate limit interval.
--   
--   The bandwidth rate limit interval ends at the end of the minute. To
--   end an interval at the end of an hour, use the value <tt>59</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:daysOfWeek:BandwidthRateLimitInterval'</a>,
--   <a>bandwidthRateLimitInterval_daysOfWeek</a> - The days of the week
--   component of the bandwidth rate limit interval, represented as ordinal
--   numbers from 0 to 6, where 0 represents Sunday and 6 represents
--   Saturday.
newBandwidthRateLimitInterval :: Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> NonEmpty Natural -> BandwidthRateLimitInterval

-- | The average upload rate limit component of the bandwidth rate limit
--   interval, in bits per second. This field does not appear in the
--   response if the upload rate limit is not set.
bandwidthRateLimitInterval_averageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec :: Lens' BandwidthRateLimitInterval (Maybe Natural)

--   interval, in bits per second. This field does not appear in the
--   response if the download rate limit is not set.
bandwidthRateLimitInterval_averageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec :: Lens' BandwidthRateLimitInterval (Maybe Natural)

bandwidthRateLimitInterval_daysOfWeek :: Lens' BandwidthRateLimitInterval (NonEmpty Natural)

-- | The refresh cache information for the file share or FSx file systems.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCacheAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data CacheAttributes
CacheAttributes' :: Maybe Int -> CacheAttributes

-- | Refreshes a file share's cache by using Time To Live (TTL). TTL is the
--   length of time since the last refresh after which access to the
--   directory would cause the file gateway to first refresh that
--   directory's contents from the Amazon S3 bucket or Amazon FSx file
--   system. The TTL duration is in seconds.
--   
--   Valid Values:0, 300 to 2,592,000 seconds (5 minutes to 30 days)
[$sel:cacheStaleTimeoutInSeconds:CacheAttributes'] :: CacheAttributes -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CacheAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheStaleTimeoutInSeconds:CacheAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>cacheAttributes_cacheStaleTimeoutInSeconds</a> - Refreshes a file
--   share's cache by using Time To Live (TTL). TTL is the length of time
--   since the last refresh after which access to the directory would cause
--   the file gateway to first refresh that directory's contents from the
--   Amazon S3 bucket or Amazon FSx file system. The TTL duration is in
--   seconds.
--   
--   Valid Values:0, 300 to 2,592,000 seconds (5 minutes to 30 days)
newCacheAttributes :: CacheAttributes

-- | Refreshes a file share's cache by using Time To Live (TTL). TTL is the
--   length of time since the last refresh after which access to the
--   directory would cause the file gateway to first refresh that
--   directory's contents from the Amazon S3 bucket or Amazon FSx file
--   system. The TTL duration is in seconds.
--   
--   Valid Values:0, 300 to 2,592,000 seconds (5 minutes to 30 days)
cacheAttributes_cacheStaleTimeoutInSeconds :: Lens' CacheAttributes (Maybe Int)

-- | Describes an iSCSI cached volume.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCachediSCSIVolume</a> smart constructor.
data CachediSCSIVolume
CachediSCSIVolume' :: Maybe VolumeiSCSIAttributes -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CachediSCSIVolume

-- | An VolumeiSCSIAttributes object that represents a collection of iSCSI
--   attributes for one stored volume.
[$sel:volumeiSCSIAttributes:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe VolumeiSCSIAttributes

-- | One of the VolumeStatus values that indicates the state of the storage
--   volume.
[$sel:volumeStatus:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | If the cached volume was created from a snapshot, this field contains
--   the snapshot ID used, e.g., snap-78e22663. Otherwise, this field is
--   not included.
[$sel:sourceSnapshotId:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text
[$sel:kmsKey:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that indicates whether a storage volume is attached to or
--   detached from a gateway. For more information, see <a>Moving your
--   volumes to a different gateway</a>.
[$sel:volumeAttachmentStatus:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage volume.
[$sel:volumeARN:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | Represents the percentage complete if the volume is restoring or
--   bootstrapping that represents the percent of data transferred. This
--   field does not appear in the response if the cached volume is not
--   restoring or bootstrapping.
[$sel:volumeProgress:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Double

-- | The size, in bytes, of the volume capacity.
[$sel:volumeSizeInBytes:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Integer

-- | The size of the data stored on the volume in bytes. This value is
--   calculated based on the number of blocks that are touched, instead of
--   the actual amount of data written. This value can be useful for
--   sequential write patterns but less accurate for random write patterns.
--   <tt>VolumeUsedInBytes</tt> is different from the compressed size of
--   the volume, which is the value that is used to calculate your bill.
--   
--   This value is not available for volumes created prior to May 13, 2015,
--   until you store data on the volume.
[$sel:volumeUsedInBytes:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date the volume was created. Volumes created prior to March 28,
--   2017 dont have this timestamp.
[$sel:createdDate:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique identifier of the volume, e.g., vol-AE4B946D.
[$sel:volumeId:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | One of the VolumeType enumeration values that describes the type of
--   the volume.
[$sel:volumeType:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
[$sel:targetName:CachediSCSIVolume'] :: CachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CachediSCSIVolume</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeiSCSIAttributes:CachediSCSIVolume'</a>,
--   <a>cachediSCSIVolume_volumeiSCSIAttributes</a> - An
--   VolumeiSCSIAttributes object that represents a collection of iSCSI
--   attributes for one stored volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeStatus:CachediSCSIVolume'</a>,
--   <a>cachediSCSIVolume_volumeStatus</a> - One of the VolumeStatus values
--   that indicates the state of the storage volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceSnapshotId:CachediSCSIVolume'</a>,
--   <a>cachediSCSIVolume_sourceSnapshotId</a> - If the cached volume was
--   created from a snapshot, this field contains the snapshot ID used,
--   e.g., snap-78e22663. Otherwise, this field is not included.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:CachediSCSIVolume'</a>, <a>cachediSCSIVolume_kmsKey</a>
--   - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeAttachmentStatus:CachediSCSIVolume'</a>,
--   <a>cachediSCSIVolume_volumeAttachmentStatus</a> - A value that
--   indicates whether a storage volume is attached to or detached from a
--   gateway. For more information, see <a>Moving your volumes to a
--   different gateway</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeARN:CachediSCSIVolume'</a>,
--   <a>cachediSCSIVolume_volumeARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the storage volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeProgress:CachediSCSIVolume'</a>,
--   <a>cachediSCSIVolume_volumeProgress</a> - Represents the percentage
--   complete if the volume is restoring or bootstrapping that represents
--   the percent of data transferred. This field does not appear in the
--   response if the cached volume is not restoring or bootstrapping.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeSizeInBytes:CachediSCSIVolume'</a>,
--   <a>cachediSCSIVolume_volumeSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in bytes, of
--   the volume capacity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeUsedInBytes:CachediSCSIVolume'</a>,
--   <a>cachediSCSIVolume_volumeUsedInBytes</a> - The size of the data
--   stored on the volume in bytes. This value is calculated based on the
--   number of blocks that are touched, instead of the actual amount of
--   data written. This value can be useful for sequential write patterns
--   but less accurate for random write patterns.
--   <tt>VolumeUsedInBytes</tt> is different from the compressed size of
--   the volume, which is the value that is used to calculate your bill.
--   
--   This value is not available for volumes created prior to May 13, 2015,
--   until you store data on the volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdDate:CachediSCSIVolume'</a>,
--   <a>cachediSCSIVolume_createdDate</a> - The date the volume was
--   created. Volumes created prior to March 28, 2017 dont have this
--   timestamp.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeId:CachediSCSIVolume'</a>,
--   <a>cachediSCSIVolume_volumeId</a> - The unique identifier of the
--   volume, e.g., vol-AE4B946D.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:CachediSCSIVolume'</a>,
--   <a>cachediSCSIVolume_volumeType</a> - One of the VolumeType
--   enumeration values that describes the type of the volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetName:CachediSCSIVolume'</a>,
--   <a>cachediSCSIVolume_targetName</a> - The name of the iSCSI target
--   used by an initiator to connect to a volume and used as a suffix for
--   the target ARN. For example, specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as
--   <i>myvolume</i> results in the target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
newCachediSCSIVolume :: CachediSCSIVolume

-- | An VolumeiSCSIAttributes object that represents a collection of iSCSI
--   attributes for one stored volume.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeiSCSIAttributes :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe VolumeiSCSIAttributes)

-- | One of the VolumeStatus values that indicates the state of the storage
--   volume.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeStatus :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | If the cached volume was created from a snapshot, this field contains
--   the snapshot ID used, e.g., snap-78e22663. Otherwise, this field is
--   not included.
cachediSCSIVolume_sourceSnapshotId :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
cachediSCSIVolume_kmsKey :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that indicates whether a storage volume is attached to or
--   detached from a gateway. For more information, see <a>Moving your
--   volumes to a different gateway</a>.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeAttachmentStatus :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage volume.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeARN :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | Represents the percentage complete if the volume is restoring or
--   bootstrapping that represents the percent of data transferred. This
--   field does not appear in the response if the cached volume is not
--   restoring or bootstrapping.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeProgress :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Double)

-- | The size, in bytes, of the volume capacity.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeSizeInBytes :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Integer)

-- | The size of the data stored on the volume in bytes. This value is
--   calculated based on the number of blocks that are touched, instead of
--   the actual amount of data written. This value can be useful for
--   sequential write patterns but less accurate for random write patterns.
--   <tt>VolumeUsedInBytes</tt> is different from the compressed size of
--   the volume, which is the value that is used to calculate your bill.
--   
--   This value is not available for volumes created prior to May 13, 2015,
--   until you store data on the volume.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeUsedInBytes :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date the volume was created. Volumes created prior to March 28,
--   2017 dont have this timestamp.
cachediSCSIVolume_createdDate :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique identifier of the volume, e.g., vol-AE4B946D.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeId :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | One of the VolumeType enumeration values that describes the type of
--   the volume.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeType :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
cachediSCSIVolume_targetName :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP)
--   information that supports authentication between your gateway and
--   iSCSI initiators.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChapInfo</a> smart constructor.
data ChapInfo
ChapInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> ChapInfo

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume.
--   
--   Valid Values: 50 to 500 lowercase letters, numbers, periods (.), and
--   hyphens (-).
[$sel:targetARN:ChapInfo'] :: ChapInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The secret key that the initiator (for example, the Windows client)
--   must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the target.
[$sel:secretToAuthenticateInitiator:ChapInfo'] :: ChapInfo -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The iSCSI initiator that connects to the target.
[$sel:initiatorName:ChapInfo'] :: ChapInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The secret key that the target must provide to participate in mutual
--   CHAP with the initiator (e.g., Windows client).
[$sel:secretToAuthenticateTarget:ChapInfo'] :: ChapInfo -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>ChapInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetARN:ChapInfo'</a>, <a>chapInfo_targetARN</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume.
--   
--   Valid Values: 50 to 500 lowercase letters, numbers, periods (.), and
--   hyphens (-).
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretToAuthenticateInitiator:ChapInfo'</a>,
--   <a>chapInfo_secretToAuthenticateInitiator</a> - The secret key that
--   the initiator (for example, the Windows client) must provide to
--   participate in mutual CHAP with the target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:initiatorName:ChapInfo'</a>, <a>chapInfo_initiatorName</a> -
--   The iSCSI initiator that connects to the target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretToAuthenticateTarget:ChapInfo'</a>,
--   <a>chapInfo_secretToAuthenticateTarget</a> - The secret key that the
--   target must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the initiator
--   (e.g., Windows client).
newChapInfo :: ChapInfo

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume.
--   
--   Valid Values: 50 to 500 lowercase letters, numbers, periods (.), and
--   hyphens (-).
chapInfo_targetARN :: Lens' ChapInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The secret key that the initiator (for example, the Windows client)
--   must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the target.
chapInfo_secretToAuthenticateInitiator :: Lens' ChapInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The iSCSI initiator that connects to the target.
chapInfo_initiatorName :: Lens' ChapInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The secret key that the target must provide to participate in mutual
--   CHAP with the initiator (e.g., Windows client).
chapInfo_secretToAuthenticateTarget :: Lens' ChapInfo (Maybe Text)

--   qualified name(iqn) of a tape drive or media changer target.

--   Resource Name (ARN) that encodes the iSCSI qualified name(iqn) of a
--   tape drive or media changer target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:chapEnabled:DeviceiSCSIAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>deviceiSCSIAttributes_chapEnabled</a> - Indicates whether mutual
--   CHAP is enabled for the iSCSI target.

-- | Represents a gateway's local disk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDisk</a> smart constructor.
data Disk
Disk' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Disk

-- | The iSCSI qualified name (IQN) that is defined for a disk. This field
--   is not included in the response if the local disk is not defined as an
--   iSCSI target. The format of this field is
--   <i>targetIqn::LUNNumber::region-volumeId</i>.
[$sel:diskAllocationResource:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text
[$sel:diskAllocationType:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The device node of a local disk as assigned by the virtualization
--   environment.
[$sel:diskNode:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The path of a local disk in the gateway virtual machine (VM).
[$sel:diskPath:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The local disk size in bytes.
[$sel:diskSizeInBytes:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Integer

-- | A value that represents the status of a local disk.
[$sel:diskStatus:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique device ID or other distinguishing data that identifies a
--   local disk.
[$sel:diskId:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text
[$sel:diskAttributeList:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe [Text]

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   that is defined for a disk. This field is not included in the response

--   this field is <i>targetIqn::LUNNumber::region-volumeId</i>.

--   Undocumented member.

--   a local disk as assigned by the virtualization environment.

--   disk in the gateway virtual machine (VM).

-- | Specifies network configuration information for the gateway associated
--   with the Amazon FSx file system.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointNetworkConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointNetworkConfiguration

--   system is available.
--   
--   If multiple file systems are associated with this gateway, this field
--   is required.
[$sel:ipAddresses:EndpointNetworkConfiguration'] :: EndpointNetworkConfiguration -> Maybe [Text]

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   addresses on which the associated Amazon FSx file system is available.

--   If multiple file systems are associated with this gateway, this field
--   is required.
newEndpointNetworkConfiguration :: EndpointNetworkConfiguration

--   system is available.
--   
--   If multiple file systems are associated with this gateway, this field
--   is required.

-- | Describes the object returned by
--   <tt>DescribeFileSystemAssociations</tt> that describes a created file

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFileSystemAssociationInfo</a> smart constructor.
data FileSystemAssociationInfo
FileSystemAssociationInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CacheAttributes -> Maybe EndpointNetworkConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> FileSystemAssociationInfo

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for the audit logs.
[$sel:auditDestinationARN:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe Text

[$sel:gatewayARN:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:cacheAttributes:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe CacheAttributes

-- | Specifies network configuration information for the gateway associated
--   with the Amazon FSx file system.
--   
--   If multiple file systems are associated with this gateway, this
--   parameter's <tt>IpAddresses</tt> field is required.
[$sel:endpointNetworkConfiguration:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe EndpointNetworkConfiguration

-- | The ARN of the backend Amazon FSx file system used for storing file
--   data. For information, see <a>FileSystem</a> in the <i>Amazon FSx API
--   Reference</i>.
[$sel:locationARN:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the file system association. Valid Values:
--   <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> | <tt>CREATING</tt> | <tt>DELETING</tt> |
--   <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> | <tt>UPDATING</tt> | <tt>ERROR</tt>
[$sel:fileSystemAssociationStatus:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the SMB file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair.
[$sel:tags:FileSystemAssociationInfo'] :: FileSystemAssociationInfo -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>FileSystemAssociationInfo</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for the audit logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileSystemAssociationARN:FileSystemAssociationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>fileSystemAssociationInfo_fileSystemAssociationARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the file system association.
--

-- | Undocumented member.
fileSystemAssociationInfo_gatewayARN :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
fileSystemAssociationInfo_cacheAttributes :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe CacheAttributes)

-- | Specifies network configuration information for the gateway associated
--   with the Amazon FSx file system.
--   
--   If multiple file systems are associated with this gateway, this
--   parameter's <tt>IpAddresses</tt> field is required.
fileSystemAssociationInfo_endpointNetworkConfiguration :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe EndpointNetworkConfiguration)

-- | The ARN of the backend Amazon FSx file system used for storing file
--   data. For information, see <a>FileSystem</a> in the <i>Amazon FSx API
--   Reference</i>.
fileSystemAssociationInfo_locationARN :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the file system association. Valid Values:
--   <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> | <tt>CREATING</tt> | <tt>DELETING</tt> |
--   <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> | <tt>UPDATING</tt> | <tt>ERROR</tt>
fileSystemAssociationInfo_fileSystemAssociationStatus :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the SMB file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair.
fileSystemAssociationInfo_tags :: Lens' FileSystemAssociationInfo (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Gets the summary returned by <tt>ListFileSystemAssociation</tt>, which
--   is a summary of a created file system association.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFileSystemAssociationSummary</a> smart constructor.
data FileSystemAssociationSummary
FileSystemAssociationSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> FileSystemAssociationSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file system association.
[$sel:fileSystemAssociationARN:FileSystemAssociationSummary'] :: FileSystemAssociationSummary -> Maybe Text
[$sel:gatewayARN:FileSystemAssociationSummary'] :: FileSystemAssociationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the file system association.
[$sel:fileSystemAssociationId:FileSystemAssociationSummary'] :: FileSystemAssociationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the file share. Valid Values: <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> |
--   <tt>CREATING</tt> | <tt>DELETING</tt> | <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> |
--   <tt>UPDATING</tt> | <tt>ERROR</tt>
[$sel:fileSystemAssociationStatus:FileSystemAssociationSummary'] :: FileSystemAssociationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Describes a gateway object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGatewayInfo</a> smart constructor.
data GatewayInfo
GatewayInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> GatewayInfo

-- | The Region where the Amazon EC2 instance is located.
[$sel:ec2InstanceRegion:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways
--   operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
[$sel:gatewayARN:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EC2 instance that was used to launch the gateway.
[$sel:ec2InstanceId:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the gateway.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>DISABLED</tt> | <tt>ACTIVE</tt>
[$sel:gatewayOperationalState:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the gateway.
[$sel:gatewayName:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier assigned to your gateway during activation. This
--   ID becomes part of the gateway Amazon Resource Name (ARN), which you
--   use as input for other operations.
[$sel:gatewayId:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the gateway.
[$sel:gatewayType:GatewayInfo'] :: GatewayInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Describes Network File System (NFS) file share default values. Files
--   and folders stored as Amazon S3 objects in S3 buckets don't, by
--   default, have Unix file permissions assigned to them. Upon discovery
--   in an S3 bucket by Storage Gateway, the S3 objects that represent
--   files and folders are assigned these default Unix permissions. This
--   operation is only supported for S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNFSFileShareDefaults</a> smart constructor.
data NFSFileShareDefaults
NFSFileShareDefaults' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> NFSFileShareDefaults

-- | The Unix file mode in the form "nnnn". For example, <tt>0666</tt>
--   represents the default file mode inside the file share. The default
--   value is <tt>0666</tt>.
[$sel:fileMode:NFSFileShareDefaults'] :: NFSFileShareDefaults -> Maybe Text

-- | The default owner ID for files in the file share (unless the files
--   have another owner ID specified). The default value is
--   <tt>nfsnobody</tt>.
[$sel:ownerId:NFSFileShareDefaults'] :: NFSFileShareDefaults -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Unix directory mode in the form "nnnn". For example, <tt>0666</tt>
--   represents the default access mode for all directories inside the file
--   share. The default value is <tt>0777</tt>.
[$sel:directoryMode:NFSFileShareDefaults'] :: NFSFileShareDefaults -> Maybe Text

-- | The default group ID for the file share (unless the files have another
--   group ID specified). The default value is <tt>nfsnobody</tt>.
[$sel:groupId:NFSFileShareDefaults'] :: NFSFileShareDefaults -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>NFSFileShareDefaults</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileMode:NFSFileShareDefaults'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareDefaults_fileMode</a> - The Unix file mode in the form
--   "nnnn". For example, <tt>0666</tt> represents the default file mode
--   inside the file share. The default value is <tt>0666</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ownerId:NFSFileShareDefaults'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareDefaults_ownerId</a> - The default owner ID for files
--   in the file share (unless the files have another owner ID specified).
--   The default value is <tt>nfsnobody</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:directoryMode:NFSFileShareDefaults'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareDefaults_directoryMode</a> - The Unix directory mode in
--   the form "nnnn". For example, <tt>0666</tt> represents the default
--   access mode for all directories inside the file share. The default
--   value is <tt>0777</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupId:NFSFileShareDefaults'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareDefaults_groupId</a> - The default group ID for the
--   file share (unless the files have another group ID specified). The
--   default value is <tt>nfsnobody</tt>.
newNFSFileShareDefaults :: NFSFileShareDefaults

-- | The Unix file mode in the form "nnnn". For example, <tt>0666</tt>
--   represents the default file mode inside the file share. The default
--   value is <tt>0666</tt>.
nFSFileShareDefaults_fileMode :: Lens' NFSFileShareDefaults (Maybe Text)

-- | The default owner ID for files in the file share (unless the files
--   have another owner ID specified). The default value is
--   <tt>nfsnobody</tt>.
nFSFileShareDefaults_ownerId :: Lens' NFSFileShareDefaults (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Unix directory mode in the form "nnnn". For example, <tt>0666</tt>
--   represents the default access mode for all directories inside the file
--   share. The default value is <tt>0777</tt>.
nFSFileShareDefaults_directoryMode :: Lens' NFSFileShareDefaults (Maybe Text)

-- | The default group ID for the file share (unless the files have another
--   group ID specified). The default value is <tt>nfsnobody</tt>.
nFSFileShareDefaults_groupId :: Lens' NFSFileShareDefaults (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Unix file permissions and ownership information assigned, by
--   default, to native S3 objects when an S3 File Gateway discovers them
--   in S3 buckets. This operation is only supported in S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNFSFileShareInfo</a> smart constructor.
data NFSFileShareInfo
NFSFileShareInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CacheAttributes -> Maybe ObjectACL -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> NFSFileShareInfo
[$sel:fileShareStatus:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:kmsKey:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:gatewayARN:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:path:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the DNS name for the VPC endpoint that the NFS file share
--   uses to connect to Amazon S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
[$sel:vPCEndpointDNSName:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Refresh cache information for the file share.
[$sel:cacheAttributes:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe CacheAttributes
[$sel:objectACL:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe ObjectACL

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:kmsEncrypted:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool
[$sel:fileShareId:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:fileShareARN:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
[$sel:defaultStorageClass:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
[$sel:fileShareName:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:role':NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
[$sel:notificationPolicy:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:squash:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:requesterPays:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool
[$sel:nFSFileShareDefaults:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults
[$sel:locationARN:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:clientList:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:readOnly:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the NFS file share stores
--   files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
[$sel:bucketRegion:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the NFS file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair. For a
--   gateway with more than 10 tags assigned, you can view all tags using
--   the <tt>ListTagsForResource</tt> API operation.
[$sel:tags:NFSFileShareInfo'] :: NFSFileShareInfo -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>NFSFileShareInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareStatus:NFSFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareInfo_fileShareStatus</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:NFSFileShareInfo'</a>, <a>nFSFileShareInfo_kmsKey</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:NFSFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareInfo_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:NFSFileShareInfo'</a>, <a>nFSFileShareInfo_path</a> -
--   Undocumented member.

--   for the VPC endpoint that the NFS file share uses to connect to Amazon
--   S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheAttributes:NFSFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareInfo_cacheAttributes</a> - Refresh cache information
--   for the file share.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectACL:NFSFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareInfo_objectACL</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsEncrypted:NFSFileShareInfo'</a>,

--   Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your own KMS key, or
--   <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>

--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.

--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationPolicy:NFSFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>nFSFileShareInfo_notificationPolicy</a> - The notification policy
--   of the file share. <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number
--   of seconds to wait after the last point in time a client wrote to a
--   file before generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification.
--   Because clients can make many small writes to files, it's best to set
--   this parameter for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple
--   notifications for the same file in a small time period.

--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
