nFSFileShareInfo_gatewayARN :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_path :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the DNS name for the VPC endpoint that the NFS file share
--   uses to connect to Amazon S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
nFSFileShareInfo_vPCEndpointDNSName :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Refresh cache information for the file share.
nFSFileShareInfo_cacheAttributes :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe CacheAttributes)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_objectACL :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe ObjectACL)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
nFSFileShareInfo_kmsEncrypted :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_fileShareId :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_fileShareARN :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
nFSFileShareInfo_defaultStorageClass :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
nFSFileShareInfo_fileShareName :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_role :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
nFSFileShareInfo_notificationPolicy :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_squash :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
nFSFileShareInfo_requesterPays :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_nFSFileShareDefaults :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_locationARN :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_clientList :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
nFSFileShareInfo_guessMIMETypeEnabled :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
nFSFileShareInfo_readOnly :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the NFS file share stores
--   files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
nFSFileShareInfo_bucketRegion :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the NFS file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair. For a
--   gateway with more than 10 tags assigned, you can view all tags using
--   the <tt>ListTagsForResource</tt> API operation.
nFSFileShareInfo_tags :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Describes a gateway's network interface.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkInterface</a> smart constructor.
data NetworkInterface
NetworkInterface' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkInterface

-- | The Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) address of the interface.
--   <i>Currently not supported</i>.
[$sel:ipv6Address:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe Text

-- | The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the interface.
--   
--   This is currently unsupported and will not be returned in output.
[$sel:macAddress:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe Text

-- | The Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) address of the interface.
[$sel:ipv4Address:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkInterface</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipv6Address:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_ipv6Address</a> - The Internet Protocol version 6
--   (IPv6) address of the interface. <i>Currently not supported</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:macAddress:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_macAddress</a> - The Media Access Control (MAC)
--   address of the interface.
--   
--   This is currently unsupported and will not be returned in output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipv4Address:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_ipv4Address</a> - The Internet Protocol version 4
--   (IPv4) address of the interface.
newNetworkInterface :: NetworkInterface

-- | The Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) address of the interface.
--   <i>Currently not supported</i>.
networkInterface_ipv6Address :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the interface.
--   
--   This is currently unsupported and will not be returned in output.
networkInterface_macAddress :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) address of the interface.
networkInterface_ipv4Address :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes a custom tape pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPoolInfo</a> smart constructor.
data PoolInfo
PoolInfo' :: Maybe RetentionLockType -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TapeStorageClass -> Maybe PoolStatus -> Maybe Text -> PoolInfo

-- | Tape retention lock type, which can be configured in two modes. When
--   configured in governance mode, accounts with specific IAM permissions
--   are authorized to remove the tape retention lock from archived virtual
--   tapes. When configured in compliance mode, the tape retention lock
--   cannot be removed by any user, including the root account.
[$sel:retentionLockType:PoolInfo'] :: PoolInfo -> Maybe RetentionLockType

-- | Tape retention lock time is set in days. Tape retention lock can be
--   enabled for up to 100 years (36,500 days).
[$sel:retentionLockTimeInDays:PoolInfo'] :: PoolInfo -> Maybe Natural

-- | The name of the custom tape pool. <tt>PoolName</tt> can use all ASCII
--   characters, except '/' and '\'.
[$sel:poolName:PoolInfo'] :: PoolInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The storage class that is associated with the custom pool. When you
--   use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is archived
--   directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep
--   Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
[$sel:storageClass:PoolInfo'] :: PoolInfo -> Maybe TapeStorageClass

-- | Status of the custom tape pool. Pool can be <tt>ACTIVE</tt> or
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>.
[$sel:poolStatus:PoolInfo'] :: PoolInfo -> Maybe PoolStatus

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom tape pool. Use the
--   ListTapePools operation to return a list of custom tape pools for your
--   account and Region.
[$sel:poolARN:PoolInfo'] :: PoolInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PoolInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionLockType:PoolInfo'</a>,
--   <a>poolInfo_retentionLockType</a> - Tape retention lock type, which
--   can be configured in two modes. When configured in governance mode,
--   accounts with specific IAM permissions are authorized to remove the
--   tape retention lock from archived virtual tapes. When configured in
--   compliance mode, the tape retention lock cannot be removed by any
--   user, including the root account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionLockTimeInDays:PoolInfo'</a>,
--   <a>poolInfo_retentionLockTimeInDays</a> - Tape retention lock time is
--   set in days. Tape retention lock can be enabled for up to 100 years
--   (36,500 days).
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolName:PoolInfo'</a>, <a>poolInfo_poolName</a> - The name of
--   the custom tape pool. <tt>PoolName</tt> can use all ASCII characters,
--   except '/' and '\'.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:PoolInfo'</a>, <a>poolInfo_storageClass</a> - The
--   storage class that is associated with the custom pool. When you use
--   your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is archived
--   directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep
--   Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolStatus:PoolInfo'</a>, <a>poolInfo_poolStatus</a> - Status
--   of the custom tape pool. Pool can be <tt>ACTIVE</tt> or
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolARN:PoolInfo'</a>, <a>poolInfo_poolARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the custom tape pool. Use the ListTapePools
--   operation to return a list of custom tape pools for your account and
--   Region.
newPoolInfo :: PoolInfo

-- | Tape retention lock type, which can be configured in two modes. When
--   configured in governance mode, accounts with specific IAM permissions
--   are authorized to remove the tape retention lock from archived virtual
--   tapes. When configured in compliance mode, the tape retention lock
--   cannot be removed by any user, including the root account.
poolInfo_retentionLockType :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe RetentionLockType)

-- | Tape retention lock time is set in days. Tape retention lock can be
--   enabled for up to 100 years (36,500 days).
poolInfo_retentionLockTimeInDays :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe Natural)

-- | The name of the custom tape pool. <tt>PoolName</tt> can use all ASCII
--   characters, except '/' and '\'.
poolInfo_poolName :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The storage class that is associated with the custom pool. When you
--   use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is archived
--   directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep
--   Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
poolInfo_storageClass :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe TapeStorageClass)

-- | Status of the custom tape pool. Pool can be <tt>ACTIVE</tt> or
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>.
poolInfo_poolStatus :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe PoolStatus)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom tape pool. Use the
--   ListTapePools operation to return a list of custom tape pools for your
--   account and Region.
poolInfo_poolARN :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The Windows file permissions and ownership information assigned, by
--   default, to native S3 objects when S3 File Gateway discovers them in
--   S3 buckets. This operation is only supported for S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMBFileShareInfo</a> smart constructor.
data SMBFileShareInfo
SMBFileShareInfo' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CacheAttributes -> Maybe ObjectACL -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CaseSensitivity -> Maybe [Tag] -> SMBFileShareInfo

-- | Indicates whether <tt>AccessBasedEnumeration</tt> is enabled.
[$sel:accessBasedEnumeration:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that have
--   administrator rights to the file share. A group must be prefixed with
--   the @ character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
[$sel:adminUserList:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for audit logs.
[$sel:auditDestinationARN:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:fileShareStatus:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are not allowed
--   to access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @
--   character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
[$sel:invalidUserList:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe [Text]
[$sel:kmsKey:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are allowed to
--   access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @ character.
--   Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>,
--   <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if
--   Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
[$sel:validUserList:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe [Text]
[$sel:gatewayARN:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The file share path used by the SMB client to identify the mount
--   point.
[$sel:path:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the DNS name for the VPC endpoint that the SMB file share
--   uses to connect to Amazon S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
[$sel:vPCEndpointDNSName:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:authentication:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Refresh cache information for the file share.
[$sel:cacheAttributes:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe CacheAttributes
[$sel:objectACL:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe ObjectACL

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:kmsEncrypted:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool
[$sel:fileShareId:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:fileShareARN:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
[$sel:defaultStorageClass:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
[$sel:fileShareName:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:role':SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, it indicates that access
--   control list (ACL) is enabled on the SMB file share. If it is set to
--   <tt>false</tt>, it indicates that file and directory permissions are
--   mapped to the POSIX permission.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Using Microsoft Windows ACLs to control
--   access to an SMB file share</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:sMBACLEnabled:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether opportunistic locking is enabled for the SMB file
--   share.
--   
--   Enabling opportunistic locking on case-sensitive shares is not
--   recommended for workloads that involve access to files with the same
--   name in different case.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:oplocksEnabled:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
[$sel:notificationPolicy:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:requesterPays:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool
[$sel:locationARN:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:readOnly:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the SMB file share stores
--   files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
[$sel:bucketRegion:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The case of an object name in an Amazon S3 bucket. For
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client determines the case sensitivity.
--   For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the gateway determines the case
--   sensitivity. The default value is <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
[$sel:caseSensitivity:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe CaseSensitivity

-- | A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the SMB file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair. For a
--   gateway with more than 10 tags assigned, you can view all tags using
--   the <tt>ListTagsForResource</tt> API operation.
[$sel:tags:SMBFileShareInfo'] :: SMBFileShareInfo -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>SMBFileShareInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessBasedEnumeration:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_accessBasedEnumeration</a> - Indicates whether
--   <tt>AccessBasedEnumeration</tt> is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adminUserList:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_adminUserList</a> - A list of users or groups in
--   the Active Directory that have administrator rights to the file share.
--   A group must be prefixed with the @ character. Acceptable formats
--   include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and
--   <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if Authentication is set to
--   <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:auditDestinationARN:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_auditDestinationARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the storage used for audit logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareStatus:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_fileShareStatus</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:invalidUserList:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_invalidUserList</a> - A list of users or groups in
--   the Active Directory that are not allowed to access the file share. A
--   group must be prefixed with the @ character. Acceptable formats
--   include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and
--   <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if Authentication is set to
--   <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>, <a>sMBFileShareInfo_kmsKey</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validUserList:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_validUserList</a> - A list of users or groups in
--   the Active Directory that are allowed to access the file share. A
--   group must be prefixed with the @ character. Acceptable formats
--   include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and
--   <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if Authentication is set to
--   <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>, <a>sMBFileShareInfo_path</a> - The
--   file share path used by the SMB client to identify the mount point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vPCEndpointDNSName:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_vPCEndpointDNSName</a> - Specifies the DNS name
--   for the VPC endpoint that the SMB file share uses to connect to Amazon
--   S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authentication:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_authentication</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheAttributes:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_cacheAttributes</a> - Refresh cache information
--   for the file share.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectACL:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_objectACL</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsEncrypted:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_kmsEncrypted</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt> to use
--   Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your own KMS key, or
--   <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareId:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_fileShareId</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareARN:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_fileShareARN</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultStorageClass:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_defaultStorageClass</a> - The default storage
--   class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by the S3 File Gateway.
--   The default value is <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareName:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_fileShareName</a> - The name of the file share.
--   Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:role':SMBFileShareInfo'</a>, <a>sMBFileShareInfo_role</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sMBACLEnabled:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_sMBACLEnabled</a> - If this value is set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, it indicates that access control list (ACL) is enabled
--   on the SMB file share. If it is set to <tt>false</tt>, it indicates
--   that file and directory permissions are mapped to the POSIX
--   permission.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Using Microsoft Windows ACLs to control
--   access to an SMB file share</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oplocksEnabled:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_oplocksEnabled</a> - Specifies whether
--   opportunistic locking is enabled for the SMB file share.
--   
--   Enabling opportunistic locking on case-sensitive shares is not
--   recommended for workloads that involve access to files with the same
--   name in different case.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationPolicy:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_notificationPolicy</a> - The notification policy
--   of the file share. <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number
--   of seconds to wait after the last point in time a client wrote to a
--   file before generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification.
--   Because clients can make many small writes to files, it's best to set
--   this parameter for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple
--   notifications for the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:requesterPays:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_requesterPays</a> - A value that sets who pays the
--   cost of the request and the cost associated with data download from
--   the S3 bucket. If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, the requester
--   pays the costs; otherwise, the S3 bucket owner pays. However, the S3
--   bucket owner always pays the cost of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:locationARN:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_locationARN</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_guessMIMETypeEnabled</a> - A value that enables
--   guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects based on file
--   extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable MIME type
--   guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value is
--   <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:readOnly:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_readOnly</a> - A value that sets the write status
--   of a file share. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to set the write
--   status to read-only, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketRegion:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_bucketRegion</a> - Specifies the Region of the S3
--   bucket where the SMB file share stores files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:caseSensitivity:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>,
--   <a>sMBFileShareInfo_caseSensitivity</a> - The case of an object name
--   in an Amazon S3 bucket. For <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client
--   determines the case sensitivity. For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the
--   gateway determines the case sensitivity. The default value is
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:SMBFileShareInfo'</a>, <a>sMBFileShareInfo_tags</a> - A
--   list of up to 50 tags assigned to the SMB file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair. For a
--   gateway with more than 10 tags assigned, you can view all tags using
--   the <tt>ListTagsForResource</tt> API operation.
newSMBFileShareInfo :: SMBFileShareInfo

-- | Indicates whether <tt>AccessBasedEnumeration</tt> is enabled.
sMBFileShareInfo_accessBasedEnumeration :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that have
--   administrator rights to the file share. A group must be prefixed with
--   the @ character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
sMBFileShareInfo_adminUserList :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for audit logs.
sMBFileShareInfo_auditDestinationARN :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_fileShareStatus :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are not allowed
--   to access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @
--   character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
sMBFileShareInfo_invalidUserList :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe [Text])

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_kmsKey :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are allowed to
--   access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @ character.
--   Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>,
--   <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if
--   Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
sMBFileShareInfo_validUserList :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe [Text])

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_gatewayARN :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The file share path used by the SMB client to identify the mount
--   point.
sMBFileShareInfo_path :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the DNS name for the VPC endpoint that the SMB file share
--   uses to connect to Amazon S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
sMBFileShareInfo_vPCEndpointDNSName :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_authentication :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Refresh cache information for the file share.
sMBFileShareInfo_cacheAttributes :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe CacheAttributes)

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_objectACL :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe ObjectACL)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
sMBFileShareInfo_kmsEncrypted :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_fileShareId :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_fileShareARN :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
sMBFileShareInfo_defaultStorageClass :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
sMBFileShareInfo_fileShareName :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_role :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, it indicates that access
--   control list (ACL) is enabled on the SMB file share. If it is set to
--   <tt>false</tt>, it indicates that file and directory permissions are
--   mapped to the POSIX permission.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Using Microsoft Windows ACLs to control
--   access to an SMB file share</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User
--   Guide</i>.
sMBFileShareInfo_sMBACLEnabled :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether opportunistic locking is enabled for the SMB file
--   share.
--   
--   Enabling opportunistic locking on case-sensitive shares is not
--   recommended for workloads that involve access to files with the same
--   name in different case.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
sMBFileShareInfo_oplocksEnabled :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
sMBFileShareInfo_notificationPolicy :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
sMBFileShareInfo_requesterPays :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_locationARN :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
sMBFileShareInfo_guessMIMETypeEnabled :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
sMBFileShareInfo_readOnly :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the SMB file share stores
--   files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
sMBFileShareInfo_bucketRegion :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The case of an object name in an Amazon S3 bucket. For
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client determines the case sensitivity.
--   For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the gateway determines the case
--   sensitivity. The default value is <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
sMBFileShareInfo_caseSensitivity :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe CaseSensitivity)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the SMB file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair. For a
--   gateway with more than 10 tags assigned, you can view all tags using
--   the <tt>ListTagsForResource</tt> API operation.
sMBFileShareInfo_tags :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Describes an iSCSI stored volume.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStorediSCSIVolume</a> smart constructor.
data StorediSCSIVolume
StorediSCSIVolume' :: Maybe VolumeiSCSIAttributes -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StorediSCSIVolume

-- | An VolumeiSCSIAttributes object that represents a collection of iSCSI
--   attributes for one stored volume.
[$sel:volumeiSCSIAttributes:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe VolumeiSCSIAttributes

-- | One of the VolumeStatus values that indicates the state of the storage
--   volume.
[$sel:volumeStatus:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | If the stored volume was created from a snapshot, this field contains
--   the snapshot ID used, e.g. snap-78e22663. Otherwise, this field is not
--   included.
[$sel:sourceSnapshotId:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates if when the stored volume was created, existing data on the
--   underlying local disk was preserved.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:preservedExistingData:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Bool
[$sel:kmsKey:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that indicates whether a storage volume is attached to,
--   detached from, or is in the process of detaching from a gateway. For
--   more information, see <a>Moving your volumes to a different
--   gateway</a>.
[$sel:volumeAttachmentStatus:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage volume.
[$sel:volumeARN:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | Represents the percentage complete if the volume is restoring or
--   bootstrapping that represents the percent of data transferred. This
--   field does not appear in the response if the stored volume is not
--   restoring or bootstrapping.
[$sel:volumeProgress:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Double

-- | The size of the volume in bytes.
[$sel:volumeSizeInBytes:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Integer

-- | The size of the data stored on the volume in bytes. This value is
--   calculated based on the number of blocks that are touched, instead of
--   the actual amount of data written. This value can be useful for
--   sequential write patterns but less accurate for random write patterns.
--   <tt>VolumeUsedInBytes</tt> is different from the compressed size of
--   the volume, which is the value that is used to calculate your bill.
--   
--   This value is not available for volumes created prior to May 13, 2015,
--   until you store data on the volume.
[$sel:volumeUsedInBytes:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date the volume was created. Volumes created prior to March 28,
--   2017 dont have this timestamp.
[$sel:createdDate:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique identifier of the volume, e.g., vol-AE4B946D.
[$sel:volumeId:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the local disk that was specified in the
--   CreateStorediSCSIVolume operation.
[$sel:volumeDiskId:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | One of the VolumeType enumeration values describing the type of the
--   volume.
[$sel:volumeType:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
[$sel:targetName:StorediSCSIVolume'] :: StorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StorediSCSIVolume</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   attributes for one stored volume.

--   
--   <a>$sel:preservedExistingData:StorediSCSIVolume'</a>,

--   created. Volumes created prior to March 28, 2017 dont have this
--   timestamp.

--   enumeration values describing the type of the volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetName:StorediSCSIVolume'</a>,
--   <a>storediSCSIVolume_targetName</a> - The name of the iSCSI target
--   used by an initiator to connect to a volume and used as a suffix for
--   the target ARN. For example, specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as
--   <i>myvolume</i> results in the target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--

--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
newStorediSCSIVolume :: StorediSCSIVolume

-- | The size of the data stored on the volume in bytes. This value is
--   calculated based on the number of blocks that are touched, instead of
--   the actual amount of data written. This value can be useful for
--   sequential write patterns but less accurate for random write patterns.
--   <tt>VolumeUsedInBytes</tt> is different from the compressed size of
--   the volume, which is the value that is used to calculate your bill.
--   
--   This value is not available for volumes created prior to May 13, 2015,
--   until you store data on the volume.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeUsedInBytes :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date the volume was created. Volumes created prior to March 28,
--   2017 dont have this timestamp.
storediSCSIVolume_createdDate :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique identifier of the volume, e.g., vol-AE4B946D.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeId :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the local disk that was specified in the
--   CreateStorediSCSIVolume operation.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeDiskId :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | One of the VolumeType enumeration values describing the type of the
--   volume.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeType :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
storediSCSIVolume_targetName :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | A key-value pair that helps you manage, filter, and search for your
--   resource. Allowed characters: letters, white space, and numbers,
--   representable in UTF-8, and the following characters: + - = . _ : /.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Tag key. The key can't start with aws:.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Value of the tag key.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - Tag key. The key can't start
--   with aws:.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - Value of the tag key.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Tag key. The key can't start with aws:.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | Value of the tag key.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | Describes a virtual tape object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTape</a> smart constructor.
data Tape
Tape' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Tape

-- | The barcode that identifies a specific virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeBarcode:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of the virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeStatus:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Text
[$sel:kmsKey:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeARN:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Text

-- | For archiving virtual tapes, indicates how much data remains to be
--   uploaded before archiving is complete.
--   
--   Range: 0 (not started) to 100 (complete).
[$sel:progress:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Double

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tape capacity.
[$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Integer

-- | The virtual tape library (VTL) device that the virtual tape is
--   associated with.
[$sel:vTLDevice:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the pool that contains tapes that will be archived. The
--   tapes in this pool are archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
[$sel:poolId:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of data stored on the virtual tape.
--   
--   This value is not available for tapes created prior to May 13, 2015.
[$sel:tapeUsedInBytes:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date the virtual tape was created.
[$sel:tapeCreatedDate:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date that the tape enters a custom tape pool.
[$sel:poolEntryDate:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe POSIX

-- | If the tape is archived as write-once-read-many (WORM), this value is
--   <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:worm:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date that the tape is first archived with tape retention lock
--   enabled.
[$sel:retentionStartDate:Tape'] :: Tape -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>Tape</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeBarcode:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_tapeBarcode</a> - The barcode
--   that identifies a specific virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeStatus:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_tapeStatus</a> - The current
--   state of the virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_kmsKey</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_tapeARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:progress:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_progress</a> - For archiving
--   virtual tapes, indicates how much data remains to be uploaded before
--   archiving is complete.
--   
--   Range: 0 (not started) to 100 (complete).
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_tapeSizeInBytes</a> - The
--   size, in bytes, of the virtual tape capacity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vTLDevice:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_vTLDevice</a> - The virtual tape
--   library (VTL) device that the virtual tape is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolId:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_poolId</a> - The ID of the pool that
--   contains tapes that will be archived. The tapes in this pool are
--   archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with the pool.
--   When you use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is
--   archived directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier
--   Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeUsedInBytes:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_tapeUsedInBytes</a> - The
--   size, in bytes, of data stored on the virtual tape.
--   
--   This value is not available for tapes created prior to May 13, 2015.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeCreatedDate:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_tapeCreatedDate</a> - The
--   date the virtual tape was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolEntryDate:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_poolEntryDate</a> - The date
--   that the tape enters a custom tape pool.
--   
--   <a>$sel:worm:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_worm</a> - If the tape is archived as
--   write-once-read-many (WORM), this value is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionStartDate:Tape'</a>, <a>tape_retentionStartDate</a> -
--   The date that the tape is first archived with tape retention lock
--   enabled.
newTape :: Tape

-- | The barcode that identifies a specific virtual tape.
tape_tapeBarcode :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of the virtual tape.
tape_tapeStatus :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
tape_kmsKey :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape.
tape_tapeARN :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Text)

-- | For archiving virtual tapes, indicates how much data remains to be
--   uploaded before archiving is complete.
--   
--   Range: 0 (not started) to 100 (complete).
tape_progress :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Double)

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tape capacity.
tape_tapeSizeInBytes :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Integer)

-- | The virtual tape library (VTL) device that the virtual tape is
--   associated with.
tape_vTLDevice :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the pool that contains tapes that will be archived. The
--   tapes in this pool are archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
tape_poolId :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of data stored on the virtual tape.
--   
--   This value is not available for tapes created prior to May 13, 2015.
tape_tapeUsedInBytes :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date the virtual tape was created.
tape_tapeCreatedDate :: Lens' Tape (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date that the tape enters a custom tape pool.
tape_poolEntryDate :: Lens' Tape (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If the tape is archived as write-once-read-many (WORM), this value is
--   <tt>true</tt>.
tape_worm :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date that the tape is first archived with tape retention lock
--   enabled.
tape_retentionStartDate :: Lens' Tape (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Represents a virtual tape that is archived in the virtual tape shelf
--   (VTS).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTapeArchive</a> smart constructor.
data TapeArchive
TapeArchive' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> TapeArchive

-- | The barcode that identifies the archived virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeBarcode:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of the archived virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeStatus:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Text
[$sel:kmsKey:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an archived virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeARN:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the archived virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Integer

-- | The time that the archiving of the virtual tape was completed.
--   
--   The default timestamp format is in the ISO8601 extended
--   YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
[$sel:completionTime:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ID of the pool that was used to archive the tape. The tapes in
--   this pool are archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with
--   the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
[$sel:poolId:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of data stored on the virtual tape.
--   
--   This value is not available for tapes created prior to May 13, 2015.
[$sel:tapeUsedInBytes:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date the virtual tape was created.
[$sel:tapeCreatedDate:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time that the tape entered the custom tape pool.
--   
--   The default timestamp format is in the ISO8601 extended
--   YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
[$sel:poolEntryDate:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> if the archived tape is stored as
--   write-once-read-many (WORM).
[$sel:worm:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Bool

-- | If the archived tape is subject to tape retention lock, the date that
--   the archived tape started being retained.
[$sel:retentionStartDate:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the tape gateway that the virtual
--   tape is being retrieved to.
--   
--   The virtual tape is retrieved from the virtual tape shelf (VTS).
[$sel:retrievedTo:TapeArchive'] :: TapeArchive -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TapeArchive</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeBarcode:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_tapeBarcode</a> -
--   The barcode that identifies the archived virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeStatus:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_tapeStatus</a> -
--   The current state of the archived virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_kmsKey</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_tapeARN</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an archived virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:TapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>tapeArchive_tapeSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in bytes, of the
--   archived virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:TapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>tapeArchive_completionTime</a> - The time that the archiving of the
--   virtual tape was completed.
--   
--   The default timestamp format is in the ISO8601 extended
--   YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolId:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_poolId</a> - The ID of
--   the pool that was used to archive the tape. The tapes in this pool are
--   archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeUsedInBytes:TapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>tapeArchive_tapeUsedInBytes</a> - The size, in bytes, of data
--   stored on the virtual tape.
--   
--   This value is not available for tapes created prior to May 13, 2015.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeCreatedDate:TapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>tapeArchive_tapeCreatedDate</a> - The date the virtual tape was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolEntryDate:TapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>tapeArchive_poolEntryDate</a> - The time that the tape entered the
--   custom tape pool.
--   
--   The default timestamp format is in the ISO8601 extended
--   YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:worm:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_worm</a> - Set to
--   <tt>true</tt> if the archived tape is stored as write-once-read-many
--   (WORM).
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionStartDate:TapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>tapeArchive_retentionStartDate</a> - If the archived tape is
--   subject to tape retention lock, the date that the archived tape
--   started being retained.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retrievedTo:TapeArchive'</a>, <a>tapeArchive_retrievedTo</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the tape gateway that the virtual
--   tape is being retrieved to.
--   
--   The virtual tape is retrieved from the virtual tape shelf (VTS).
newTapeArchive :: TapeArchive

-- | The barcode that identifies the archived virtual tape.
tapeArchive_tapeBarcode :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of the archived virtual tape.
tapeArchive_tapeStatus :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
tapeArchive_kmsKey :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an archived virtual tape.
tapeArchive_tapeARN :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of the archived virtual tape.
tapeArchive_tapeSizeInBytes :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time that the archiving of the virtual tape was completed.
--   
--   The default timestamp format is in the ISO8601 extended
--   YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
tapeArchive_completionTime :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the pool that was used to archive the tape. The tapes in
--   this pool are archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with
--   the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
tapeArchive_poolId :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of data stored on the virtual tape.
--   
--   This value is not available for tapes created prior to May 13, 2015.
tapeArchive_tapeUsedInBytes :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date the virtual tape was created.
tapeArchive_tapeCreatedDate :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time that the tape entered the custom tape pool.
--   
--   The default timestamp format is in the ISO8601 extended
--   YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
tapeArchive_poolEntryDate :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> if the archived tape is stored as
--   write-once-read-many (WORM).
tapeArchive_worm :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Bool)

-- | If the archived tape is subject to tape retention lock, the date that
--   the archived tape started being retained.
tapeArchive_retentionStartDate :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the tape gateway that the virtual
--   tape is being retrieved to.
--   
--   The virtual tape is retrieved from the virtual tape shelf (VTS).
tapeArchive_retrievedTo :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes a virtual tape.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTapeInfo</a> smart constructor.
data TapeInfo
TapeInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> TapeInfo

-- | The barcode that identifies a specific virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeBarcode:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the tape.
[$sel:tapeStatus:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeARN:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways
--   operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
[$sel:gatewayARN:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of a virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe Integer

-- | The ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving.
--   The tape in this pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
[$sel:poolId:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The date that the tape entered the custom tape pool with tape
--   retention lock enabled.
[$sel:poolEntryDate:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date that the tape became subject to tape retention lock.
[$sel:retentionStartDate:TapeInfo'] :: TapeInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>TapeInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeBarcode:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_tapeBarcode</a> - The
--   barcode that identifies a specific virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeStatus:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_tapeStatus</a> - The
--   status of the tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_tapeARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of a virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_gatewayARN</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways
--   operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_tapeSizeInBytes</a>
--   - The size, in bytes, of a virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolId:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_poolId</a> - The ID of the
--   pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving. The tape in this
--   pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with the
--   pool. When you use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape
--   is archived directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier
--   Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolEntryDate:TapeInfo'</a>, <a>tapeInfo_poolEntryDate</a> -
--   The date that the tape entered the custom tape pool with tape
--   retention lock enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionStartDate:TapeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>tapeInfo_retentionStartDate</a> - The date that the tape became
--   subject to tape retention lock.
newTapeInfo :: TapeInfo

-- | The barcode that identifies a specific virtual tape.
tapeInfo_tapeBarcode :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the tape.
tapeInfo_tapeStatus :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a virtual tape.
tapeInfo_tapeARN :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways
--   operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
tapeInfo_gatewayARN :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of a virtual tape.
tapeInfo_tapeSizeInBytes :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe Integer)

-- | The ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving.
--   The tape in this pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
tapeInfo_poolId :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The date that the tape entered the custom tape pool with tape
--   retention lock enabled.
tapeInfo_poolEntryDate :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date that the tape became subject to tape retention lock.
tapeInfo_retentionStartDate :: Lens' TapeInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Describes a recovery point.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTapeRecoveryPointInfo</a> smart constructor.
data TapeRecoveryPointInfo
TapeRecoveryPointInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> TapeRecoveryPointInfo

-- | The status of the virtual tapes.
[$sel:tapeStatus:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'] :: TapeRecoveryPointInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The time when the point-in-time view of the virtual tape was
--   replicated for later recovery.
--   
--   The default timestamp format of the tape recovery point time is in the
--   ISO8601 extended YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
[$sel:tapeRecoveryPointTime:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'] :: TapeRecoveryPointInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeARN:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'] :: TapeRecoveryPointInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tapes to recover.
[$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'] :: TapeRecoveryPointInfo -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>TapeRecoveryPointInfo</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeStatus:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'</a>,
--   <a>tapeRecoveryPointInfo_tapeStatus</a> - The status of the virtual
--   tapes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeRecoveryPointTime:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'</a>,
--   <a>tapeRecoveryPointInfo_tapeRecoveryPointTime</a> - The time when the
--   point-in-time view of the virtual tape was replicated for later
--   recovery.
--   
--   The default timestamp format of the tape recovery point time is in the
--   ISO8601 extended YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'</a>,
--   <a>tapeRecoveryPointInfo_tapeARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the virtual tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:TapeRecoveryPointInfo'</a>,
--   <a>tapeRecoveryPointInfo_tapeSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in bytes, of
--   the virtual tapes to recover.

-- | The status of the virtual tapes.

--   replicated for later recovery.
--   
--   The default timestamp format of the tape recovery point time is in the
--   ISO8601 extended YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' format.

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tapes to recover.
tapeRecoveryPointInfo_tapeSizeInBytes :: Lens' TapeRecoveryPointInfo (Maybe Integer)

-- | Starts a gateway that you previously shut down (see ShutdownGateway).
--   After the gateway starts, you can then make other API calls, your
--   applications can read from or write to the gateway's storage volumes
--   and you will be able to take snapshot backups.
--   
--   When you make a request, you will get a 200 OK success response
--   immediately. However, it might take some time for the gateway to be
--   ready. You should call DescribeGatewayInformation and check the status
--   before making any additional API calls. For more information, see
--   ActivateGateway.
--   
--   To specify which gateway to start, use the Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the gateway in your request.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.StartGateway

-- | A JSON object containing the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway
--   to start.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStartGateway</a> smart constructor.

-- | Start a test that verifies that the specified gateway is configured
--   for High Availability monitoring in your host environment. This
--   request only initiates the test and that a successful response only
--   indicates that the test was started. It doesn't indicate that the test
--   passed. For the status of the test, invoke the
--   <tt>DescribeAvailabilityMonitorTest</tt> API.
--   
--   Starting this test will cause your gateway to go offline for a brief
--   period.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.StartAvailabilityMonitorTest

-- | Shuts down a gateway. To specify which gateway to shut down, use the
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway in the body of your request.
--   
--   The operation shuts down the gateway service component running in the
--   gateway's virtual machine (VM) and not the host VM.
--   
--   If you want to shut down the VM, it is recommended that you first shut
--   down the gateway component in the VM to avoid unpredictable
--   conditions.
--   
--   After the gateway is shutdown, you cannot call any other API except
--   StartGateway, DescribeGatewayInformation, and ListGateways. For more
--   information, see ActivateGateway. Your applications cannot read from
--   or write to the gateway's storage volumes, and there are no snapshots
--   taken.
--   
--   When you make a shutdown request, you will get a <tt>200 OK</tt>
--   success response immediately. However, it might take some time for the
--   gateway to shut down. You can call the DescribeGatewayInformation API
--   to check the status. For more information, see ActivateGateway.
--   
--   If do not intend to use the gateway again, you must delete the gateway
--   (using DeleteGateway) to no longer pay software charges associated
--   with the gateway.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ShutdownGateway

-- | A JSON object containing the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway
--   to shut down.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newShutdownGateway</a> smart constructor.
data ShutdownGateway
ShutdownGateway' :: Text -> ShutdownGateway
[$sel:gatewayARN:ShutdownGateway'] :: ShutdownGateway -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ShutdownGateway</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:ShutdownGateway'</a>,
--   <a>shutdownGateway_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
newShutdownGateway :: Text -> ShutdownGateway

-- | Undocumented member.
shutdownGateway_gatewayARN :: Lens' ShutdownGateway Text

-- | A JSON object containing the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway
--   that was shut down.
--

-- | Retrieves the recovery point for the specified virtual tape. This
--   operation is only supported in the tape gateway type.
--   
--   A recovery point is a point in time view of a virtual tape at which
--   all the data on the tape is consistent. If your gateway crashes,
--   virtual tapes that have recovery points can be recovered to a new
--   gateway.
--   
--   The virtual tape can be retrieved to only one gateway. The retrieved
--   tape is read-only. The virtual tape can be retrieved to only a tape
--   gateway. There is no charge for retrieving recovery points.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint

-- | RetrieveTapeRecoveryPointInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint</a> smart constructor.
data RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint
RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint' :: Text -> Text -> RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape for which you want
--   to retrieve the recovery point.
[$sel:tapeARN:RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint'] :: RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint -> Text
[$sel:gatewayARN:RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint'] :: RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint'</a>,
--   <a>retrieveTapeRecoveryPoint_tapeARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the virtual tape for which you want to retrieve the recovery
--   point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint'</a>,
--   <a>retrieveTapeRecoveryPoint_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.

--   to retrieve the recovery point.

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRetrieveTapeRecoveryPointResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.StorageGateway.RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint.RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint


-- | Retrieves an archived virtual tape from the virtual tape shelf (VTS)
--   to a tape gateway. Virtual tapes archived in the VTS are not
--   associated with any gateway. However after a tape is retrieved, it is
--   associated with a gateway, even though it is also listed in the VTS,
--   that is, archive. This operation is only supported in the tape gateway
--   type.
--   
--   Once a tape is successfully retrieved to a gateway, it cannot be
--   retrieved again to another gateway. You must archive the tape again
--   before you can retrieve it to another gateway. This operation is only
--   supported in the tape gateway type.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.RetrieveTapeArchive

-- | RetrieveTapeArchiveInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRetrieveTapeArchive</a> smart constructor.
data RetrieveTapeArchive
RetrieveTapeArchive' :: Text -> Text -> RetrieveTapeArchive

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape you want to
--   retrieve from the virtual tape shelf (VTS).
[$sel:tapeARN:RetrieveTapeArchive'] :: RetrieveTapeArchive -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway you want to retrieve the
--   virtual tape to. Use the ListGateways operation to return a list of
--   gateways for your account and Region.
--   
--   You retrieve archived virtual tapes to only one gateway and the
--   gateway must be a tape gateway.
[$sel:gatewayARN:RetrieveTapeArchive'] :: RetrieveTapeArchive -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RetrieveTapeArchive</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:RetrieveTapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>retrieveTapeArchive_tapeARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the virtual tape you want to retrieve from the virtual tape shelf
--   (VTS).
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:RetrieveTapeArchive'</a>,
--   <a>retrieveTapeArchive_gatewayARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the gateway you want to retrieve the virtual tape to. Use the
--   ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account
--   and Region.
--   
--   You retrieve archived virtual tapes to only one gateway and the
--   gateway must be a tape gateway.
newRetrieveTapeArchive :: Text -> Text -> RetrieveTapeArchive

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape you want to
--   retrieve from the virtual tape shelf (VTS).
retrieveTapeArchive_tapeARN :: Lens' RetrieveTapeArchive Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway you want to retrieve the
--   virtual tape to. Use the ListGateways operation to return a list of
--   gateways for your account and Region.
--   
--   You retrieve archived virtual tapes to only one gateway and the
--   gateway must be a tape gateway.
retrieveTapeArchive_gatewayARN :: Lens' RetrieveTapeArchive Text

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRetrieveTapeArchiveResponse</a> smart constructor.
