instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.StorageGateway.RetrieveTapeArchive.RetrieveTapeArchive


-- | Resets all cache disks that have encountered an error and makes the
--   disks available for reconfiguration as cache storage. If your cache
--   disk encounters an error, the gateway prevents read and write
--   operations on virtual tapes in the gateway. For example, an error can
--   occur when a disk is corrupted or removed from the gateway. When a
--   cache is reset, the gateway loses its cache storage. At this point,
--   you can reconfigure the disks as cache disks. This operation is only
--   supported in the cached volume and tape types.
--   
--   If the cache disk you are resetting contains data that has not been
--   uploaded to Amazon S3 yet, that data can be lost. After you reset
--   cache disks, there will be no configured cache disks left in the
--   gateway, so you must configure at least one new cache disk for your
--   gateway to function properly.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ResetCache

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newResetCache</a> smart constructor.
data ResetCache
ResetCache' :: Text -> ResetCache
[$sel:gatewayARN:ResetCache'] :: ResetCache -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResetCache</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:ResetCache'</a>, <a>resetCache_gatewayARN</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
newResetCache :: Text -> ResetCache

-- | Undocumented member.
resetCache_gatewayARN :: Lens' ResetCache Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newResetCacheResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ResetCacheResponse
ResetCacheResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> ResetCacheResponse
[$sel:gatewayARN:ResetCacheResponse'] :: ResetCacheResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ResetCacheResponse'] :: ResetCacheResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ResetCacheResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:ResetCache'</a>,
--   <a>resetCacheResponse_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ResetCacheResponse'</a>,
--   <a>resetCacheResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newResetCacheResponse :: Int -> ResetCacheResponse

-- | Undocumented member.
resetCacheResponse_gatewayARN :: Lens' ResetCacheResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
resetCacheResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ResetCacheResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ResetCache.ResetCache
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ResetCache.ResetCache
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ResetCache.ResetCache
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ResetCache.ResetCache

-- | Removes one or more tags from the specified resource. This operation
--   is supported in storage gateways of all types.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.RemoveTagsFromResource

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRemoveTagsFromResource</a> smart constructor.

-- | Refreshes the cached inventory of objects for the specified file
--   share. This operation finds objects in the Amazon S3 bucket that were
--   added, removed, or replaced since the gateway last listed the bucket's
--   contents and cached the results. This operation does not import files
--   into the S3 File Gateway cache storage. It only updates the cached
--   inventory to reflect changes in the inventory of the objects in the S3
--   bucket. This operation is only supported in the S3 File Gateway types.
--   
--   You can subscribe to be notified through an Amazon CloudWatch event
--   when your <tt>RefreshCache</tt> operation completes. For more
--   information, see <a>Getting notified about file operations</a> in the
--   <i>Storage Gateway User Guide</i>. This operation is Only supported
--   for S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   When this API is called, it only initiates the refresh operation. When
--   the API call completes and returns a success code, it doesn't
--   necessarily mean that the file refresh has completed. You should use
--   the refresh-complete notification to determine that the operation has
--   completed before you check for new files on the gateway file share.
--   You can subscribe to be notified through a CloudWatch event when your
--   <tt>RefreshCache</tt> operation completes.
--   
--   Throttle limit: This API is asynchronous, so the gateway will accept
--   no more than two refreshes at any time. We recommend using the
--   refresh-complete CloudWatch event notification before issuing
--   additional requests. For more information, see <a>Getting notified
--   about file operations</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you invoke the RefreshCache API when two requests are already being
--   processed, any new request will cause an
--   <tt>InvalidGatewayRequestException</tt> error because too many
--   requests were sent to the server.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Getting notified about file
--   operations</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.RefreshCache

-- | RefreshCacheInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRefreshCache</a> smart constructor.
data RefreshCache
RefreshCache' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> RefreshCache

-- | A comma-separated list of the paths of folders to refresh in the
--   cache. The default is [<tt>"/"</tt>]. The default refreshes objects
--   and folders at the root of the Amazon S3 bucket. If <tt>Recursive</tt>
--   is set to <tt>true</tt>, the entire S3 bucket that the file share has
--   access to is refreshed.
[$sel:folderList:RefreshCache'] :: RefreshCache -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A value that specifies whether to recursively refresh folders in the
--   cache. The refresh includes folders that were in the cache the last
--   time the gateway listed the folder's contents. If this value set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, each folder that is listed in <tt>FolderList</tt> is
--   recursively updated. Otherwise, subfolders listed in
--   <tt>FolderList</tt> are not refreshed. Only objects that are in
--   folders listed directly under <tt>FolderList</tt> are found and used
--   for the update. The default is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:recursive:RefreshCache'] :: RefreshCache -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share you want to refresh.
[$sel:fileShareARN:RefreshCache'] :: RefreshCache -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RefreshCache</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:folderList:RefreshCache'</a>, <a>refreshCache_folderList</a> -
--   A comma-separated list of the paths of folders to refresh in the
--   cache. The default is [<tt>"/"</tt>]. The default refreshes objects
--   and folders at the root of the Amazon S3 bucket. If <tt>Recursive</tt>
--   is set to <tt>true</tt>, the entire S3 bucket that the file share has
--   access to is refreshed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recursive:RefreshCache'</a>, <a>refreshCache_recursive</a> - A
--   value that specifies whether to recursively refresh folders in the
--   cache. The refresh includes folders that were in the cache the last
--   time the gateway listed the folder's contents. If this value set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, each folder that is listed in <tt>FolderList</tt> is
--   recursively updated. Otherwise, subfolders listed in
--   <tt>FolderList</tt> are not refreshed. Only objects that are in
--   folders listed directly under <tt>FolderList</tt> are found and used
--   for the update. The default is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareARN:RefreshCache'</a>,
--   <a>refreshCache_fileShareARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the file share you want to refresh.
newRefreshCache :: Text -> RefreshCache

-- | A comma-separated list of the paths of folders to refresh in the
--   cache. The default is [<tt>"/"</tt>]. The default refreshes objects
--   and folders at the root of the Amazon S3 bucket. If <tt>Recursive</tt>
--   is set to <tt>true</tt>, the entire S3 bucket that the file share has
--   access to is refreshed.
refreshCache_folderList :: Lens' RefreshCache (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A value that specifies whether to recursively refresh folders in the
--   cache. The refresh includes folders that were in the cache the last
--   time the gateway listed the folder's contents. If this value set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, each folder that is listed in <tt>FolderList</tt> is
--   recursively updated. Otherwise, subfolders listed in
--   <tt>FolderList</tt> are not refreshed. Only objects that are in
--   folders listed directly under <tt>FolderList</tt> are found and used
--   for the update. The default is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
refreshCache_recursive :: Lens' RefreshCache (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share you want to refresh.
refreshCache_fileShareARN :: Lens' RefreshCache Text

-- | RefreshCacheOutput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRefreshCacheResponse</a> smart constructor.

RefreshCacheResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> RefreshCacheResponse

-- | Sends you notification through CloudWatch Events when all files
--   written to your file share have been uploaded to Amazon S3.
--   
--   Storage Gateway can send a notification through Amazon CloudWatch
--   Events when all files written to your file share up to that point in
--   time have been uploaded to Amazon S3. These files include files
--   written to the file share up to the time that you make a request for
--   notification. When the upload is done, Storage Gateway sends you
--   notification through an Amazon CloudWatch Event. You can configure
--   CloudWatch Events to send the notification through event targets such
--   as Amazon SNS or Lambda function. This operation is only supported for
--   S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Getting file upload notification</a> in
--   the <i>Storage Gateway User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.NotifyWhenUploaded

-- | Lists the iSCSI stored volumes of a gateway. Results are sorted by
--   volume ARN. The response includes only the volume ARNs. If you want
--   additional volume information, use the DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes or
--   the DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes API.
--   
--   The operation supports pagination. By default, the operation returns a
--   maximum of up to 100 volumes. You can optionally specify the
--   <tt>Limit</tt> field in the body to limit the number of volumes in the
--   response. If the number of volumes returned in the response is
--   truncated, the response includes a Marker field. You can use this
--   Marker value in your subsequent request to retrieve the next set of
--   volumes. This operation is only supported in the cached volume and
--   stored volume gateway types.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ListVolumes

-- | A JSON object that contains one or more of the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ListVolumesInput$Limit</li>
--   <li>ListVolumesInput$Marker</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListVolumes</a> smart constructor.
data ListVolumes
ListVolumes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListVolumes
[$sel:gatewayARN:ListVolumes'] :: ListVolumes -> Maybe Text

-- | A string that indicates the position at which to begin the returned
--   list of volumes. Obtain the marker from the response of a previous
--   List iSCSI Volumes request.
[$sel:marker:ListVolumes'] :: ListVolumes -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies that the list of volumes returned be limited to the
--   specified number of items.
[$sel:limit:ListVolumes'] :: ListVolumes -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListVolumes</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:ListVolumes'</a>, <a>listVolumes_gatewayARN</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:ListVolumes'</a>, <a>listVolumes_marker</a> - A string
--   that indicates the position at which to begin the returned list of
--   volumes. Obtain the marker from the response of a previous List iSCSI
--   Volumes request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limit:ListVolumes'</a>, <a>listVolumes_limit</a> - Specifies
--   that the list of volumes returned be limited to the specified number
--   of items.
newListVolumes :: ListVolumes

-- | Undocumented member.
listVolumes_gatewayARN :: Lens' ListVolumes (Maybe Text)

-- | A string that indicates the position at which to begin the returned
--   list of volumes. Obtain the marker from the response of a previous
--   List iSCSI Volumes request.
listVolumes_marker :: Lens' ListVolumes (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies that the list of volumes returned be limited to the
--   specified number of items.
listVolumes_limit :: Lens' ListVolumes (Maybe Natural)

-- | A JSON object containing the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ListVolumesOutput$Marker</li>
--   <li>ListVolumesOutput$VolumeInfos</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListVolumesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListVolumesResponse
ListVolumesResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [VolumeInfo] -> Int -> ListVolumesResponse
[$sel:gatewayARN:ListVolumesResponse'] :: ListVolumesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Use the marker in your next request to continue pagination of iSCSI
--   volumes. If there are no more volumes to list, this field does not
--   appear in the response body.
[$sel:marker:ListVolumesResponse'] :: ListVolumesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of VolumeInfo objects, where each object describes an iSCSI
--   volume. If no volumes are defined for the gateway, then
--   <tt>VolumeInfos</tt> is an empty array "[]".
[$sel:volumeInfos:ListVolumesResponse'] :: ListVolumesResponse -> Maybe [VolumeInfo]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListVolumesResponse'] :: ListVolumesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListVolumesResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>listVolumesResponse_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:ListVolumes'</a>, <a>listVolumesResponse_marker</a> -
--   Use the marker in your next request to continue pagination of iSCSI
--   volumes. If there are no more volumes to list, this field does not
--   appear in the response body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeInfos:ListVolumesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listVolumesResponse_volumeInfos</a> - An array of VolumeInfo
--   objects, where each object describes an iSCSI volume. If no volumes
--   are defined for the gateway, then <tt>VolumeInfos</tt> is an empty
--   array "[]".
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListVolumesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listVolumesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status

-- | Lists the recovery points for a specified gateway. This operation is
--   only supported in the cached volume gateway type.
--   
--   Each cache volume has one recovery point. A volume recovery point is a
--   point in time at which all data of the volume is consistent and from
--   which you can create a snapshot or clone a new cached volume from a
--   source volume. To create a snapshot from a volume recovery point use
--   the CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint operation.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ListVolumeRecoveryPoints

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListVolumeRecoveryPoints</a> smart constructor.
data ListVolumeRecoveryPoints
ListVolumeRecoveryPoints' :: Text -> ListVolumeRecoveryPoints
[$sel:gatewayARN:ListVolumeRecoveryPoints'] :: ListVolumeRecoveryPoints -> Text

--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:ListVolumeRecoveryPoints'</a>,
--   <a>listVolumeRecoveryPoints_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
newListVolumeRecoveryPoints :: Text -> ListVolumeRecoveryPoints

-- | Undocumented member.
listVolumeRecoveryPoints_gatewayARN :: Lens' ListVolumeRecoveryPoints Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListVolumeRecoveryPointsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | Lists virtual tapes in your virtual tape library (VTL) and your
--   virtual tape shelf (VTS). You specify the tapes to list by specifying
--   one or more tape Amazon Resource Names (ARNs). If you don't specify a
--   tape ARN, the operation lists all virtual tapes in both your VTL and
--   VTS.
--   
--   This operation supports pagination. By default, the operation returns
--   a maximum of up to 100 tapes. You can optionally specify the
--   <tt>Limit</tt> parameter in the body to limit the number of tapes in
--   the response. If the number of tapes returned in the response is
--   truncated, the response includes a <tt>Marker</tt> element that you
--   can use in your subsequent request to retrieve the next set of tapes.
--   This operation is only supported in the tape gateway type.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ListTapes

-- | A JSON object that contains one or more of the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ListTapesInput$Limit</li>
--   <li>ListTapesInput$Marker</li>
--   <li>ListTapesInput$TapeARNs</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListTapes</a> smart constructor.

-- | Lists custom tape pools. You specify custom tape pools to list by
--   specifying one or more custom tape pool Amazon Resource Names (ARNs).
--   If you don't specify a custom tape pool ARN, the operation lists all
--   custom tape pools.
--   
--   This operation supports pagination. You can optionally specify the
--   <tt>Limit</tt> parameter in the body to limit the number of tape pools
--   in the response. If the number of tape pools returned in the response
--   is truncated, the response includes a <tt>Marker</tt> element that you
--   can use in your subsequent request to retrieve the next set of tape
--   pools.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | Lists the tags that have been added to the specified resource. This
--   operation is supported in storage gateways of all types.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ListTagsForResource

-- | ListTagsForResourceInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListTagsForResource</a> smart constructor.
data ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListTagsForResource

-- | An opaque string that indicates the position at which to begin
--   returning the list of tags.
[$sel:marker:ListTagsForResource'] :: ListTagsForResource -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies that the list of tags returned be limited to the specified
--   number of items.
[$sel:limit:ListTagsForResource'] :: ListTagsForResource -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource for which you want to
--   list tags.
[$sel:resourceARN:ListTagsForResource'] :: ListTagsForResource -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTagsForResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:ListTagsForResource'</a>,
--   <a>listTagsForResource_marker</a> - An opaque string that indicates
--   the position at which to begin returning the list of tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limit:ListTagsForResource'</a>,
--   <a>listTagsForResource_limit</a> - Specifies that the list of tags
--   returned be limited to the specified number of items.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceARN:ListTagsForResource'</a>,
--   <a>listTagsForResource_resourceARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the resource for which you want to list tags.
newListTagsForResource :: Text -> ListTagsForResource

-- | An opaque string that indicates the position at which to begin
--   returning the list of tags.
listTagsForResource_marker :: Lens' ListTagsForResource (Maybe Text)

-- | Returns a list of the gateway's local disks. To specify which gateway
--   to describe, you use the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway in
--   the body of the request.
--   
--   The request returns a list of all disks, specifying which are
--   configured as working storage, cache storage, or stored volume or not
--   configured at all. The response includes a <tt>DiskStatus</tt> field.
--   This field can have a value of present (the disk is available to use),
--   missing (the disk is no longer connected to the gateway), or mismatch
--   (the disk node is occupied by a disk that has incorrect metadata or
--   the disk content is corrupted).
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ListLocalDisks

--   gateway.

-- | Lists gateways owned by an account in an Region specified in the
--   request. The returned list is ordered by gateway Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN).
--   
--   By default, the operation returns a maximum of 100 gateways. This
--   operation supports pagination that allows you to optionally reduce the
--   number of gateways returned in a response.
--   
--   If you have more gateways than are returned in a response (that is,
--   the response returns only a truncated list of your gateways), the
--   response contains a marker that you can specify in your next request
--   to fetch the next page of gateways.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ListGateways

--   operation is only supported for S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListFileShares</a> smart constructor.

-- | If the request includes <tt>Marker</tt>, the response returns that
--   value in this field.
[$sel:marker:ListFileSharesResponse'] :: ListFileSharesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | If a value is present, there are more file shares to return. In a
--   subsequent request, use <tt>NextMarker</tt> as the value for
--   <tt>Marker</tt> to retrieve the next set of file shares.
[$sel:nextMarker:ListFileSharesResponse'] :: ListFileSharesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListFileSharesResponse'] :: ListFileSharesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListFileSharesResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareInfoList:ListFileSharesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listFileSharesResponse_fileShareInfoList</a> - An array of
--   information about the S3 File Gateway's file shares.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:ListFileShares'</a>,
--   <a>listFileSharesResponse_marker</a> - If the request includes
--   <tt>Marker</tt>, the response returns that value in this field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextMarker:ListFileSharesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listFileSharesResponse_nextMarker</a> - If a value is present,
--   there are more file shares to return. In a subsequent request, use
--   <tt>NextMarker</tt> as the value for <tt>Marker</tt> to retrieve the
--   next set of file shares.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListFileSharesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listFileSharesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newListFileSharesResponse :: Int -> ListFileSharesResponse

-- | An array of information about the S3 File Gateway's file shares.
listFileSharesResponse_fileShareInfoList :: Lens' ListFileSharesResponse (Maybe [FileShareInfo])

-- | If the request includes <tt>Marker</tt>, the response returns that
--   value in this field.

-- | Lists the automatic tape creation policies for a gateway. If there are
--   no automatic tape creation policies for the gateway, it returns an
--   empty list.
--   
--   This operation is only supported for tape gateways.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ListAutomaticTapeCreationPolicies

--   constructor.

-- | Adds a file gateway to an Active Directory domain. This operation is
--   only supported for file gateways that support the SMB file protocol.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.JoinDomain

-- | JoinDomainInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJoinDomain</a> smart constructor.
data JoinDomain
JoinDomain' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Sensitive Text -> JoinDomain

-- | The organizational unit (OU) is a container in an Active Directory
--   that can hold users, groups, computers, and other OUs and this
--   parameter specifies the OU that the gateway will join within the AD
--   domain.
[$sel:organizationalUnit:JoinDomain'] :: JoinDomain -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the time in seconds, in which the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation must complete. The default is 20 seconds.
[$sel:timeoutInSeconds:JoinDomain'] :: JoinDomain -> Maybe Natural

-- | List of IPv4 addresses, NetBIOS names, or host names of your domain
--   server. If you need to specify the port number include it after the
--   colon (:). For example, <tt>mydc.mydomain.com:389</tt>.
[$sel:domainControllers:JoinDomain'] :: JoinDomain -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the
--   <tt>ListGateways</tt> operation to return a list of gateways for your
--   account and Region.
[$sel:gatewayARN:JoinDomain'] :: JoinDomain -> Text

-- | The name of the domain that you want the gateway to join.
[$sel:domainName:JoinDomain'] :: JoinDomain -> Text

-- | Sets the user name of user who has permission to add the gateway to
--   the Active Directory domain. The domain user account should be enabled
--   to join computers to the domain. For example, you can use the domain
--   administrator account or an account with delegated permissions to join
--   computers to the domain.
[$sel:userName:JoinDomain'] :: JoinDomain -> Text

-- | Sets the password of the user who has permission to add the gateway to
--   the Active Directory domain.
[$sel:password:JoinDomain'] :: JoinDomain -> Sensitive Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JoinDomain</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnit:JoinDomain'</a>,
--   <a>joinDomain_organizationalUnit</a> - The organizational unit (OU) is
--   a container in an Active Directory that can hold users, groups,
--   computers, and other OUs and this parameter specifies the OU that the
--   gateway will join within the AD domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutInSeconds:JoinDomain'</a>,
--   <a>joinDomain_timeoutInSeconds</a> - Specifies the time in seconds, in
--   which the <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation must complete. The default is
--   20 seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainControllers:JoinDomain'</a>,
--   <a>joinDomain_domainControllers</a> - List of IPv4 addresses, NetBIOS
--   names, or host names of your domain server. If you need to specify the
--   port number include it after the colon (:). For example,
--   <tt>mydc.mydomain.com:389</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:JoinDomain'</a>, <a>joinDomain_gatewayARN</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the
--   <tt>ListGateways</tt> operation to return a list of gateways for your
--   account and Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainName:JoinDomain'</a>, <a>joinDomain_domainName</a> - The
--   name of the domain that you want the gateway to join.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:JoinDomain'</a>, <a>joinDomain_userName</a> - Sets
--   the user name of user who has permission to add the gateway to the
--   Active Directory domain. The domain user account should be enabled to
--   join computers to the domain. For example, you can use the domain
--   administrator account or an account with delegated permissions to join
--   computers to the domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:JoinDomain'</a>, <a>joinDomain_password</a> - Sets
--   the password of the user who has permission to add the gateway to the
--   Active Directory domain.
newJoinDomain :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> JoinDomain

-- | The organizational unit (OU) is a container in an Active Directory
--   that can hold users, groups, computers, and other OUs and this
--   parameter specifies the OU that the gateway will join within the AD
--   domain.
joinDomain_organizationalUnit :: Lens' JoinDomain (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the time in seconds, in which the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation must complete. The default is 20 seconds.
joinDomain_timeoutInSeconds :: Lens' JoinDomain (Maybe Natural)

-- | List of IPv4 addresses, NetBIOS names, or host names of your domain
--   server. If you need to specify the port number include it after the
--   colon (:). For example, <tt>mydc.mydomain.com:389</tt>.
joinDomain_domainControllers :: Lens' JoinDomain (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the
--   <tt>ListGateways</tt> operation to return a list of gateways for your
--   account and Region.
joinDomain_gatewayARN :: Lens' JoinDomain Text

-- | The name of the domain that you want the gateway to join.
joinDomain_domainName :: Lens' JoinDomain Text

-- | Sets the user name of user who has permission to add the gateway to
--   the Active Directory domain. The domain user account should be enabled
--   to join computers to the domain. For example, you can use the domain
--   administrator account or an account with delegated permissions to join
--   computers to the domain.
joinDomain_userName :: Lens' JoinDomain Text

-- | Sets the password of the user who has permission to add the gateway to
--   the Active Directory domain.
joinDomain_password :: Lens' JoinDomain Text

-- | JoinDomainOutput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJoinDomainResponse</a> smart constructor.
data JoinDomainResponse
JoinDomainResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ActiveDirectoryStatus -> Int -> JoinDomainResponse

-- | The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway that joined the
--   domain.
[$sel:gatewayARN:JoinDomainResponse'] :: JoinDomainResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates the status of the gateway as a member of the Active
--   Directory domain.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACCESS_DENIED</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to an authentication error.</li>
--   <li><tt>DETACHED</tt>: Indicates that gateway is not joined to a
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINED</tt>: Indicates that the gateway has successfully
--   joined a domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINING</tt>: Indicates that a <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation
--   is in progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>NETWORK_ERROR</tt>: Indicates that <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to a network or connectivity error.</li>
--   <li><tt>TIMEOUT</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation
--   failed because the operation didn't complete within the allotted
--   time.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN_ERROR</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to another type of error.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:activeDirectoryStatus:JoinDomainResponse'] :: JoinDomainResponse -> Maybe ActiveDirectoryStatus

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:JoinDomainResponse'] :: JoinDomainResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>JoinDomainResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:JoinDomain'</a>,
--   <a>joinDomainResponse_gatewayARN</a> - The unique Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the gateway that joined the domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activeDirectoryStatus:JoinDomainResponse'</a>,
--   <a>joinDomainResponse_activeDirectoryStatus</a> - Indicates the status
--   of the gateway as a member of the Active Directory domain.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACCESS_DENIED</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to an authentication error.</li>
--   <li><tt>DETACHED</tt>: Indicates that gateway is not joined to a
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINED</tt>: Indicates that the gateway has successfully
--   joined a domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINING</tt>: Indicates that a <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation
--   is in progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>NETWORK_ERROR</tt>: Indicates that <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to a network or connectivity error.</li>
--   <li><tt>TIMEOUT</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation
--   failed because the operation didn't complete within the allotted
--   time.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN_ERROR</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to another type of error.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:JoinDomainResponse'</a>,
--   <a>joinDomainResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newJoinDomainResponse :: Int -> JoinDomainResponse

-- | The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway that joined the
--   domain.
joinDomainResponse_gatewayARN :: Lens' JoinDomainResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates the status of the gateway as a member of the Active
--   Directory domain.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACCESS_DENIED</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to an authentication error.</li>

--   domain.</li>

--   joined a domain.</li>

-- | Disassociates an Amazon FSx file system from the specified gateway.
--   After the disassociation process finishes, the gateway can no longer
--   access the Amazon FSx file system. This operation is only supported in
--   the FSx File Gateway type.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DisassociateFileSystem

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisassociateFileSystem</a> smart constructor.
data DisassociateFileSystem
DisassociateFileSystem' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> DisassociateFileSystem

-- | If this value is set to true, the operation disassociates an Amazon
--   FSx file system immediately. It ends all data uploads to the file
--   system, and the file system association enters the
--   <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> status. If this value is set to false, the
--   Amazon FSx file system does not disassociate until all data is
--   uploaded.
[$sel:forceDelete:DisassociateFileSystem'] :: DisassociateFileSystem -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file system association to be
--   deleted.
[$sel:fileSystemAssociationARN:DisassociateFileSystem'] :: DisassociateFileSystem -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DisassociateFileSystem</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceDelete:DisassociateFileSystem'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateFileSystem_forceDelete</a> - If this value is set to
--   true, the operation disassociates an Amazon FSx file system
--   immediately. It ends all data uploads to the file system, and the file
--   system association enters the <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> status. If this
--   value is set to false, the Amazon FSx file system does not
--   disassociate until all data is uploaded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileSystemAssociationARN:DisassociateFileSystem'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateFileSystem_fileSystemAssociationARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the file system association to be deleted.
newDisassociateFileSystem :: Text -> DisassociateFileSystem

-- | If this value is set to true, the operation disassociates an Amazon
--   FSx file system immediately. It ends all data uploads to the file
--   system, and the file system association enters the
--   <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> status. If this value is set to false, the
--   Amazon FSx file system does not disassociate until all data is
--   uploaded.
disassociateFileSystem_forceDelete :: Lens' DisassociateFileSystem (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file system association to be
--   deleted.
disassociateFileSystem_fileSystemAssociationARN :: Lens' DisassociateFileSystem Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisassociateFileSystemResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DisassociateFileSystemResponse
DisassociateFileSystemResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> DisassociateFileSystemResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the deleted file system association.
[$sel:fileSystemAssociationARN:DisassociateFileSystemResponse'] :: DisassociateFileSystemResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DisassociateFileSystemResponse'] :: DisassociateFileSystemResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DisassociateFileSystemResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileSystemAssociationARN:DisassociateFileSystem'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateFileSystemResponse_fileSystemAssociationARN</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the deleted file system association.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DisassociateFileSystemResponse'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateFileSystemResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDisassociateFileSystemResponse :: Int -> DisassociateFileSystemResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the deleted file system association.
disassociateFileSystemResponse_fileSystemAssociationARN :: Lens' DisassociateFileSystemResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
disassociateFileSystemResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DisassociateFileSystemResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DisassociateFileSystem.DisassociateFileSystem
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DisassociateFileSystem.DisassociateFileSystem
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DisassociateFileSystem.DisassociateFileSystem
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DisassociateFileSystem.DisassociateFileSystem

-- | Disables a tape gateway when the gateway is no longer functioning. For
--   example, if your gateway VM is damaged, you can disable the gateway so
--   you can recover virtual tapes.
--   
--   Use this operation for a tape gateway that is not reachable or not
--   functioning. This operation is only supported in the tape gateway
--   type.
--   
--   After a gateway is disabled, it cannot be enabled.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DisableGateway

-- | DisableGatewayInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDisableGateway</a> smart constructor.
data DisableGateway

-- | Disconnects a volume from an iSCSI connection and then detaches the
--   volume from the specified gateway. Detaching and attaching a volume
--   enables you to recover your data from one gateway to a different
--   gateway without creating a snapshot. It also makes it easier to move
--   your volumes from an on-premises gateway to a gateway hosted on an
--   Amazon EC2 instance. This operation is only supported in the volume
--   gateway type.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DetachVolume

-- | AttachVolumeInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDetachVolume</a> smart constructor.
data DetachVolume
DetachVolume' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> DetachVolume

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to forcibly remove the iSCSI connection of the
--   target volume and detach the volume. The default is <tt>false</tt>. If
--   this value is set to <tt>false</tt>, you must manually disconnect the
--   iSCSI connection from the target volume.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:forceDetach:DetachVolume'] :: DetachVolume -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume to detach from the
--   gateway.
[$sel:volumeARN:DetachVolume'] :: DetachVolume -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DetachVolume</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceDetach:DetachVolume'</a>, <a>detachVolume_forceDetach</a>
--   - Set to <tt>true</tt> to forcibly remove the iSCSI connection of the
--   target volume and detach the volume. The default is <tt>false</tt>. If
--   this value is set to <tt>false</tt>, you must manually disconnect the
--   iSCSI connection from the target volume.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeARN:DetachVolume'</a>, <a>detachVolume_volumeARN</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume to detach from the
--   gateway.
newDetachVolume :: Text -> DetachVolume

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to forcibly remove the iSCSI connection of the
--   target volume and detach the volume. The default is <tt>false</tt>. If
--   this value is set to <tt>false</tt>, you must manually disconnect the
--   iSCSI connection from the target volume.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
detachVolume_forceDetach :: Lens' DetachVolume (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume to detach from the
--   gateway.
detachVolume_volumeARN :: Lens' DetachVolume Text

-- | AttachVolumeOutput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDetachVolumeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DetachVolumeResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DetachVolumeResponse'] :: DetachVolumeResponse -> Int

-- | Returns information about the working storage of a gateway. This
--   operation is only supported in the stored volumes gateway type. This
--   operation is deprecated in cached volumes API version (20120630). Use
--   DescribeUploadBuffer instead.
--   
--   Working storage is also referred to as upload buffer. You can also use
--   the DescribeUploadBuffer operation to add upload buffer to a stored
--   volume gateway.
--   
--   The response includes disk IDs that are configured as working storage,
--   and it includes the amount of working storage allocated and used.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeWorkingStorage

-- | A JSON object containing the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the
--   gateway.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeWorkingStorage</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeWorkingStorage

--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--

--   constructor.

[$sel:gatewayARN:DescribeWorkingStorageResponse'] :: DescribeWorkingStorageResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of the gateway's local disk IDs that are configured as
--   working storage. Each local disk ID is specified as a string (minimum
--   length of 1 and maximum length of 300). If no local disks are
--   configured as working storage, then the DiskIds array is empty.
[$sel:diskIds:DescribeWorkingStorageResponse'] :: DescribeWorkingStorageResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The total working storage in bytes allocated for the gateway. If no
--   working storage is configured for the gateway, this field returns 0.
[$sel:workingStorageAllocatedInBytes:DescribeWorkingStorageResponse'] :: DescribeWorkingStorageResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total working storage in bytes in use by the gateway. If no
--   working storage is configured for the gateway, this field returns 0.
[$sel:workingStorageUsedInBytes:DescribeWorkingStorageResponse'] :: DescribeWorkingStorageResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeWorkingStorageResponse'] :: DescribeWorkingStorageResponse -> Int

-- | Returns a description of virtual tape library (VTL) devices for the
--   specified tape gateway. In the response, Storage Gateway returns VTL
--   device information.
--   
--   This operation is only supported in the tape gateway type.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeVTLDevices

-- | DescribeVTLDevicesInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeVTLDevices</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeVTLDevices
DescribeVTLDevices' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> DescribeVTLDevices

-- | An opaque string that indicates the position at which to begin
--   describing the VTL devices.
[$sel:marker:DescribeVTLDevices'] :: DescribeVTLDevices -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies that the number of VTL devices described be limited to the
--   specified number.
[$sel:limit:DescribeVTLDevices'] :: DescribeVTLDevices -> Maybe Natural

-- | An array of strings, where each string represents the Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of a VTL device.
--   
--   All of the specified VTL devices must be from the same gateway. If no
--   VTL devices are specified, the result will contain all devices on the
--   specified gateway.
[$sel:vTLDeviceARNs:DescribeVTLDevices'] :: DescribeVTLDevices -> Maybe [Text]
[$sel:gatewayARN:DescribeVTLDevices'] :: DescribeVTLDevices -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeVTLDevices</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   position at which to begin describing the VTL devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limit:DescribeVTLDevices'</a>, <a>describeVTLDevices_limit</a>
--   - Specifies that the number of VTL devices described be limited to the
--   specified number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vTLDeviceARNs:DescribeVTLDevices'</a>,
--   <a>describeVTLDevices_vTLDeviceARNs</a> - An array of strings, where
--   each string represents the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a VTL device.
--   
--   All of the specified VTL devices must be from the same gateway. If no
--   VTL devices are specified, the result will contain all devices on the
--   specified gateway.

-- | Returns information about the upload buffer of a gateway. This
--   operation is supported for the stored volume, cached volume, and tape
--   gateway types.
--   
--   The response includes disk IDs that are configured as upload buffer
--   space, and it includes the amount of upload buffer space allocated and
--   used.

-- | Returns a description of the specified Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   virtual tapes. If a <tt>TapeARN</tt> is not specified, returns a
--   description of all virtual tapes associated with the specified
--   gateway. This operation is only supported in the tape gateway type.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeTapes

-- | DescribeTapesInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeTapes</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeTapes

--   This marker indicates which page of results to retrieve.
--   
--   If not specified, the first page of results is retrieved.
[$sel:marker:DescribeTapes'] :: DescribeTapes -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies that the number of virtual tapes described be limited to the
--   specified number.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services may impose its own limit, if this field is not
--   set.
[$sel:limit:DescribeTapes'] :: DescribeTapes -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies one or more unique Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) that
--   represent the virtual tapes you want to describe. If this parameter is
--   not specified, Tape gateway returns a description of all virtual tapes
--   associated with the specified gateway.
[$sel:tapeARNs:DescribeTapes'] :: DescribeTapes -> Maybe [Text]
[$sel:gatewayARN:DescribeTapes'] :: DescribeTapes -> Text

-- | Returns a list of virtual tape recovery points that are available for
--   the specified tape gateway.
--   
--   A recovery point is a point-in-time view of a virtual tape at which
--   all the data on the virtual tape is consistent. If your gateway
--   crashes, virtual tapes that have recovery points can be recovered to a
--   new gateway. This operation is only supported in the tape gateway
--   type.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints

-- | DescribeTapeRecoveryPointsInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeTapeRecoveryPoints</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints

--   describing the virtual tape recovery points.

-- | Specifies that the number of virtual tape recovery points that are
--   described be limited to the specified number.
[$sel:limit:DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints'] :: DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints -> Maybe Natural
[$sel:gatewayARN:DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints'] :: DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>describeTapeRecoveryPoints_marker</a> - An opaque string that
--   indicates the position at which to begin describing the virtual tape
--   recovery points.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limit:DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints'</a>,
--   <a>describeTapeRecoveryPoints_limit</a> - Specifies that the number of
--   virtual tape recovery points that are described be limited to the
--   specified number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints'</a>,
--   <a>describeTapeRecoveryPoints_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.

-- | Returns a description of specified virtual tapes in the virtual tape
--   shelf (VTS). This operation is only supported in the tape gateway
--   type.
--   
--   If a specific <tt>TapeARN</tt> is not specified, Storage Gateway
--   returns a description of all virtual tapes found in the VTS associated
--   with your account.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeTapeArchives

-- | DescribeTapeArchivesInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeTapeArchives</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeTapeArchives

-- | An array of virtual tape objects in the virtual tape shelf (VTS). The
--   description includes of the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual
--   tapes. The information returned includes the Amazon Resource Names
--   (ARNs) of the tapes, size of the tapes, status of the tapes, progress
--   of the description, and tape barcode.
[$sel:tapeArchives:DescribeTapeArchivesResponse'] :: DescribeTapeArchivesResponse -> Maybe [TapeArchive]

--   tapes that were fetched for description ended. Use this marker in your
--   next request to fetch the next set of virtual tapes in the virtual
--   tape shelf (VTS). If there are no more virtual tapes to describe, this
--   field does not appear in the response.
[$sel:marker:DescribeTapeArchivesResponse'] :: DescribeTapeArchivesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeTapeArchivesResponse'] :: DescribeTapeArchivesResponse -> Int

--   information returned includes the Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the
--   tapes, size of the tapes, status of the tapes, progress of the
--   description, and tape barcode.
--

-- | Returns the description of the gateway volumes specified in the
--   request. The list of gateway volumes in the request must be from one
--   gateway. In the response, Storage Gateway returns volume information
--   sorted by volume ARNs. This operation is only supported in stored
--   volume gateway type.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes

-- | A JSON object containing a list of
--   DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesInput$VolumeARNs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeStorediSCSIVolumes</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes' :: [Text] -> DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes

-- | An array of strings where each string represents the Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of a stored volume. All of the specified stored volumes
--   must be from the same gateway. Use ListVolumes to get volume ARNs for
--   a gateway.
[$sel:volumeARNs:DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes'] :: DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:volumeARNs:DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes'</a>,
--   <a>describeStorediSCSIVolumes_volumeARNs</a> - An array of strings
--   where each string represents the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a
--   stored volume. All of the specified stored volumes must be from the
--   same gateway. Use ListVolumes to get volume ARNs for a gateway.
newDescribeStorediSCSIVolumes :: DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes

--   Name (ARN) of a stored volume. All of the specified stored volumes
--   must be from the same gateway. Use ListVolumes to get volume ARNs for
--   a gateway.
describeStorediSCSIVolumes_volumeARNs :: Lens' DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes [Text]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse
DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse' :: Maybe [StorediSCSIVolume] -> Int -> DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse

-- | Describes a single unit of output from DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes. The
--   following fields are returned:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ChapEnabled</tt>: Indicates whether mutual CHAP is enabled for
--   the iSCSI target.</li>
--   <li><tt>LunNumber</tt>: The logical disk number.</li>
--   <li><tt>NetworkInterfaceId</tt>: The network interface ID of the
--   stored volume that initiator use to map the stored volume as an iSCSI
--   target.</li>
--   <li><tt>NetworkInterfacePort</tt>: The port used to communicate with
--   iSCSI targets.</li>
--   <li><tt>PreservedExistingData</tt>: Indicates when the stored volume
--   was created, existing data on the underlying local disk was
--   preserved.</li>
--   <li><tt>SourceSnapshotId</tt>: If the stored volume was created from a
--   snapshot, this field contains the snapshot ID used, e.g.
--   <tt>snap-1122aabb</tt>. Otherwise, this field is not included.</li>
--   <li><tt>StorediSCSIVolumes</tt>: An array of StorediSCSIVolume objects
--   where each object contains metadata about one stored volume.</li>
--   <li><tt>TargetARN</tt>: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume
--   target.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeARN</tt>: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the stored
--   volume.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeDiskId</tt>: The disk ID of the local disk that was
--   specified in the CreateStorediSCSIVolume operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeId</tt>: The unique identifier of the storage volume,
--   e.g. <tt>vol-1122AABB</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeiSCSIAttributes</tt>: An VolumeiSCSIAttributes object
--   that represents a collection of iSCSI attributes for one stored
--   volume.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeProgress</tt>: Represents the percentage complete if the
--   volume is restoring or bootstrapping that represents the percent of
--   data transferred. This field does not appear in the response if the
--   stored volume is not restoring or bootstrapping.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeSizeInBytes</tt>: The size of the volume in bytes.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeStatus</tt>: One of the <tt>VolumeStatus</tt> values
--   that indicates the state of the volume.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeType</tt>: One of the enumeration values describing the
--   type of the volume. Currently, only <tt>STORED</tt> volumes are
--   supported.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:storediSCSIVolumes:DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse'] :: DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse -> Maybe [StorediSCSIVolume]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse'] :: DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse -> Int

-- | Describes the snapshot schedule for the specified gateway volume. The
--   snapshot schedule information includes intervals at which snapshots
--   are automatically initiated on the volume. This operation is only
--   supported in the cached volume and stored volume types.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeSnapshotSchedule

--   of the volume.

-- | Gets a description of a Server Message Block (SMB) file share settings
--   from a file gateway. This operation is only supported for file
--   gateways.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeSMBSettings

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeSMBSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeSMBSettings
DescribeSMBSettings' :: Text -> DescribeSMBSettings
[$sel:gatewayARN:DescribeSMBSettings'] :: DescribeSMBSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeSMBSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:DescribeSMBSettings'</a>,
--   <a>describeSMBSettings_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
newDescribeSMBSettings :: Text -> DescribeSMBSettings

-- | Undocumented member.
describeSMBSettings_gatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeSMBSettings Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeSMBSettingsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeSMBSettingsResponse
DescribeSMBSettingsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ActiveDirectoryStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe SMBSecurityStrategy -> Int -> DescribeSMBSettingsResponse
[$sel:gatewayARN:DescribeSMBSettingsResponse'] :: DescribeSMBSettingsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The shares on this gateway appear when listing shares. Only supported
--   for S3 File Gateways.
[$sel:fileSharesVisible:DescribeSMBSettingsResponse'] :: DescribeSMBSettingsResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Indicates the status of a gateway that is a member of the Active
--   Directory domain.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACCESS_DENIED</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to an authentication error.</li>
--   <li><tt>DETACHED</tt>: Indicates that gateway is not joined to a
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINED</tt>: Indicates that the gateway has successfully
--   joined a domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINING</tt>: Indicates that a <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation
--   is in progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>NETWORK_ERROR</tt>: Indicates that <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to a network or connectivity error.</li>
--   <li><tt>TIMEOUT</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation
--   failed because the operation didn't complete within the allotted
--   time.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN_ERROR</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to another type of error.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:activeDirectoryStatus:DescribeSMBSettingsResponse'] :: DescribeSMBSettingsResponse -> Maybe ActiveDirectoryStatus

-- | The name of the domain that the gateway is joined to.
[$sel:domainName:DescribeSMBSettingsResponse'] :: DescribeSMBSettingsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | This value is <tt>true</tt> if a password for the guest user
--   <tt>smbguest</tt> is set, otherwise <tt>false</tt>. Only supported for
--   S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:sMBGuestPasswordSet:DescribeSMBSettingsResponse'] :: DescribeSMBSettingsResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of security strategy that was specified for file gateway.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ClientSpecified</tt>: If you use this option, requests are
--   established based on what is negotiated by the client. This option is
--   recommended when you want to maximize compatibility across different
--   clients in your environment. Only supported for S3 File Gateways.</li>
--   <li><tt>MandatorySigning</tt>: If you use this option, file gateway
--   only allows connections from SMBv2 or SMBv3 clients that have signing
--   enabled. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows
--   Vista, Windows Server 2008 or newer.</li>
--   <li><tt>MandatoryEncryption</tt>: If you use this option, file gateway
--   only allows connections from SMBv3 clients that have encryption
--   enabled. This option is highly recommended for environments that
--   handle sensitive data. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft
--   Windows 8, Windows Server 2012 or newer.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:sMBSecurityStrategy:DescribeSMBSettingsResponse'] :: DescribeSMBSettingsResponse -> Maybe SMBSecurityStrategy

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeSMBSettingsResponse'] :: DescribeSMBSettingsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeSMBSettingsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:DescribeSMBSettings'</a>,

--   this gateway appear when listing shares. Only supported for S3 File
--   Gateways.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activeDirectoryStatus:DescribeSMBSettingsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeSMBSettingsResponse_activeDirectoryStatus</a> - Indicates
--   the status of a gateway that is a member of the Active Directory
--   domain.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACCESS_DENIED</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to an authentication error.</li>
--   <li><tt>DETACHED</tt>: Indicates that gateway is not joined to a
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINED</tt>: Indicates that the gateway has successfully
--   joined a domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINING</tt>: Indicates that a <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation
--   is in progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>NETWORK_ERROR</tt>: Indicates that <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to a network or connectivity error.</li>
--   <li><tt>TIMEOUT</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation
--   failed because the operation didn't complete within the allotted
--   time.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN_ERROR</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to another type of error.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainName:DescribeSMBSettingsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeSMBSettingsResponse_domainName</a> - The name of the domain
--   that the gateway is joined to.
--

--   <a>describeSMBSettingsResponse_sMBGuestPasswordSet</a> - This value is
--   <tt>true</tt> if a password for the guest user <tt>smbguest</tt> is
--   set, otherwise <tt>false</tt>. Only supported for S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sMBSecurityStrategy:DescribeSMBSettingsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeSMBSettingsResponse_sMBSecurityStrategy</a> - The type of
--   security strategy that was specified for file gateway.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ClientSpecified</tt>: If you use this option, requests are
--   established based on what is negotiated by the client. This option is
--   recommended when you want to maximize compatibility across different
--   clients in your environment. Only supported for S3 File Gateways.</li>
--   <li><tt>MandatorySigning</tt>: If you use this option, file gateway
--   only allows connections from SMBv2 or SMBv3 clients that have signing
--   enabled. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows
--   Vista, Windows Server 2008 or newer.</li>
--   <li><tt>MandatoryEncryption</tt>: If you use this option, file gateway
--   only allows connections from SMBv3 clients that have encryption
--   enabled. This option is highly recommended for environments that
--   handle sensitive data. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft
--   Windows 8, Windows Server 2012 or newer.</li>
--   </ul>

-- | Returns your gateway's weekly maintenance start time including the day
--   and time of the week. Note that values are in terms of the gateway's
--   time zone.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeMaintenanceStartTime

-- | A JSON object containing the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the
--   gateway.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeMaintenanceStartTime</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeMaintenanceStartTime

-- | The minute component of the maintenance start time represented as
--   <i>mm</i>, where <i>mm</i> is the minute (0 to 59). The minute of the
--   hour is in the time zone of the gateway.
[$sel:minuteOfHour:DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse'] :: DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse -> Maybe Natural

-- | The day of the month component of the maintenance start time
--   represented as an ordinal number from 1 to 28, where 1 represents the
--   first day of the month and 28 represents the last day of the month.
[$sel:dayOfMonth:DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse'] :: DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse -> Maybe Natural

-- | The hour component of the maintenance start time represented as
--   <i>hh</i>, where <i>hh</i> is the hour (0 to 23). The hour of the day
--   is in the time zone of the gateway.
[$sel:hourOfDay:DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse'] :: DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse -> Maybe Natural

-- | A value that indicates the time zone that is set for the gateway. The
--   start time and day of week specified should be in the time zone of the
--   gateway.
[$sel:timezone:DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse'] :: DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An ordinal number between 0 and 6 that represents the day of the week,
--   where 0 represents Sunday and 6 represents Saturday. The day of week
--   is in the time zone of the gateway.
[$sel:dayOfWeek:DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse'] :: DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse -> Maybe Natural

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse'] :: DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse -> Int

-- | Returns metadata about a gateway such as its name, network interfaces,
--   configured time zone, and the state (whether the gateway is running or
--   not). To specify which gateway to describe, use the Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the gateway in your request.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeGatewayInformation

-- | A JSON object containing the ID of the gateway.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeGatewayInformation</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeGatewayInformation
DescribeGatewayInformation' :: Text -> DescribeGatewayInformation

-- | Returns an array of Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP)
--   credentials information for a specified iSCSI target, one for each
--   target-initiator pair. This operation is supported in the volume and
--   tape gateway types.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeChapCredentials

-- | A JSON object containing the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the iSCSI
--   volume target.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeChapCredentials</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeChapCredentials
DescribeChapCredentials' :: Text -> DescribeChapCredentials

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the iSCSI volume target. Use the
--   DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes operation to return to retrieve the
--   TargetARN for specified VolumeARN.
[$sel:targetARN:DescribeChapCredentials'] :: DescribeChapCredentials -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeChapCredentials</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetARN:DescribeChapCredentials'</a>,
--   <a>describeChapCredentials_targetARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the iSCSI volume target. Use the DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
--   operation to return to retrieve the TargetARN for specified VolumeARN.
newDescribeChapCredentials :: Text -> DescribeChapCredentials

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the iSCSI volume target. Use the
--   DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes operation to return to retrieve the
--   TargetARN for specified VolumeARN.
describeChapCredentials_targetARN :: Lens' DescribeChapCredentials Text

-- | A JSON object containing the following fields:
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeChapCredentialsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeChapCredentialsResponse
DescribeChapCredentialsResponse' :: Maybe [ChapInfo] -> Int -> DescribeChapCredentialsResponse

-- | An array of ChapInfo objects that represent CHAP credentials. Each
--   object in the array contains CHAP credential information for one
--   target-initiator pair. If no CHAP credentials are set, an empty array
--   is returned. CHAP credential information is provided in a JSON object
--   with the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>InitiatorName</b>: The iSCSI initiator that connects to the
--   target.</li>
--   <li><b>SecretToAuthenticateInitiator</b>: The secret key that the
--   initiator (for example, the Windows client) must provide to
--   participate in mutual CHAP with the target.</li>
--   <li><b>SecretToAuthenticateTarget</b>: The secret key that the target
--   must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the initiator (e.g.
--   Windows client).</li>
--   <li><b>TargetARN</b>: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage
--   volume.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:chapCredentials:DescribeChapCredentialsResponse'] :: DescribeChapCredentialsResponse -> Maybe [ChapInfo]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeChapCredentialsResponse'] :: DescribeChapCredentialsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeChapCredentialsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:chapCredentials:DescribeChapCredentialsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChapCredentialsResponse_chapCredentials</a> - An array of
--   ChapInfo objects that represent CHAP credentials. Each object in the
--   array contains CHAP credential information for one target-initiator
--   pair. If no CHAP credentials are set, an empty array is returned. CHAP
--   credential information is provided in a JSON object with the following
--   fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>InitiatorName</b>: The iSCSI initiator that connects to the
--   target.</li>
--   <li><b>SecretToAuthenticateInitiator</b>: The secret key that the
--   initiator (for example, the Windows client) must provide to
--   participate in mutual CHAP with the target.</li>
--   <li><b>SecretToAuthenticateTarget</b>: The secret key that the target
--   must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the initiator (e.g.
--   Windows client).</li>
--   <li><b>TargetARN</b>: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage
--   volume.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeChapCredentialsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChapCredentialsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newDescribeChapCredentialsResponse :: Int -> DescribeChapCredentialsResponse

-- | An array of ChapInfo objects that represent CHAP credentials. Each
--   object in the array contains CHAP credential information for one
--   target-initiator pair. If no CHAP credentials are set, an empty array
--   is returned. CHAP credential information is provided in a JSON object
--   with the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>InitiatorName</b>: The iSCSI initiator that connects to the
--   target.</li>
--   <li><b>SecretToAuthenticateInitiator</b>: The secret key that the
--   initiator (for example, the Windows client) must provide to
--   participate in mutual CHAP with the target.</li>
--   <li><b>SecretToAuthenticateTarget</b>: The secret key that the target
--   must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the initiator (e.g.
--   Windows client).</li>
--   <li><b>TargetARN</b>: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage
--   volume.</li>
--   </ul>
describeChapCredentialsResponse_chapCredentials :: Lens' DescribeChapCredentialsResponse (Maybe [ChapInfo])

-- | The response's http status code.
describeChapCredentialsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeChapCredentialsResponse Int

-- | Returns information about the cache of a gateway. This operation is
--   only supported in the cached volume, tape, and file gateway types.
--   
--   The response includes disk IDs that are configured as cache, and it
--   includes the amount of cache allocated and used.

--   length of 300. You can get the disk IDs from the ListLocalDisks API.
[$sel:diskIds:DescribeCacheResponse'] :: DescribeCacheResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Percent use of the gateway's cache storage. This metric applies only
--   to the gateway-cached volume setup. The sample is taken at the end of
--   the reporting period.
[$sel:cacheUsedPercentage:DescribeCacheResponse'] :: DescribeCacheResponse -> Maybe Double

--   served from cache. The sample is taken at the end of the reporting
--   period.

-- | Returns information about the bandwidth rate limit schedule of a
--   gateway. By default, gateways do not have bandwidth rate limit
--   schedules, which means no bandwidth rate limiting is in effect. This
--   operation is supported only in the volume and tape gateway types.
--   
--   This operation returns information about a gateway's bandwidth rate
--   limit schedule. A bandwidth rate limit schedule consists of one or
--   more bandwidth rate limit intervals. A bandwidth rate limit interval
--   defines a period of time on one or more days of the week, during which
--   bandwidth rate limits are specified for uploading, downloading, or
--   both.
--   
--   A bandwidth rate limit interval consists of one or more days of the
--   week, a start hour and minute, an ending hour and minute, and
--   bandwidth rate limits for uploading and downloading
--   
--   If no bandwidth rate limit schedule intervals are set for the gateway,
--   this operation returns an empty response. To specify which gateway to
--   describe, use the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway in your
--   request.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeBandwidthRateLimitSchedule

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeBandwidthRateLimitSchedule</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeBandwidthRateLimitSchedule
DescribeBandwidthRateLimitSchedule' :: Text -> DescribeBandwidthRateLimitSchedule
[$sel:gatewayARN:DescribeBandwidthRateLimitSchedule'] :: DescribeBandwidthRateLimitSchedule -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeBandwidthRateLimitSchedule</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   member.

--   constructor.

--   or volume gateway.

-- | Returns the bandwidth rate limits of a gateway. By default, these
--   limits are not set, which means no bandwidth rate limiting is in
--   effect. This operation is supported for the stored volume, cached
--   volume, and tape gateway types.
--   
--   This operation only returns a value for a bandwidth rate limit only if
--   the limit is set. If no limits are set for the gateway, then this
--   operation returns only the gateway ARN in the response body. To
--   specify which gateway to describe, use the Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the gateway in your request.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeBandwidthRateLimit

--   gateway.

-- | Deletes the specified storage volume that you previously created using
--   the CreateCachediSCSIVolume or CreateStorediSCSIVolume API. This
--   operation is only supported in the cached volume and stored volume
--   types. For stored volume gateways, the local disk that was configured
--   as the storage volume is not deleted. You can reuse the local disk to
--   create another storage volume.
--   
--   Before you delete a volume, make sure there are no iSCSI connections
--   to the volume you are deleting. You should also make sure there is no
--   snapshot in progress. You can use the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
--   (Amazon EC2) API to query snapshots on the volume you are deleting and
--   check the snapshot status. For more information, go to
--   <a>DescribeSnapshots</a> in the <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud API
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   In the request, you must provide the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the
--   storage volume you want to delete.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DeleteVolume

-- | A JSON object containing the DeleteVolumeInput$VolumeARN to delete.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteVolume</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteVolume
DeleteVolume' :: Text -> DeleteVolume

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume. Use the ListVolumes
--   operation to return a list of gateway volumes.
[$sel:volumeARN:DeleteVolume'] :: DeleteVolume -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteVolume</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeARN:DeleteVolume'</a>, <a>deleteVolume_volumeARN</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume. Use the ListVolumes
--   operation to return a list of gateway volumes.
newDeleteVolume :: Text -> DeleteVolume

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume. Use the ListVolumes
--   operation to return a list of gateway volumes.
deleteVolume_volumeARN :: Lens' DeleteVolume Text

-- | A JSON object containing the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage
--   volume that was deleted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteVolumeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteVolumeResponse
DeleteVolumeResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> DeleteVolumeResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage volume that was deleted.
--   It is the same ARN you provided in the request.
[$sel:volumeARN:DeleteVolumeResponse'] :: DeleteVolumeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteVolumeResponse'] :: DeleteVolumeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteVolumeResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   of the storage volume that was deleted. It is the same ARN you
--   provided in the request.

--   <a>deleteVolumeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
