-- | Deletes the specified virtual tape from the virtual tape shelf (VTS).
--   This operation is only supported in the tape gateway type.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DeleteTapeArchive

-- | DeleteTapeArchiveInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteTapeArchive</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteTapeArchive
DeleteTapeArchive' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> DeleteTapeArchive

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to delete an archived tape that belongs to a
--   custom pool with tape retention lock. Only archived tapes with tape
--   retention lock set to <tt>governance</tt> can be deleted. Archived
--   tapes with tape retention lock set to <tt>compliance</tt> can't be
--   deleted.
[$sel:bypassGovernanceRetention:DeleteTapeArchive'] :: DeleteTapeArchive -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape to delete from the
--   virtual tape shelf (VTS).

--   with tape retention lock. Only archived tapes with tape retention lock
--   set to <tt>governance</tt> can be deleted. Archived tapes with tape
--   retention lock set to <tt>compliance</tt> can't be deleted.

--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:DeleteTapeArchive'</a>,

-- | Deletes the specified virtual tape. This operation is only supported
--   in the tape gateway type.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DeleteTape

-- | DeleteTapeInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteTape</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteTape
DeleteTape' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> DeleteTape

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to delete an archived tape that belongs to a
--   custom pool with tape retention lock. Only archived tapes with tape
--   retention lock set to <tt>governance</tt> can be deleted. Archived
--   tapes with tape retention lock set to <tt>compliance</tt> can't be
--   deleted.
[$sel:bypassGovernanceRetention:DeleteTape'] :: DeleteTape -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway that the virtual
--   tape to delete is associated with. Use the ListGateways operation to
--   return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
[$sel:gatewayARN:DeleteTape'] :: DeleteTape -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape to delete.
[$sel:tapeARN:DeleteTape'] :: DeleteTape -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteTape</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bypassGovernanceRetention:DeleteTape'</a>,
--   <a>deleteTape_bypassGovernanceRetention</a> - Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to
--   delete an archived tape that belongs to a custom pool with tape
--   retention lock. Only archived tapes with tape retention lock set to
--   <tt>governance</tt> can be deleted. Archived tapes with tape retention
--   lock set to <tt>compliance</tt> can't be deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:DeleteTape'</a>, <a>deleteTape_gatewayARN</a> - The
--   unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway that the virtual tape
--   to delete is associated with. Use the ListGateways operation to return
--   a list of gateways for your account and Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:DeleteTape'</a>, <a>deleteTape_tapeARN</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape to delete.
newDeleteTape :: Text -> Text -> DeleteTape

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> to delete an archived tape that belongs to a
--   custom pool with tape retention lock. Only archived tapes with tape
--   retention lock set to <tt>governance</tt> can be deleted. Archived
--   tapes with tape retention lock set to <tt>compliance</tt> can't be
--   deleted.
deleteTape_bypassGovernanceRetention :: Lens' DeleteTape (Maybe Bool)

-- | The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway that the virtual
--   tape to delete is associated with. Use the ListGateways operation to
--   return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
deleteTape_gatewayARN :: Lens' DeleteTape Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape to delete.
deleteTape_tapeARN :: Lens' DeleteTape Text

-- | DeleteTapeOutput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteTapeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteTapeResponse
DeleteTapeResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> DeleteTapeResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the deleted virtual tape.
[$sel:tapeARN:DeleteTapeResponse'] :: DeleteTapeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteTapeResponse'] :: DeleteTapeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteTapeResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

-- | Deletes a snapshot of a volume.
--   
--   You can take snapshots of your gateway volumes on a scheduled or ad
--   hoc basis. This API action enables you to delete a snapshot schedule
--   for a volume. For more information, see <a>Backing up your
--   volumes</a>. In the <tt>DeleteSnapshotSchedule</tt> request, you
--   identify the volume by providing its Amazon Resource Name (ARN). This
--   operation is only supported in stored and cached volume gateway types.
--   
--   To list or delete a snapshot, you must use the Amazon EC2 API. For
--   more information, go to <a>DescribeSnapshots</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Elastic Compute Cloud API Reference</i>.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DeleteSnapshotSchedule

--   schedule to delete.

-- | Deletes a gateway. To specify which gateway to delete, use the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway in your request. The operation
--   deletes the gateway; however, it does not delete the gateway virtual
--   machine (VM) from your host computer.
--   
--   After you delete a gateway, you cannot reactivate it. Completed
--   snapshots of the gateway volumes are not deleted upon deleting the
--   gateway, however, pending snapshots will not complete. After you
--   delete a gateway, your next step is to remove it from your
--   environment.
--   
--   You no longer pay software charges after the gateway is deleted;
--   however, your existing Amazon EBS snapshots persist and you will
--   continue to be billed for these snapshots. You can choose to remove
--   all remaining Amazon EBS snapshots by canceling your Amazon EC2
--   subscription. If you prefer not to cancel your Amazon EC2
--   subscription, you can delete your snapshots using the Amazon EC2
--   console. For more information, see the <a>Storage Gateway detail
--   page</a>.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DeleteGateway

-- | A JSON object containing the ID of the gateway to delete.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteGateway</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteGateway
DeleteGateway' :: Text -> DeleteGateway
[$sel:gatewayARN:DeleteGateway'] :: DeleteGateway -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteGateway</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:DeleteGateway'</a>, <a>deleteGateway_gatewayARN</a>
--   - Undocumented member.
newDeleteGateway :: Text -> DeleteGateway

-- | Undocumented member.
deleteGateway_gatewayARN :: Lens' DeleteGateway Text

-- | A JSON object containing the ID of the deleted gateway.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteGatewayResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteGatewayResponse

[$sel:gatewayARN:DeleteGatewayResponse'] :: DeleteGatewayResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteGatewayResponse'] :: DeleteGatewayResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteGatewayResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:DeleteGateway'</a>,
--   <a>deleteGatewayResponse_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteGatewayResponse'</a>,

-- | Deletes a file share from an S3 File Gateway. This operation is only
--   supported for S3 File Gateways.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DeleteFileShare

-- | DeleteFileShareInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteFileShare</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteFileShare
DeleteFileShare' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> DeleteFileShare

-- | If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, the operation deletes a file
--   share immediately and aborts all data uploads to Amazon Web Services.
--   Otherwise, the file share is not deleted until all data is uploaded to
--   Amazon Web Services. This process aborts the data upload process, and
--   the file share enters the <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> status.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:forceDelete:DeleteFileShare'] :: DeleteFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share to be deleted.
[$sel:fileShareARN:DeleteFileShare'] :: DeleteFileShare -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteFileShare</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceDelete:DeleteFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>deleteFileShare_forceDelete</a> - If this value is set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, the operation deletes a file share immediately and
--   aborts all data uploads to Amazon Web Services. Otherwise, the file
--   share is not deleted until all data is uploaded to Amazon Web
--   Services. This process aborts the data upload process, and the file
--   share enters the <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> status.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareARN:DeleteFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>deleteFileShare_fileShareARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the file share to be deleted.
newDeleteFileShare :: Text -> DeleteFileShare

-- | If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, the operation deletes a file
--   share immediately and aborts all data uploads to Amazon Web Services.
--   Otherwise, the file share is not deleted until all data is uploaded to
--   Amazon Web Services. This process aborts the data upload process, and
--   the file share enters the <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> status.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
deleteFileShare_forceDelete :: Lens' DeleteFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share to be deleted.
deleteFileShare_fileShareARN :: Lens' DeleteFileShare Text

-- | Deletes the bandwidth rate limits of a gateway. You can delete either
--   the upload and download bandwidth rate limit, or you can delete both.
--   If you delete only one of the limits, the other limit remains
--   unchanged. To specify which gateway to work with, use the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway in your request. This operation is
--   supported for the stored volume, cached volume and tape gateway types.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DeleteBandwidthRateLimit

-- | A JSON object containing the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DeleteBandwidthRateLimitInput$BandwidthType</li>

-- | Deletes the automatic tape creation policy of a gateway. If you delete
--   this policy, new virtual tapes must be created manually. Use the
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway in your request to remove
--   the policy.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DeleteAutomaticTapeCreationPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteAutomaticTapeCreationPolicy</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | Creates one or more virtual tapes. You write data to the virtual tapes
--   and then archive the tapes. This operation is only supported in the
--   tape gateway type.
--   
--   Cache storage must be allocated to the gateway before you can create
--   virtual tapes. Use the AddCache operation to add cache storage to a
--   gateway.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateTapes

-- | CreateTapesInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateTapes</a> smart constructor.
data CreateTapes
CreateTapes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Integer -> Text -> Natural -> Text -> CreateTapes

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
[$sel:kmsKey:CreateTapes'] :: CreateTapes -> Maybe Text

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:kmsEncrypted:CreateTapes'] :: CreateTapes -> Maybe Bool

-- | The ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving.
--   The tape in this pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
[$sel:poolId:CreateTapes'] :: CreateTapes -> Maybe Text

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> if the tape you are creating is to be configured
--   as a write-once-read-many (WORM) tape.
[$sel:worm:CreateTapes'] :: CreateTapes -> Maybe Bool

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to a virtual tape. Each
--   tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
[$sel:tags:CreateTapes'] :: CreateTapes -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that represents the gateway to
--   associate the virtual tapes with. Use the ListGateways operation to
--   return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
[$sel:gatewayARN:CreateTapes'] :: CreateTapes -> Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tapes that you want to create.
--   
--   The size must be aligned by gigabyte (1024*1024*1024 bytes).
[$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:CreateTapes'] :: CreateTapes -> Integer

-- | A unique identifier that you use to retry a request. If you retry a
--   request, use the same <tt>ClientToken</tt> you specified in the
--   initial request.
--   
--   Using the same <tt>ClientToken</tt> prevents creating the tape
--   multiple times.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateTapes'] :: CreateTapes -> Text

-- | The number of virtual tapes that you want to create.
[$sel:numTapesToCreate:CreateTapes'] :: CreateTapes -> Natural

-- | A prefix that you append to the barcode of the virtual tape you are
--   creating. This prefix makes the barcode unique.
--   
--   The prefix must be 1-4 characters in length and must be one of the
--   uppercase letters from A to Z.
[$sel:tapeBarcodePrefix:CreateTapes'] :: CreateTapes -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateTapes</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--

--   - Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with
--   your own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.

-- | Creates a virtual tape by using your own barcode. You write data to
--   the virtual tape and then archive the tape. A barcode is unique and
--   cannot be reused if it has already been used on a tape. This applies
--   to barcodes used on deleted tapes. This operation is only supported in
--   the tape gateway type.
--   
--   Cache storage must be allocated to the gateway before you can create a
--   virtual tape. Use the AddCache operation to add cache storage to a
--   gateway.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateTapeWithBarcode

-- | CreateTapeWithBarcodeInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateTapeWithBarcode</a> smart constructor.
data CreateTapeWithBarcode
CreateTapeWithBarcode' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Integer -> Text -> CreateTapeWithBarcode

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
[$sel:kmsKey:CreateTapeWithBarcode'] :: CreateTapeWithBarcode -> Maybe Text

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:kmsEncrypted:CreateTapeWithBarcode'] :: CreateTapeWithBarcode -> Maybe Bool

--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class

[$sel:poolId:CreateTapeWithBarcode'] :: CreateTapeWithBarcode -> Maybe Text

[$sel:worm:CreateTapeWithBarcode'] :: CreateTapeWithBarcode -> Maybe Bool

--   has a barcode. Each tag is a key-value pair.

--   
--   Barcodes cannot be reused. This includes barcodes used for tapes that
--   have been deleted.
[$sel:tapeBarcode:CreateTapeWithBarcode'] :: CreateTapeWithBarcode -> Text

--   The tape in this pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
createTapeWithBarcode_poolId :: Lens' CreateTapeWithBarcode (Maybe Text)

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> if the tape you are creating is to be configured
--   as a write-once-read-many (WORM) tape.
createTapeWithBarcode_worm :: Lens' CreateTapeWithBarcode (Maybe Bool)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to a virtual tape that
--   has a barcode. Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
createTapeWithBarcode_tags :: Lens' CreateTapeWithBarcode (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that represents the gateway to
--   associate the virtual tape with. Use the ListGateways operation to
--   return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
createTapeWithBarcode_gatewayARN :: Lens' CreateTapeWithBarcode Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tape that you want to create.
--   
--   The size must be aligned by gigabyte (1024*1024*1024 bytes).
createTapeWithBarcode_tapeSizeInBytes :: Lens' CreateTapeWithBarcode Integer

-- | The barcode that you want to assign to the tape.
--   
--   Barcodes cannot be reused. This includes barcodes used for tapes that
--   have been deleted.
createTapeWithBarcode_tapeBarcode :: Lens' CreateTapeWithBarcode Text

-- | CreateTapeOutput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateTapeWithBarcodeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateTapeWithBarcodeResponse
CreateTapeWithBarcodeResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> CreateTapeWithBarcodeResponse

-- | A unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that represents the virtual tape
--   that was created.
[$sel:tapeARN:CreateTapeWithBarcodeResponse'] :: CreateTapeWithBarcodeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateTapeWithBarcodeResponse'] :: CreateTapeWithBarcodeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateTapeWithBarcodeResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   Resource Name (ARN) that represents the virtual tape that was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateTapeWithBarcodeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createTapeWithBarcodeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newCreateTapeWithBarcodeResponse :: Int -> CreateTapeWithBarcodeResponse

-- | Creates a new custom tape pool. You can use custom tape pool to enable
--   tape retention lock on tapes that are archived in the custom pool.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateTapePool

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateTapePool</a> smart constructor.
data CreateTapePool
CreateTapePool' :: Maybe RetentionLockType -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> TapeStorageClass -> CreateTapePool

-- | Tape retention lock can be configured in two modes. When configured in
--   governance mode, accounts with specific IAM permissions are authorized
--   to remove the tape retention lock from archived virtual tapes. When
--   configured in compliance mode, the tape retention lock cannot be
--   removed by any user, including the root account.
[$sel:retentionLockType:CreateTapePool'] :: CreateTapePool -> Maybe RetentionLockType

-- | Tape retention lock time is set in days. Tape retention lock can be
--   enabled for up to 100 years (36,500 days).
[$sel:retentionLockTimeInDays:CreateTapePool'] :: CreateTapePool -> Maybe Natural

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to tape pool. Each tag is
--   a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
[$sel:tags:CreateTapePool'] :: CreateTapePool -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The name of the new custom tape pool.
[$sel:poolName:CreateTapePool'] :: CreateTapePool -> Text

-- | The storage class that is associated with the new custom pool. When
--   you use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is
--   archived directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier
--   Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
[$sel:storageClass:CreateTapePool'] :: CreateTapePool -> TapeStorageClass

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateTapePool</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionLockType:CreateTapePool'</a>,
--   <a>createTapePool_retentionLockType</a> - Tape retention lock can be
--   configured in two modes. When configured in governance mode, accounts
--   with specific IAM permissions are authorized to remove the tape
--   retention lock from archived virtual tapes. When configured in
--   compliance mode, the tape retention lock cannot be removed by any
--   user, including the root account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionLockTimeInDays:CreateTapePool'</a>,
--   <a>createTapePool_retentionLockTimeInDays</a> - Tape retention lock
--   time is set in days. Tape retention lock can be enabled for up to 100
--   years (36,500 days).
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateTapePool'</a>, <a>createTapePool_tags</a> - A list
--   of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to tape pool. Each tag is a
--   key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolName:CreateTapePool'</a>, <a>createTapePool_poolName</a> -
--   The name of the new custom tape pool.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:CreateTapePool'</a>,
--   <a>createTapePool_storageClass</a> - The storage class that is
--   associated with the new custom pool. When you use your backup
--   application to eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the
--   storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds
--   to the pool.
newCreateTapePool :: Text -> TapeStorageClass -> CreateTapePool

-- | Tape retention lock can be configured in two modes. When configured in
--   governance mode, accounts with specific IAM permissions are authorized
--   to remove the tape retention lock from archived virtual tapes. When
--   configured in compliance mode, the tape retention lock cannot be
--   removed by any user, including the root account.
createTapePool_retentionLockType :: Lens' CreateTapePool (Maybe RetentionLockType)

-- | Tape retention lock time is set in days. Tape retention lock can be
--   enabled for up to 100 years (36,500 days).
createTapePool_retentionLockTimeInDays :: Lens' CreateTapePool (Maybe Natural)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to tape pool. Each tag is
--   a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
createTapePool_tags :: Lens' CreateTapePool (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The name of the new custom tape pool.
createTapePool_poolName :: Lens' CreateTapePool Text

-- | The storage class that is associated with the new custom pool. When
--   you use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is
--   archived directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier
--   Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
createTapePool_storageClass :: Lens' CreateTapePool TapeStorageClass

-- | Creates a volume on a specified gateway. This operation is only
--   supported in the stored volume gateway type.
--   
--   The size of the volume to create is inferred from the disk size. You
--   can choose to preserve existing data on the disk, create volume from
--   an existing snapshot, or create an empty volume. If you choose to
--   create an empty gateway volume, then any existing data on the disk is
--   erased.
--   
--   In the request, you must specify the gateway and the disk information
--   on which you are creating the volume. In response, the gateway creates
--   the volume and returns volume information such as the volume Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), its size, and the iSCSI target ARN that
--   initiators can use to connect to the volume target.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateStorediSCSIVolume

-- | A JSON object containing one or more of the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CreateStorediSCSIVolumeInput$DiskId</li>
--   <li>CreateStorediSCSIVolumeInput$NetworkInterfaceId</li>
--   <li>CreateStorediSCSIVolumeInput$PreserveExistingData</li>
--   <li>CreateStorediSCSIVolumeInput$SnapshotId</li>
--   <li>CreateStorediSCSIVolumeInput$TargetName</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateStorediSCSIVolume</a> smart constructor.
data CreateStorediSCSIVolume
CreateStorediSCSIVolume' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Bool -> Text -> Text -> CreateStorediSCSIVolume

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
[$sel:kmsKey:CreateStorediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateStorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:kmsEncrypted:CreateStorediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateStorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Bool

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to a stored volume. Each
--   tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
[$sel:tags:CreateStorediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateStorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The snapshot ID (e.g., "snap-1122aabb") of the snapshot to restore as
--   the new stored volume. Specify this field if you want to create the
--   iSCSI storage volume from a snapshot; otherwise, do not include this
--   field. To list snapshots for your account use <a>DescribeSnapshots</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud API Reference</i>.
[$sel:snapshotId:CreateStorediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateStorediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text
[$sel:gatewayARN:CreateStorediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateStorediSCSIVolume -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the gateway local disk that is configured as
--   a stored volume. Use <a>ListLocalDisks</a> to list disk IDs for a
--   gateway.
[$sel:diskId:CreateStorediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateStorediSCSIVolume -> Text

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> if you want to preserve the data on the local
--   disk. Otherwise, set to <tt>false</tt> to create an empty volume.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:preserveExistingData:CreateStorediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateStorediSCSIVolume -> Bool

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
[$sel:targetName:CreateStorediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateStorediSCSIVolume -> Text

-- | The network interface of the gateway on which to expose the iSCSI
--   target. Only IPv4 addresses are accepted. Use
--   DescribeGatewayInformation to get a list of the network interfaces
--   available on a gateway.
--   
--   Valid Values: A valid IP address.
[$sel:networkInterfaceId:CreateStorediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateStorediSCSIVolume -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateStorediSCSIVolume</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

-- | Initiates a snapshot of a gateway from a volume recovery point. This
--   operation is only supported in the cached volume gateway type.
--   
--   A volume recovery point is a point in time at which all data of the
--   volume is consistent and from which you can create a snapshot. To get
--   a list of volume recovery point for cached volume gateway, use
--   ListVolumeRecoveryPoints.
--   
--   In the <tt>CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint</tt> request, you
--   identify the volume by providing its Amazon Resource Name (ARN). You
--   must also provide a description for the snapshot. When the gateway
--   takes a snapshot of the specified volume, the snapshot and its
--   description appear in the Storage Gateway console. In response, the
--   gateway returns you a snapshot ID. You can use this snapshot ID to
--   check the snapshot progress or later use it when you want to create a
--   volume from a snapshot.
--   
--   To list or delete a snapshot, you must use the Amazon EC2 API. For
--   more information, see <a>DescribeSnapshots</a> or
--   <a>DeleteSnapshot</a> in the <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud API
--   Reference</i>.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint
CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to a snapshot. Each tag
--   is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
[$sel:tags:CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint'] :: CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the iSCSI volume target. Use the
--   DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes operation to return to retrieve the

[$sel:volumeARN:CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint'] :: CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint -> Text

--   <b>Description</b> field.

-- | Initiates a snapshot of a volume.
--   
--   Storage Gateway provides the ability to back up point-in-time
--   snapshots of your data to Amazon Simple Storage (Amazon S3) for
--   durable off-site recovery, and also import the data to an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (EBS) volume in Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
--   (EC2). You can take snapshots of your gateway volume on a scheduled or
--   ad hoc basis. This API enables you to take an ad hoc snapshot. For
--   more information, see <a>Editing a snapshot schedule</a>.
--   
--   In the <tt>CreateSnapshot</tt> request, you identify the volume by
--   providing its Amazon Resource Name (ARN). You must also provide
--   description for the snapshot. When Storage Gateway takes the snapshot
--   of specified volume, the snapshot and description appears in the
--   Storage Gateway console. In response, Storage Gateway returns you a
--   snapshot ID. You can use this snapshot ID to check the snapshot
--   progress or later use it when you want to create a volume from a
--   snapshot. This operation is only supported in stored and cached volume
--   gateway type.
--   
--   To list or delete a snapshot, you must use the Amazon EC2 API. For
--   more information, see <a>DescribeSnapshots</a> or
--   <a>DeleteSnapshot</a> in the <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud API
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   Volume and snapshot IDs are changing to a longer length ID format. For
--   more information, see the important note on the <a>Welcome</a> page.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateSnapshot

-- | A JSON object containing one or more of the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CreateSnapshotInput$SnapshotDescription</li>
--   <li>CreateSnapshotInput$VolumeARN</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data CreateSnapshot
CreateSnapshot' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> CreateSnapshot

--   is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
[$sel:tags:CreateSnapshot'] :: CreateSnapshot -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume. Use the ListVolumes
--   operation to return a list of gateway volumes.
[$sel:volumeARN:CreateSnapshot'] :: CreateSnapshot -> Text

-- | Textual description of the snapshot that appears in the Amazon EC2
--   console, Elastic Block Store snapshots panel in the <b>Description</b>
--   field, and in the Storage Gateway snapshot <b>Details</b> pane,
--   <b>Description</b> field.
[$sel:snapshotDescription:CreateSnapshot'] :: CreateSnapshot -> Text

--   omitted.

--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.

newCreateSnapshot :: Text -> Text -> CreateSnapshot

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to a snapshot. Each tag

-- | Creates a Server Message Block (SMB) file share on an existing S3 File
--   Gateway. In Storage Gateway, a file share is a file system mount point
--   backed by Amazon S3 cloud storage. Storage Gateway exposes file shares
--   using an SMB interface. This operation is only supported for S3 File
--   Gateways.
--   
--   S3 File Gateways require Security Token Service (STS) to be activated
--   to enable you to create a file share. Make sure that STS is activated
--   in the Region you are creating your S3 File Gateway in. If STS is not
--   activated in this Region, activate it. For information about how to
--   activate STS, see <a>Activating and deactivating STS in an Region</a>
--   in the <i>Identity and Access Management User Guide</i>.
--   
--   File gateways don't support creating hard or symbolic links on a file
--   share.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateSMBFileShare

-- | CreateSMBFileShareInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateSMBFileShare</a> smart constructor.
data CreateSMBFileShare
CreateSMBFileShare' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CacheAttributes -> Maybe ObjectACL -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CaseSensitivity -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateSMBFileShare

-- | The files and folders on this share will only be visible to users with
--   read access.
[$sel:accessBasedEnumeration:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that will be granted
--   administrator privileges on the file share. These users can do all
--   file operations as the super-user. Acceptable formats include:
--   <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and
--   <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>.
--   
--   Use this option very carefully, because any user in this list can do
--   anything they like on the file share, regardless of file permissions.
[$sel:adminUserList:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for audit logs.
[$sel:auditDestinationARN:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are not allowed
--   to access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @
--   character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
[$sel:invalidUserList:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
[$sel:kmsKey:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are allowed to
--   access the file <a></a> share. A group must be prefixed with the @
--   character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
[$sel:validUserList:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specifies the DNS name for the VPC endpoint that the SMB file share
--   uses to connect to Amazon S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
[$sel:vPCEndpointDNSName:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | The authentication method that users use to access the file share. The
--   default is <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt> | <tt>GuestAccess</tt>
[$sel:authentication:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies refresh cache information for the file share.
[$sel:cacheAttributes:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe CacheAttributes

-- | A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects
--   in the S3 bucket that a S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default
--   value is <tt>private</tt>.
[$sel:objectACL:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe ObjectACL

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:kmsEncrypted:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
[$sel:defaultStorageClass:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
[$sel:fileShareName:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable access control list (ACL) on
--   the SMB file share. Set it to <tt>false</tt> to map file and directory
--   permissions to the POSIX permissions.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Using Microsoft Windows ACLs to control
--   access to an SMB file share</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:sMBACLEnabled:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether opportunistic locking is enabled for the SMB file
--   share.
--   
--   Enabling opportunistic locking on case-sensitive shares is not
--   recommended for workloads that involve access to files with the same
--   name in different case.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:oplocksEnabled:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
[$sel:notificationPolicy:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:requesterPays:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:readOnly:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the SMB file share stores
--   files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
[$sel:bucketRegion:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | The case of an object name in an Amazon S3 bucket. For
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client determines the case sensitivity.
--   For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the gateway determines the case
--   sensitivity. The default value is <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
[$sel:caseSensitivity:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe CaseSensitivity

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to the NFS file share.
--   Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
[$sel:tags:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | A unique string value that you supply that is used by S3 File Gateway
--   to ensure idempotent file share creation.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Text

-- | The ARN of the S3 File Gateway on which you want to create a file
--   share.
[$sel:gatewayARN:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Text

-- | The ARN of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that an S3
--   File Gateway assumes when it accesses the underlying storage.
[$sel:role':CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Text

-- | The ARN of the backend storage used for storing file data. A prefix
--   name can be added to the S3 bucket name. It must end with a "/".
--   
--   You can specify a bucket attached to an access point using a complete
--   ARN that includes the bucket region as shown:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:s3:region:account-id:accesspoint/access-point-name
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you specify a bucket attached to an access point, the bucket policy
--   must be configured to delegate access control to the access point. For
--   information, see <a>Delegating access control to access points</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:locationARN:CreateSMBFileShare'] :: CreateSMBFileShare -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateSMBFileShare</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessBasedEnumeration:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_accessBasedEnumeration</a> - The files and
--   folders on this share will only be visible to users with read access.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adminUserList:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_adminUserList</a> - A list of users or groups in
--   the Active Directory that will be granted administrator privileges on
--   the file share. These users can do all file operations as the
--   super-user. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>.
--   
--   Use this option very carefully, because any user in this list can do
--   anything they like on the file share, regardless of file permissions.
--

--   status of a file share. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to set the
--   write status to read-only, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketRegion:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_bucketRegion</a> - Specifies the Region of the
--   S3 bucket where the SMB file share stores files.
--

--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
--

--   in an Amazon S3 bucket. For <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client
--   determines the case sensitivity. For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the
--   gateway determines the case sensitivity. The default value is
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>, <a>createSMBFileShare_tags</a> -
--   A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to the NFS file share.

--   read access.

--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createSMBFileShare_requesterPays :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createSMBFileShare_guessMIMETypeEnabled :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createSMBFileShare_readOnly :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the SMB file share stores
--   files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
createSMBFileShare_bucketRegion :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The case of an object name in an Amazon S3 bucket. For
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client determines the case sensitivity.
--   For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the gateway determines the case
--   sensitivity. The default value is <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
createSMBFileShare_caseSensitivity :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe CaseSensitivity)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to the NFS file share.
--   Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
createSMBFileShare_tags :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe [Tag])

-- | A unique string value that you supply that is used by S3 File Gateway
--   to ensure idempotent file share creation.
createSMBFileShare_clientToken :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare Text

-- | The ARN of the S3 File Gateway on which you want to create a file
--   share.
createSMBFileShare_gatewayARN :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare Text

-- | The ARN of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that an S3
--   File Gateway assumes when it accesses the underlying storage.
createSMBFileShare_role :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare Text

-- | The ARN of the backend storage used for storing file data. A prefix
--   name can be added to the S3 bucket name. It must end with a "/".
--   
--   You can specify a bucket attached to an access point using a complete
--   ARN that includes the bucket region as shown:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:s3:region:account-id:accesspoint/access-point-name
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you specify a bucket attached to an access point, the bucket policy
--   must be configured to delegate access control to the access point. For
--   information, see <a>Delegating access control to access points</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
createSMBFileShare_locationARN :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare Text

-- | CreateSMBFileShareOutput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateSMBFileShareResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateSMBFileShareResponse
CreateSMBFileShareResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> CreateSMBFileShareResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the newly created file share.
[$sel:fileShareARN:CreateSMBFileShareResponse'] :: CreateSMBFileShareResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateSMBFileShareResponse'] :: CreateSMBFileShareResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateSMBFileShareResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareARN:CreateSMBFileShareResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShareResponse_fileShareARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the newly created file share.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateSMBFileShareResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShareResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newCreateSMBFileShareResponse :: Int -> CreateSMBFileShareResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the newly created file share.
createSMBFileShareResponse_fileShareARN :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShareResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
createSMBFileShareResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShareResponse Int

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateSMBFileShare.CreateSMBFileShare
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateSMBFileShare.CreateSMBFileShare
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateSMBFileShare.CreateSMBFileShare


-- | Creates a Network File System (NFS) file share on an existing S3 File
--   Gateway. In Storage Gateway, a file share is a file system mount point
--   backed by Amazon S3 cloud storage. Storage Gateway exposes file shares
--   using an NFS interface. This operation is only supported for S3 File
--   Gateways.
--   
--   S3 File gateway requires Security Token Service (STS) to be activated
--   to enable you to create a file share. Make sure STS is activated in
--   the Region you are creating your S3 File Gateway in. If STS is not
--   activated in the Region, activate it. For information about how to
--   activate STS, see <a>Activating and deactivating STS in an Region</a>
--   in the <i>Identity and Access Management User Guide</i>.
--   
--   S3 File Gateways do not support creating hard or symbolic links on a
--   file share.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateNFSFileShare

-- | CreateNFSFileShareInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateNFSFileShare</a> smart constructor.
data CreateNFSFileShare
CreateNFSFileShare' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CacheAttributes -> Maybe ObjectACL -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateNFSFileShare

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
[$sel:kmsKey:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the DNS name for the VPC endpoint that the NFS file share
--   uses to connect to Amazon S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
[$sel:vPCEndpointDNSName:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies refresh cache information for the file share.
[$sel:cacheAttributes:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe CacheAttributes

-- | A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects
--   in the S3 bucket that a S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default
--   value is <tt>private</tt>.
[$sel:objectACL:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe ObjectACL

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:kmsEncrypted:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
[$sel:defaultStorageClass:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
[$sel:fileShareName:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
[$sel:notificationPolicy:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that maps a user to anonymous user.
--   
--   Valid values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>RootSquash</tt>: Only root is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>NoSquash</tt>: No one is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>AllSquash</tt>: Everyone is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:squash:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:requesterPays:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | File share default values. Optional.
[$sel:nFSFileShareDefaults:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults

-- | The list of clients that are allowed to access the S3 File Gateway.
--   The list must contain either valid IP addresses or valid CIDR blocks.
[$sel:clientList:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:readOnly:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the NFS file share stores
--   files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
[$sel:bucketRegion:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to the NFS file share.
--   Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
[$sel:tags:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | A unique string value that you supply that is used by S3 File Gateway
--   to ensure idempotent file share creation.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 File Gateway on which you
--   want to create a file share.
[$sel:gatewayARN:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Text

-- | The ARN of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that an S3
--   File Gateway assumes when it accesses the underlying storage.
[$sel:role':CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Text

-- | The ARN of the backend storage used for storing file data. A prefix
--   name can be added to the S3 bucket name. It must end with a "/".
--   
--   You can specify a bucket attached to an access point using a complete
--   ARN that includes the bucket region as shown:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:s3:region:account-id:accesspoint/access-point-name
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you specify a bucket attached to an access point, the bucket policy
--   must be configured to delegate access control to the access point. For
--   information, see <a>Delegating access control to access points</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:locationARN:CreateNFSFileShare'] :: CreateNFSFileShare -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateNFSFileShare</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   ARN that includes the bucket region as shown:

--   arn:aws:s3:region:account-id:accesspoint/access-point-name
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you specify a bucket attached to an access point, the bucket policy
--   must be configured to delegate access control to the access point. For
--   information, see <a>Delegating access control to access points</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
newCreateNFSFileShare :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateNFSFileShare

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
createNFSFileShare_kmsKey :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the DNS name for the VPC endpoint that the NFS file share
--   uses to connect to Amazon S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
createNFSFileShare_vPCEndpointDNSName :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies refresh cache information for the file share.
createNFSFileShare_cacheAttributes :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe CacheAttributes)

-- | A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects
--   in the S3 bucket that a S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default
--   value is <tt>private</tt>.
createNFSFileShare_objectACL :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe ObjectACL)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createNFSFileShare_kmsEncrypted :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
createNFSFileShare_defaultStorageClass :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
createNFSFileShare_fileShareName :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
createNFSFileShare_notificationPolicy :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that maps a user to anonymous user.
--   
--   Valid values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>RootSquash</tt>: Only root is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>NoSquash</tt>: No one is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>AllSquash</tt>: Everyone is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   </ul>
createNFSFileShare_squash :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createNFSFileShare_requesterPays :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | File share default values. Optional.
createNFSFileShare_nFSFileShareDefaults :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults)

-- | The list of clients that are allowed to access the S3 File Gateway.
--   The list must contain either valid IP addresses or valid CIDR blocks.
createNFSFileShare_clientList :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createNFSFileShare_guessMIMETypeEnabled :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createNFSFileShare_readOnly :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the NFS file share stores
--   files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
createNFSFileShare_bucketRegion :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to the NFS file share.
--   Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
createNFSFileShare_tags :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe [Tag])

-- | A unique string value that you supply that is used by S3 File Gateway
--   to ensure idempotent file share creation.
createNFSFileShare_clientToken :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 File Gateway on which you
--   want to create a file share.
createNFSFileShare_gatewayARN :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare Text

-- | The ARN of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that an S3
--   File Gateway assumes when it accesses the underlying storage.
createNFSFileShare_role :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare Text

-- | The ARN of the backend storage used for storing file data. A prefix
--   name can be added to the S3 bucket name. It must end with a "/".
--   
--   You can specify a bucket attached to an access point using a complete
--   ARN that includes the bucket region as shown:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:s3:region:account-id:accesspoint/access-point-name
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you specify a bucket attached to an access point, the bucket policy
--   must be configured to delegate access control to the access point. For
--   information, see <a>Delegating access control to access points</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
createNFSFileShare_locationARN :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare Text

-- | Creates a cached volume on a specified cached volume gateway. This
--   operation is only supported in the cached volume gateway type.
--   
--   Cache storage must be allocated to the gateway before you can create a
--   cached volume. Use the AddCache operation to add cache storage to a
--   gateway.
--   
--   In the request, you must specify the gateway, size of the volume in
--   bytes, the iSCSI target name, an IP address on which to expose the
--   target, and a unique client token. In response, the gateway creates
--   the volume and returns information about it. This information includes
--   the volume Amazon Resource Name (ARN), its size, and the iSCSI target
--   ARN that initiators can use to connect to the volume target.
--   
--   Optionally, you can provide the ARN for an existing volume as the
--   <tt>SourceVolumeARN</tt> for this cached volume, which creates an
--   exact copy of the existing volumes latest recovery point. The
--   <tt>VolumeSizeInBytes</tt> value must be equal to or larger than the
--   size of the copied volume, in bytes.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateCachediSCSIVolume

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateCachediSCSIVolume</a> smart constructor.
data CreateCachediSCSIVolume
CreateCachediSCSIVolume' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Integer -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateCachediSCSIVolume

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
[$sel:kmsKey:CreateCachediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateCachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN for an existing volume. Specifying this ARN makes the new
--   volume into an exact copy of the specified existing volume's latest
--   recovery point. The <tt>VolumeSizeInBytes</tt> value for this new
--   volume must be equal to or larger than the size of the existing
--   volume, in bytes.
[$sel:sourceVolumeARN:CreateCachediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateCachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:kmsEncrypted:CreateCachediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateCachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Bool

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that you can assign to a cached volume. Each
--   tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   that you can represent in UTF-8 format, and the following special
--   characters: + - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128
--   characters, and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256
--   characters.
[$sel:tags:CreateCachediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateCachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The snapshot ID (e.g. "snap-1122aabb") of the snapshot to restore as
--   the new cached volume. Specify this field if you want to create the
--   iSCSI storage volume from a snapshot; otherwise, do not include this
--   field. To list snapshots for your account use <a>DescribeSnapshots</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud API Reference</i>.
[$sel:snapshotId:CreateCachediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateCachediSCSIVolume -> Maybe Text
[$sel:gatewayARN:CreateCachediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateCachediSCSIVolume -> Text

-- | The size of the volume in bytes.
[$sel:volumeSizeInBytes:CreateCachediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateCachediSCSIVolume -> Integer

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
[$sel:targetName:CreateCachediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateCachediSCSIVolume -> Text

-- | The network interface of the gateway on which to expose the iSCSI
--   target. Only IPv4 addresses are accepted. Use
--   DescribeGatewayInformation to get a list of the network interfaces
--   available on a gateway.
--   
--   Valid Values: A valid IP address.
[$sel:networkInterfaceId:CreateCachediSCSIVolume'] :: CreateCachediSCSIVolume -> Text

-- | A unique identifier that you use to retry a request. If you retry a
--   request, use the same <tt>ClientToken</tt> you specified in the
--   initial request.

-- | Cancels retrieval of a virtual tape from the virtual tape shelf (VTS)
--   to a gateway after the retrieval process is initiated. The virtual
--   tape is returned to the VTS. This operation is only supported in the
--   tape gateway type.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CancelRetrieval

-- | CancelRetrievalInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelRetrieval</a> smart constructor.
data CancelRetrieval
CancelRetrieval' :: Text -> Text -> CancelRetrieval
[$sel:gatewayARN:CancelRetrieval'] :: CancelRetrieval -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape you want to cancel
--   retrieval for.
[$sel:tapeARN:CancelRetrieval'] :: CancelRetrieval -> Text

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape you want to cancel
--   retrieval for.
