-- | Connects a volume to an iSCSI connection and then attaches the volume
--   to the specified gateway. Detaching and attaching a volume enables you
--   to recover your data from one gateway to a different gateway without
--   creating a snapshot. It also makes it easier to move your volumes from
--   an on-premises gateway to a gateway hosted on an Amazon EC2 instance.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AttachVolume

-- | AttachVolumeInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachVolume</a> smart constructor.
data AttachVolume
AttachVolume' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> AttachVolume

-- | The unique device ID or other distinguishing data that identifies the
--   local disk used to create the volume. This value is only required when
--   you are attaching a stored volume.
[$sel:diskId:AttachVolume'] :: AttachVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
[$sel:targetName:AttachVolume'] :: AttachVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway that you want to attach
--   the volume to.
[$sel:gatewayARN:AttachVolume'] :: AttachVolume -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume to attach to the
--   specified gateway.
[$sel:volumeARN:AttachVolume'] :: AttachVolume -> Text

-- | The network interface of the gateway on which to expose the iSCSI
--   target. Only IPv4 addresses are accepted. Use
--   DescribeGatewayInformation to get a list of the network interfaces
--   available on a gateway.
--   
--   Valid Values: A valid IP address.
[$sel:networkInterfaceId:AttachVolume'] :: AttachVolume -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AttachVolume</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskId:AttachVolume'</a>, <a>attachVolume_diskId</a> - The
--   unique device ID or other distinguishing data that identifies the
--   local disk used to create the volume. This value is only required when
--   you are attaching a stored volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetName:AttachVolume'</a>, <a>attachVolume_targetName</a> -
--   The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:AttachVolume'</a>, <a>attachVolume_gatewayARN</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway that you want to attach
--   the volume to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeARN:AttachVolume'</a>, <a>attachVolume_volumeARN</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume to attach to the
--   specified gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInterfaceId:AttachVolume'</a>,
--   <a>attachVolume_networkInterfaceId</a> - The network interface of the
--   gateway on which to expose the iSCSI target. Only IPv4 addresses are
--   accepted. Use DescribeGatewayInformation to get a list of the network
--   interfaces available on a gateway.
--   
--   Valid Values: A valid IP address.
newAttachVolume :: Text -> Text -> Text -> AttachVolume

-- | The unique device ID or other distinguishing data that identifies the
--   local disk used to create the volume. This value is only required when
--   you are attaching a stored volume.
attachVolume_diskId :: Lens' AttachVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
attachVolume_targetName :: Lens' AttachVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway that you want to attach
--   the volume to.
attachVolume_gatewayARN :: Lens' AttachVolume Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume to attach to the
--   specified gateway.
attachVolume_volumeARN :: Lens' AttachVolume Text

-- | The network interface of the gateway on which to expose the iSCSI
--   target. Only IPv4 addresses are accepted. Use
--   DescribeGatewayInformation to get a list of the network interfaces
--   available on a gateway.
--   
--   Valid Values: A valid IP address.
attachVolume_networkInterfaceId :: Lens' AttachVolume Text

-- | AttachVolumeOutput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachVolumeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data AttachVolumeResponse
AttachVolumeResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> AttachVolumeResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume target, which includes
--   the iSCSI name for the initiator that was used to connect to the
--   target.
[$sel:targetARN:AttachVolumeResponse'] :: AttachVolumeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume that was attached to the
--   gateway.
[$sel:volumeARN:AttachVolumeResponse'] :: AttachVolumeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:AttachVolumeResponse'] :: AttachVolumeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>AttachVolumeResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetARN:AttachVolumeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>attachVolumeResponse_targetARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the volume target, which includes the iSCSI name for the initiator
--   that was used to connect to the target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeARN:AttachVolume'</a>,
--   <a>attachVolumeResponse_volumeARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the volume that was attached to the gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:AttachVolumeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>attachVolumeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newAttachVolumeResponse :: Int -> AttachVolumeResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume target, which includes
--   the iSCSI name for the initiator that was used to connect to the
--   target.
attachVolumeResponse_targetARN :: Lens' AttachVolumeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume that was attached to the
--   gateway.
attachVolumeResponse_volumeARN :: Lens' AttachVolumeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
attachVolumeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' AttachVolumeResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AttachVolume.AttachVolume
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AttachVolume.AttachVolume
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AttachVolume.AttachVolume
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AttachVolume.AttachVolumeResponse

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AttachVolume.AttachVolumeResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AttachVolume.AttachVolumeResponse

-- | Associate an Amazon FSx file system with the FSx File Gateway. After
--   the association process is complete, the file shares on the Amazon FSx
--   file system are available for access through the gateway. This
--   operation only supports the FSx File Gateway type.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AssociateFileSystem

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateFileSystem</a> smart constructor.
data AssociateFileSystem
AssociateFileSystem' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CacheAttributes -> Maybe EndpointNetworkConfiguration -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Sensitive Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> AssociateFileSystem

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for the audit logs.
[$sel:auditDestinationARN:AssociateFileSystem'] :: AssociateFileSystem -> Maybe Text
[$sel:cacheAttributes:AssociateFileSystem'] :: AssociateFileSystem -> Maybe CacheAttributes

-- | Specifies the network configuration information for the gateway
--   associated with the Amazon FSx file system.
--   
--   If multiple file systems are associated with this gateway, this
--   parameter's <tt>IpAddresses</tt> field is required.
[$sel:endpointNetworkConfiguration:AssociateFileSystem'] :: AssociateFileSystem -> Maybe EndpointNetworkConfiguration

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to the file system
--   association. Each tag is a key-value pair.
[$sel:tags:AssociateFileSystem'] :: AssociateFileSystem -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The user name of the user credential that has permission to access the
--   root share D$ of the Amazon FSx file system. The user account must
--   belong to the Amazon FSx delegated admin user group.
[$sel:userName:AssociateFileSystem'] :: AssociateFileSystem -> Text

-- | The password of the user credential.
[$sel:password:AssociateFileSystem'] :: AssociateFileSystem -> Sensitive Text

-- | A unique string value that you supply that is used by the FSx File
--   Gateway to ensure idempotent file system association creation.
[$sel:clientToken:AssociateFileSystem'] :: AssociateFileSystem -> Text
[$sel:gatewayARN:AssociateFileSystem'] :: AssociateFileSystem -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon FSx file system to
--   associate with the FSx File Gateway.
[$sel:locationARN:AssociateFileSystem'] :: AssociateFileSystem -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssociateFileSystem</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:auditDestinationARN:AssociateFileSystem'</a>,
--   <a>associateFileSystem_auditDestinationARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the storage used for the audit logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheAttributes:AssociateFileSystem'</a>,
--   <a>associateFileSystem_cacheAttributes</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointNetworkConfiguration:AssociateFileSystem'</a>,
--   <a>associateFileSystem_endpointNetworkConfiguration</a> - Specifies
--   the network configuration information for the gateway associated with
--   the Amazon FSx file system.
--   
--   If multiple file systems are associated with this gateway, this
--   parameter's <tt>IpAddresses</tt> field is required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:AssociateFileSystem'</a>, <a>associateFileSystem_tags</a>
--   - A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to the file system
--   association. Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:AssociateFileSystem'</a>,
--   <a>associateFileSystem_userName</a> - The user name of the user
--   credential that has permission to access the root share D$ of the
--   Amazon FSx file system. The user account must belong to the Amazon FSx
--   delegated admin user group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:AssociateFileSystem'</a>,
--   <a>associateFileSystem_password</a> - The password of the user
--   credential.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:AssociateFileSystem'</a>,
--   <a>associateFileSystem_clientToken</a> - A unique string value that
--   you supply that is used by the FSx File Gateway to ensure idempotent
--   file system association creation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:AssociateFileSystem'</a>,
--   <a>associateFileSystem_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:locationARN:AssociateFileSystem'</a>,
--   <a>associateFileSystem_locationARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the Amazon FSx file system to associate with the FSx File
--   Gateway.
newAssociateFileSystem :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> AssociateFileSystem

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for the audit logs.
associateFileSystem_auditDestinationARN :: Lens' AssociateFileSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
associateFileSystem_cacheAttributes :: Lens' AssociateFileSystem (Maybe CacheAttributes)

-- | Specifies the network configuration information for the gateway
--   associated with the Amazon FSx file system.
--   
--   If multiple file systems are associated with this gateway, this
--   parameter's <tt>IpAddresses</tt> field is required.
associateFileSystem_endpointNetworkConfiguration :: Lens' AssociateFileSystem (Maybe EndpointNetworkConfiguration)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to the file system
--   association. Each tag is a key-value pair.
associateFileSystem_tags :: Lens' AssociateFileSystem (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The user name of the user credential that has permission to access the
--   root share D$ of the Amazon FSx file system. The user account must
--   belong to the Amazon FSx delegated admin user group.
associateFileSystem_userName :: Lens' AssociateFileSystem Text

-- | The password of the user credential.
associateFileSystem_password :: Lens' AssociateFileSystem Text

-- | A unique string value that you supply that is used by the FSx File
--   Gateway to ensure idempotent file system association creation.
associateFileSystem_clientToken :: Lens' AssociateFileSystem Text

-- | Undocumented member.
associateFileSystem_gatewayARN :: Lens' AssociateFileSystem Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon FSx file system to
--   associate with the FSx File Gateway.
associateFileSystem_locationARN :: Lens' AssociateFileSystem Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateFileSystemResponse</a> smart constructor.
data AssociateFileSystemResponse
AssociateFileSystemResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> AssociateFileSystemResponse

-- | The ARN of the newly created file system association.
[$sel:fileSystemAssociationARN:AssociateFileSystemResponse'] :: AssociateFileSystemResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:AssociateFileSystemResponse'] :: AssociateFileSystemResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>AssociateFileSystemResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileSystemAssociationARN:AssociateFileSystemResponse'</a>,

--   of the newly created file system association.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:AssociateFileSystemResponse'</a>,
--   <a>associateFileSystemResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newAssociateFileSystemResponse :: Int -> AssociateFileSystemResponse

-- | The ARN of the newly created file system association.
associateFileSystemResponse_fileSystemAssociationARN :: Lens' AssociateFileSystemResponse (Maybe Text)

associateFileSystemResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' AssociateFileSystemResponse Int

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AssociateFileSystem.AssociateFileSystem


-- | Assigns a tape to a tape pool for archiving. The tape assigned to a
--   pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with the
--   pool. When you use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape
--   is archived directly into the S3 storage class (S3 Glacier or S3
--   Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AssignTapePool

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssignTapePool</a> smart constructor.
data AssignTapePool
AssignTapePool' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> AssignTapePool

-- | Set permissions to bypass governance retention. If the lock type of
--   the archived tape is <tt>Governance</tt>, the tape's archived age is
--   not older than <tt>RetentionLockInDays</tt>, and the user does not
--   already have <tt>BypassGovernanceRetention</tt>, setting this to TRUE
--   enables the user to bypass the retention lock. This parameter is set
--   to true by default for calls from the console.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>TRUE</tt> | <tt>FALSE</tt>
[$sel:bypassGovernanceRetention:AssignTapePool'] :: AssignTapePool -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape that you
--   want to add to the tape pool.
[$sel:tapeARN:AssignTapePool'] :: AssignTapePool -> Text

-- | The ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving.
--   The tape in this pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
[$sel:poolId:AssignTapePool'] :: AssignTapePool -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssignTapePool</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bypassGovernanceRetention:AssignTapePool'</a>,
--   <a>assignTapePool_bypassGovernanceRetention</a> - Set permissions to
--   bypass governance retention. If the lock type of the archived tape is
--   <tt>Governance</tt>, the tape's archived age is not older than
--   <tt>RetentionLockInDays</tt>, and the user does not already have
--   <tt>BypassGovernanceRetention</tt>, setting this to TRUE enables the
--   user to bypass the retention lock. This parameter is set to true by
--   default for calls from the console.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>TRUE</tt> | <tt>FALSE</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:AssignTapePool'</a>, <a>assignTapePool_tapeARN</a> -
--   The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape that you
--   want to add to the tape pool.
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolId:AssignTapePool'</a>, <a>assignTapePool_poolId</a> - The
--   ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving. The
--   tape in this pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
newAssignTapePool :: Text -> Text -> AssignTapePool

-- | Set permissions to bypass governance retention. If the lock type of
--   the archived tape is <tt>Governance</tt>, the tape's archived age is
--   not older than <tt>RetentionLockInDays</tt>, and the user does not
--   already have <tt>BypassGovernanceRetention</tt>, setting this to TRUE
--   enables the user to bypass the retention lock. This parameter is set
--   to true by default for calls from the console.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>TRUE</tt> | <tt>FALSE</tt>
assignTapePool_bypassGovernanceRetention :: Lens' AssignTapePool (Maybe Bool)

-- | The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape that you
--   want to add to the tape pool.
assignTapePool_tapeARN :: Lens' AssignTapePool Text

-- | The ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving.
--   The tape in this pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
assignTapePool_poolId :: Lens' AssignTapePool Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssignTapePoolResponse</a> smart constructor.
data AssignTapePoolResponse
AssignTapePoolResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> AssignTapePoolResponse

-- | The unique Amazon Resource Names (ARN) of the virtual tape that was
--   added to the tape pool.

assignTapePoolResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' AssignTapePoolResponse Int

-- | Configures one or more gateway local disks as working storage for a
--   gateway. This operation is only supported in the stored volume gateway
--   type. This operation is deprecated in cached volume API version
--   20120630. Use AddUploadBuffer instead.
--   
--   Working storage is also referred to as upload buffer. You can also use
--   the AddUploadBuffer operation to add upload buffer to a stored volume
--   gateway.
--   
--   In the request, you specify the gateway Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to
--   which you want to add working storage, and one or more disk IDs that
--   you want to configure as working storage.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AddWorkingStorage

-- | A JSON object containing one or more of the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AddWorkingStorageInput$DiskIds</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddWorkingStorage</a> smart constructor.
data AddWorkingStorage
AddWorkingStorage' :: Text -> [Text] -> AddWorkingStorage
[$sel:gatewayARN:AddWorkingStorage'] :: AddWorkingStorage -> Text

-- | An array of strings that identify disks that are to be configured as
--   working storage. Each string has a minimum length of 1 and maximum
--   length of 300. You can get the disk IDs from the ListLocalDisks API.
[$sel:diskIds:AddWorkingStorage'] :: AddWorkingStorage -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>AddWorkingStorage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:AddWorkingStorage'</a>,
--   <a>addWorkingStorage_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskIds:AddWorkingStorage'</a>,
--   <a>addWorkingStorage_diskIds</a> - An array of strings that identify
--   disks that are to be configured as working storage. Each string has a
--   minimum length of 1 and maximum length of 300. You can get the disk
--   IDs from the ListLocalDisks API.
newAddWorkingStorage :: Text -> AddWorkingStorage

-- | Undocumented member.
addWorkingStorage_gatewayARN :: Lens' AddWorkingStorage Text

-- | An array of strings that identify disks that are to be configured as
--   working storage. Each string has a minimum length of 1 and maximum
--   length of 300. You can get the disk IDs from the ListLocalDisks API.
addWorkingStorage_diskIds :: Lens' AddWorkingStorage [Text]

--   for which working storage was configured.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddWorkingStorageResponse</a> smart constructor.

-- | Adds one or more tags to the specified resource. You use tags to add
--   metadata to resources, which you can use to categorize these
--   resources. For example, you can categorize resources by purpose,
--   owner, environment, or team. Each tag consists of a key and a value,
--   which you define. You can add tags to the following Storage Gateway
--   resources:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Storage gateways of all types</li>
--   <li>Storage volumes</li>
--   <li>Virtual tapes</li>
--   <li>NFS and SMB file shares</li>
--   <li>File System associations</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can create a maximum of 50 tags for each resource. Virtual tapes
--   and storage volumes that are recovered to a new gateway maintain their
--   tags.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AddTagsToResource

-- | AddTagsToResourceInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddTagsToResource</a> smart constructor.
data AddTagsToResource
AddTagsToResource' :: Text -> [Tag] -> AddTagsToResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource you want to add tags
--   to.
[$sel:resourceARN:AddTagsToResource'] :: AddTagsToResource -> Text

-- | The key-value pair that represents the tag you want to add to the
--   resource. The value can be an empty string.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
[$sel:tags:AddTagsToResource'] :: AddTagsToResource -> [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>AddTagsToResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceARN:AddTagsToResource'</a>,
--   <a>addTagsToResource_resourceARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the resource you want to add tags to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:AddTagsToResource'</a>, <a>addTagsToResource_tags</a> -
--   The key-value pair that represents the tag you want to add to the
--   resource. The value can be an empty string.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
newAddTagsToResource :: Text -> AddTagsToResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource you want to add tags
--   to.
addTagsToResource_resourceARN :: Lens' AddTagsToResource Text

-- | The key-value pair that represents the tag you want to add to the
--   resource. The value can be an empty string.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
addTagsToResource_tags :: Lens' AddTagsToResource [Tag]

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddTagsToResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.

--   to.

-- | Configures one or more gateway local disks as cache for a gateway.
--   This operation is only supported in the cached volume, tape, and file
--   gateway type (see <a>How Storage Gateway works (architecture)</a>.
--   
--   In the request, you specify the gateway Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to
--   which you want to add cache, and one or more disk IDs that you want to
--   configure as cache.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AddCache

--   length of 300. You can get the disk IDs from the ListLocalDisks API.

-- | Create a value of <a>AddCache</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskIds:AddCache'</a>, <a>addCache_diskIds</a> - An array of
--   strings that identify disks that are to be configured as working
--   storage. Each string has a minimum length of 1 and maximum length of
--   300. You can get the disk IDs from the ListLocalDisks API.

-- | Activates the gateway you previously deployed on your host. In the
--   activation process, you specify information such as the Region that
--   you want to use for storing snapshots or tapes, the time zone for
--   scheduled snapshots the gateway snapshot schedule window, an
--   activation key, and a name for your gateway. The activation process
--   also associates your gateway with your account. For more information,
--   see UpdateGatewayInformation.
--   
--   You must turn on the gateway VM before you can activate your gateway.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ActivateGateway

-- | A JSON object containing one or more of the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$ActivationKey</li>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$GatewayName</li>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$GatewayRegion</li>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$GatewayTimezone</li>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$GatewayType</li>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$MediumChangerType</li>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$TapeDriveType</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivateGateway</a> smart constructor.
data ActivateGateway
ActivateGateway' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ActivateGateway

-- | The value that indicates the type of medium changer to use for tape
--   gateway. This field is optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>STK-L700</tt> | <tt>AWS-Gateway-VTL</tt> |
--   <tt>IBM-03584L32-0402</tt>
[$sel:mediumChangerType:ActivateGateway'] :: ActivateGateway -> Maybe Text

-- | The value that indicates the type of tape drive to use for tape
--   gateway. This field is optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>IBM-ULT3580-TD5</tt>
[$sel:tapeDriveType:ActivateGateway'] :: ActivateGateway -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that defines the type of gateway to activate. The type
--   specified is critical to all later functions of the gateway and cannot
--   be changed after activation. The default value is <tt>CACHED</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>STORED</tt> | <tt>CACHED</tt> | <tt>VTL</tt> |
--   <tt>FILE_S3</tt> | <tt>FILE_FSX_SMB|</tt>
[$sel:gatewayType:ActivateGateway'] :: ActivateGateway -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that you can assign to the gateway. Each tag
--   is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   that can be represented in UTF-8 format, and the following special
--   characters: + - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128
--   characters, and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256
--   characters.
[$sel:tags:ActivateGateway'] :: ActivateGateway -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Your gateway activation key. You can obtain the activation key by
--   sending an HTTP GET request with redirects enabled to the gateway IP
--   address (port 80). The redirect URL returned in the response provides
--   you the activation key for your gateway in the query string parameter
--   <tt>activationKey</tt>. It may also include other activation-related
--   parameters, however, these are merely defaults -- the arguments you
--   pass to the <tt>ActivateGateway</tt> API call determine the actual
--   configuration of your gateway.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Getting activation key</a> in the
--   <i>Storage Gateway User Guide</i>.
[$sel:activationKey:ActivateGateway'] :: ActivateGateway -> Text

-- | The name you configured for your gateway.
[$sel:gatewayName:ActivateGateway'] :: ActivateGateway -> Text

-- | A value that indicates the time zone you want to set for the gateway.
--   The time zone is of the format "GMT-hr:mm" or "GMT+hr:mm". For
--   example, GMT-4:00 indicates the time is 4 hours behind GMT. GMT+2:00
--   indicates the time is 2 hours ahead of GMT. The time zone is used, for
--   example, for scheduling snapshots and your gateway's maintenance
--   schedule.
[$sel:gatewayTimezone:ActivateGateway'] :: ActivateGateway -> Text

-- | A value that indicates the Region where you want to store your data.
--   The gateway Region specified must be the same Region as the Region in
--   your <tt>Host</tt> header in the request. For more information about
--   available Regions and endpoints for Storage Gateway, see <a>Storage
--   Gateway endpoints and quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: See <a>Storage Gateway endpoints and quotas</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Web Services General Reference</i>.
[$sel:gatewayRegion:ActivateGateway'] :: ActivateGateway -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivateGateway</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

-- | Storage Gateway returns the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the
--   activated gateway. It is a string made of information such as your
--   account, gateway name, and Region. This ARN is used to reference the
--   gateway in other API operations as well as resource-based
--   authorization.
--   
--   For gateways activated prior to September 02, 2015, the gateway ARN
--   contains the gateway name rather than the gateway ID. Changing the
--   name of the gateway has no effect on the gateway ARN.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivateGatewayResponse</a> smart constructor.

-- | Updates the automatic tape creation policy of a gateway. Use this to
--   update the policy with a new set of automatic tape creation rules.
--   This is only supported for tape gateways.
--   
--   By default, there is no automatic tape creation policy.
--   
--   A gateway can have only one automatic tape creation policy.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateAutomaticTapeCreationPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAutomaticTapeCreationPolicy</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateAutomaticTapeCreationPolicy
UpdateAutomaticTapeCreationPolicy' :: NonEmpty AutomaticTapeCreationRule -> Text -> UpdateAutomaticTapeCreationPolicy

-- | An automatic tape creation policy consists of a list of automatic tape
--   creation rules. The rules determine when and how to automatically
--   create new tapes.
[$sel:automaticTapeCreationRules:UpdateAutomaticTapeCreationPolicy'] :: UpdateAutomaticTapeCreationPolicy -> NonEmpty AutomaticTapeCreationRule
[$sel:gatewayARN:UpdateAutomaticTapeCreationPolicy'] :: UpdateAutomaticTapeCreationPolicy -> Text

-- | Updates the bandwidth rate limits of a gateway. You can update both
--   the upload and download bandwidth rate limit or specify only one of
--   the two. If you don't set a bandwidth rate limit, the existing rate
--   limit remains. This operation is supported for the stored volume,
--   cached volume, and tape gateway types.
--   
--   By default, a gateway's bandwidth rate limits are not set. If you
--   don't set any limit, the gateway does not have any limitations on its
--   bandwidth usage and could potentially use the maximum available
--   bandwidth.
--   
--   To specify which gateway to update, use the Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the gateway in your request.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateBandwidthRateLimit

-- | A JSON object containing one or more of the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   
--   <li>UpdateBandwidthRateLimitInput$AverageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec</li>
--   
--   <li>UpdateBandwidthRateLimitInput$AverageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateBandwidthRateLimit</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateBandwidthRateLimit
UpdateBandwidthRateLimit' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> UpdateBandwidthRateLimit

-- | The average upload bandwidth rate limit in bits per second.
[$sel:averageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec:UpdateBandwidthRateLimit'] :: UpdateBandwidthRateLimit -> Maybe Natural

-- | The average download bandwidth rate limit in bits per second.
[$sel:averageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec:UpdateBandwidthRateLimit'] :: UpdateBandwidthRateLimit -> Maybe Natural
[$sel:gatewayARN:UpdateBandwidthRateLimit'] :: UpdateBandwidthRateLimit -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateBandwidthRateLimit</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:averageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec:UpdateBandwidthRateLimit'</a>,
--   <a>updateBandwidthRateLimit_averageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec</a> -
--   The average upload bandwidth rate limit in bits per second.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:averageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec:UpdateBandwidthRateLimit'</a>,
--   <a>updateBandwidthRateLimit_averageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec</a> -
--   The average download bandwidth rate limit in bits per second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:UpdateBandwidthRateLimit'</a>,
--   <a>updateBandwidthRateLimit_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
newUpdateBandwidthRateLimit :: Text -> UpdateBandwidthRateLimit

-- | The average download bandwidth rate limit in bits per second.
updateBandwidthRateLimit_averageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec :: Lens' UpdateBandwidthRateLimit (Maybe Natural)

-- | Undocumented member.
updateBandwidthRateLimit_gatewayARN :: Lens' UpdateBandwidthRateLimit Text

-- | A JSON object containing the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway
--   whose throttle information was updated.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse
UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse
[$sel:gatewayARN:UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse'] :: UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse'] :: UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

-- | Updates the bandwidth rate limit schedule for a specified gateway. By
--   default, gateways do not have bandwidth rate limit schedules, which
--   means no bandwidth rate limiting is in effect. Use this to initiate or
--   update a gateway's bandwidth rate limit schedule. This operation is
--   supported in the volume and tape gateway types.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateBandwidthRateLimitSchedule

--   constructor.

--   gateway. When no bandwidth rate limit intervals have been scheduled,
--   the array is empty.

-- | Updates the Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP)
--   credentials for a specified iSCSI target. By default, a gateway does
--   not have CHAP enabled; however, for added security, you might use it.
--   This operation is supported in the volume and tape gateway types.
--   
--   When you update CHAP credentials, all existing connections on the
--   target are closed and initiators must reconnect with the new
--   credentials.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateChapCredentials

-- | A JSON object containing one or more of the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>UpdateChapCredentialsInput$InitiatorName</li>
--   <li>UpdateChapCredentialsInput$SecretToAuthenticateInitiator</li>
--   <li>UpdateChapCredentialsInput$SecretToAuthenticateTarget</li>
--   <li>UpdateChapCredentialsInput$TargetARN</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateChapCredentials</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateChapCredentials
UpdateChapCredentials' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Text -> Sensitive Text -> Text -> UpdateChapCredentials

-- | The secret key that the target must provide to participate in mutual
--   CHAP with the initiator (e.g. Windows client).
--   
--   Byte constraints: Minimum bytes of 12. Maximum bytes of 16.
--   
--   The secret key must be between 12 and 16 bytes when encoded in UTF-8.
[$sel:secretToAuthenticateTarget:UpdateChapCredentials'] :: UpdateChapCredentials -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the iSCSI volume target. Use the
--   DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes operation to return the TargetARN for
--   specified VolumeARN.
[$sel:targetARN:UpdateChapCredentials'] :: UpdateChapCredentials -> Text

-- | The secret key that the initiator (for example, the Windows client)
--   must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the target.
--   
--   The secret key must be between 12 and 16 bytes when encoded in UTF-8.
[$sel:secretToAuthenticateInitiator:UpdateChapCredentials'] :: UpdateChapCredentials -> Sensitive Text

-- | The iSCSI initiator that connects to the target.
[$sel:initiatorName:UpdateChapCredentials'] :: UpdateChapCredentials -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateChapCredentials</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretToAuthenticateTarget:UpdateChapCredentials'</a>,
--   <a>updateChapCredentials_secretToAuthenticateTarget</a> - The secret
--   key that the target must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with
--   the initiator (e.g. Windows client).
--   
--   Byte constraints: Minimum bytes of 12. Maximum bytes of 16.
--   
--   The secret key must be between 12 and 16 bytes when encoded in UTF-8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetARN:UpdateChapCredentials'</a>,
--   <a>updateChapCredentials_targetARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the iSCSI volume target. Use the DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
--   operation to return the TargetARN for specified VolumeARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretToAuthenticateInitiator:UpdateChapCredentials'</a>,
--   <a>updateChapCredentials_secretToAuthenticateInitiator</a> - The
--   secret key that the initiator (for example, the Windows client) must
--   provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the target.
--   
--   The secret key must be between 12 and 16 bytes when encoded in UTF-8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:initiatorName:UpdateChapCredentials'</a>,
--   <a>updateChapCredentials_initiatorName</a> - The iSCSI initiator that
--   connects to the target.
newUpdateChapCredentials :: Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateChapCredentials

-- | Updates a gateway's metadata, which includes the gateway's name and
--   time zone. To specify which gateway to update, use the Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the gateway in your request.
--   
--   For gateways activated after September 2, 2015, the gateway's ARN
--   contains the gateway ID rather than the gateway name. However,
--   changing the name of the gateway has no effect on the gateway's ARN.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateGatewayInformation

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateGatewayInformation</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateGatewayInformation
UpdateGatewayInformation' :: Maybe GatewayCapacity -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateGatewayInformation

[$sel:gatewayName:UpdateGatewayInformation'] :: UpdateGatewayInformation -> Maybe Text

--   you want to use to monitor and log events in the gateway.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>What is Amazon CloudWatch Logs?</a>
[$sel:cloudWatchLogGroupARN:UpdateGatewayInformation'] :: UpdateGatewayInformation -> Maybe Text
[$sel:gatewayARN:UpdateGatewayInformation'] :: UpdateGatewayInformation -> Text

--   fields omitted.

--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateGatewayInformationResponse'</a>,

-- | Updates the gateway virtual machine (VM) software. The request
--   immediately triggers the software update.
--   
--   When you make this request, you get a <tt>200 OK</tt> success response
--   immediately. However, it might take some time for the update to
--   complete. You can call DescribeGatewayInformation to verify the
--   gateway is in the <tt>STATE_RUNNING</tt> state.
--   
--   A software update forces a system restart of your gateway. You can
--   minimize the chance of any disruption to your applications by
--   increasing your iSCSI Initiators' timeouts. For more information about
--   increasing iSCSI Initiator timeouts for Windows and Linux, see
--   <a>Customizing your Windows iSCSI settings</a> and <a>Customizing your
--   Linux iSCSI settings</a>, respectively.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow

-- | A JSON object containing the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway
--   to update.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateGatewaySoftwareNow</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow

[$sel:gatewayARN:UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow'] :: UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow -> Text

--   fields omitted.

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow'</a>,
--   <a>updateGatewaySoftwareNow_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.

--   that was updated.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateGatewaySoftwareNowResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | Updates a gateway's weekly maintenance start time information,
--   including day and time of the week. The maintenance time is the time
--   in your gateway's time zone.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateMaintenanceStartTime

-- | A JSON object containing the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>UpdateMaintenanceStartTimeInput$DayOfMonth</li>
--   <li>UpdateMaintenanceStartTimeInput$DayOfWeek</li>
--   <li>UpdateMaintenanceStartTimeInput$HourOfDay</li>
--   <li>UpdateMaintenanceStartTimeInput$MinuteOfHour</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateMaintenanceStartTime</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateMaintenanceStartTime
UpdateMaintenanceStartTime' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> Natural -> Natural -> UpdateMaintenanceStartTime

-- | The day of the month component of the maintenance start time
--   represented as an ordinal number from 1 to 28, where 1 represents the
--   first day of the month and 28 represents the last day of the month.
[$sel:dayOfMonth:UpdateMaintenanceStartTime'] :: UpdateMaintenanceStartTime -> Maybe Natural

-- | The day of the week component of the maintenance start time week
--   represented as an ordinal number from 0 to 6, where 0 represents
--   Sunday and 6 Saturday.
[$sel:dayOfWeek:UpdateMaintenanceStartTime'] :: UpdateMaintenanceStartTime -> Maybe Natural
[$sel:gatewayARN:UpdateMaintenanceStartTime'] :: UpdateMaintenanceStartTime -> Text

-- | The hour component of the maintenance start time represented as
--   <i>hh</i>, where <i>hh</i> is the hour (00 to 23). The hour of the day
--   is in the time zone of the gateway.
[$sel:hourOfDay:UpdateMaintenanceStartTime'] :: UpdateMaintenanceStartTime -> Natural

-- | The minute component of the maintenance start time represented as
--   <i>mm</i>, where <i>mm</i> is the minute (00 to 59). The minute of the
--   hour is in the time zone of the gateway.
[$sel:minuteOfHour:UpdateMaintenanceStartTime'] :: UpdateMaintenanceStartTime -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateMaintenanceStartTime</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   component of the maintenance start time represented as an ordinal

--   <a>$sel:dayOfWeek:UpdateMaintenanceStartTime'</a>,

-- | Updates a Network File System (NFS) file share. This operation is only
--   supported in S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   To leave a file share field unchanged, set the corresponding input
--   field to null.
--   
--   Updates the following file share settings:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Default storage class for your S3 bucket</li>
--   <li>Metadata defaults for your S3 bucket</li>
--   <li>Allowed NFS clients for your file share</li>
--   <li>Squash settings</li>
--   <li>Write status of your file share</li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateNFSFileShare

-- | UpdateNFSFileShareInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateNFSFileShare</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateNFSFileShare
UpdateNFSFileShare' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CacheAttributes -> Maybe ObjectACL -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> UpdateNFSFileShare

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
[$sel:kmsKey:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | specifies refresh cache information for the file share.
[$sel:cacheAttributes:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Maybe CacheAttributes

-- | A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects
--   in the S3 bucket that a S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default
--   value is <tt>private</tt>.
[$sel:objectACL:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Maybe ObjectACL

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:kmsEncrypted:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
[$sel:defaultStorageClass:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
[$sel:fileShareName:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
[$sel:notificationPolicy:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | The user mapped to anonymous user.
--   
--   Valid values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>RootSquash</tt>: Only root is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>NoSquash</tt>: No one is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>AllSquash</tt>: Everyone is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:squash:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:requesterPays:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The default values for the file share. Optional.
[$sel:nFSFileShareDefaults:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults

-- | The list of clients that are allowed to access the S3 File Gateway.
--   The list must contain either valid IP addresses or valid CIDR blocks.
[$sel:clientList:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:readOnly:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share to be updated.
[$sel:fileShareARN:UpdateNFSFileShare'] :: UpdateNFSFileShare -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateNFSFileShare</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_kmsKey</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a
--   symmetric customer master key (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side
--   encryption. Storage Gateway does not support asymmetric CMKs. This
--   value can only be set when <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>.
--   Optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheAttributes:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_cacheAttributes</a> - specifies refresh cache
--   information for the file share.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectACL:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_objectACL</a> - A value that sets the access
--   control list (ACL) permission for objects in the S3 bucket that a S3
--   File Gateway puts objects into. The default value is <tt>private</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsEncrypted:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_kmsEncrypted</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt> to use
--   Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your own KMS key, or
--   <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultStorageClass:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_defaultStorageClass</a> - The default storage
--   class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by the S3 File Gateway.
--   The default value is <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareName:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_fileShareName</a> - The name of the file share.
--   Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationPolicy:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_notificationPolicy</a> - The notification policy
--   of the file share. <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number
--   of seconds to wait after the last point in time a client wrote to a
--   file before generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification.
--   Because clients can make many small writes to files, it's best to set
--   this parameter for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple
--   notifications for the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:squash:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_squash</a> - The user mapped to anonymous user.
--   
--   Valid values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>RootSquash</tt>: Only root is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>NoSquash</tt>: No one is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>AllSquash</tt>: Everyone is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:requesterPays:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_requesterPays</a> - A value that sets who pays
--   the cost of the request and the cost associated with data download
--   from the S3 bucket. If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, the
--   requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3 bucket owner pays.
--   However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:nFSFileShareDefaults:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_nFSFileShareDefaults</a> - The default values
--   for the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientList:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_clientList</a> - The list of clients that are
--   allowed to access the S3 File Gateway. The list must contain either
--   valid IP addresses or valid CIDR blocks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_guessMIMETypeEnabled</a> - A value that enables
--   guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects based on file
--   extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable MIME type
--   guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value is
--   <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:readOnly:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_readOnly</a> - A value that sets the write
--   status of a file share. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to set the
--   write status to read-only, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareARN:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_fileShareARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the file share to be updated.
newUpdateNFSFileShare :: Text -> UpdateNFSFileShare

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
updateNFSFileShare_kmsKey :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | specifies refresh cache information for the file share.
updateNFSFileShare_cacheAttributes :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe CacheAttributes)

-- | A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects
--   in the S3 bucket that a S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default
--   value is <tt>private</tt>.
updateNFSFileShare_objectACL :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe ObjectACL)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateNFSFileShare_kmsEncrypted :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
updateNFSFileShare_defaultStorageClass :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
updateNFSFileShare_fileShareName :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
updateNFSFileShare_notificationPolicy :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The user mapped to anonymous user.
--   
--   Valid values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>RootSquash</tt>: Only root is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>NoSquash</tt>: No one is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>AllSquash</tt>: Everyone is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   </ul>
updateNFSFileShare_squash :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateNFSFileShare_requesterPays :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default values for the file share. Optional.
updateNFSFileShare_nFSFileShareDefaults :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults)

-- | The list of clients that are allowed to access the S3 File Gateway.
--   The list must contain either valid IP addresses or valid CIDR blocks.
updateNFSFileShare_clientList :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateNFSFileShare_guessMIMETypeEnabled :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateNFSFileShare_readOnly :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share to be updated.
updateNFSFileShare_fileShareARN :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare Text

-- | UpdateNFSFileShareOutput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateNFSFileShareResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateNFSFileShareResponse
UpdateNFSFileShareResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> UpdateNFSFileShareResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the updated file share.
[$sel:fileShareARN:UpdateNFSFileShareResponse'] :: UpdateNFSFileShareResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateNFSFileShareResponse'] :: UpdateNFSFileShareResponse -> Int

--   fields omitted.

newUpdateNFSFileShareResponse :: Int -> UpdateNFSFileShareResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the updated file share.
updateNFSFileShareResponse_fileShareARN :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShareResponse (Maybe Text)

updateNFSFileShareResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShareResponse Int

-- | Updates a Server Message Block (SMB) file share. This operation is
--   only supported for S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   To leave a file share field unchanged, set the corresponding input
--   field to null.
--   
--   File gateways require Security Token Service (STS) to be activated to
--   enable you to create a file share. Make sure that STS is activated in
--   the Region you are creating your file gateway in. If STS is not
--   activated in this Region, activate it. For information about how to
--   activate STS, see <a>Activating and deactivating STS in an Region</a>
--   in the <i>Identity and Access Management User Guide</i>.
--   
--   File gateways don't support creating hard or symbolic links on a file
--   share.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateSMBFileShare

-- | UpdateSMBFileShareInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateSMBFileShare</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateSMBFileShare
UpdateSMBFileShare' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe CacheAttributes -> Maybe ObjectACL -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CaseSensitivity -> Text -> UpdateSMBFileShare

-- | The files and folders on this share will only be visible to users with
--   read access.
[$sel:accessBasedEnumeration:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that have
--   administrator rights to the file share. A group must be prefixed with
--   the @ character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
[$sel:adminUserList:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for audit logs.
[$sel:auditDestinationARN:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are not allowed
--   to access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @
--   character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
[$sel:invalidUserList:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
[$sel:kmsKey:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are allowed to
--   access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @ character.
--   Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>,
--   <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if
--   Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
[$sel:validUserList:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specifies refresh cache information for the file share.
[$sel:cacheAttributes:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe CacheAttributes

-- | A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects
--   in the S3 bucket that a S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default
--   value is <tt>private</tt>.
[$sel:objectACL:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe ObjectACL

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:kmsEncrypted:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
[$sel:defaultStorageClass:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
[$sel:fileShareName:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable access control list (ACL) on
--   the SMB file share. Set it to <tt>false</tt> to map file and directory
--   permissions to the POSIX permissions.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Using Microsoft Windows ACLs to control
--   access to an SMB file share</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:sMBACLEnabled:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether opportunistic locking is enabled for the SMB file
--   share.
--   
--   Enabling opportunistic locking on case-sensitive shares is not
--   recommended for workloads that involve access to files with the same
--   name in different case.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:oplocksEnabled:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
[$sel:notificationPolicy:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:requesterPays:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:readOnly:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The case of an object name in an Amazon S3 bucket. For
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client determines the case sensitivity.
--   For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the gateway determines the case
--   sensitivity. The default value is <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
[$sel:caseSensitivity:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Maybe CaseSensitivity

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SMB file share that you want to
--   update.
[$sel:fileShareARN:UpdateSMBFileShare'] :: UpdateSMBFileShare -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateSMBFileShare</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   read access.
updateSMBFileShare_accessBasedEnumeration :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that have
--   administrator rights to the file share. A group must be prefixed with
--   the @ character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
updateSMBFileShare_adminUserList :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for audit logs.
updateSMBFileShare_auditDestinationARN :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are not allowed
--   to access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @
--   character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
updateSMBFileShare_invalidUserList :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
updateSMBFileShare_kmsKey :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are allowed to
--   access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @ character.
--   Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>,
--   <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if
--   Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
updateSMBFileShare_validUserList :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies refresh cache information for the file share.
updateSMBFileShare_cacheAttributes :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe CacheAttributes)

-- | A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects
--   in the S3 bucket that a S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default
--   value is <tt>private</tt>.
updateSMBFileShare_objectACL :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe ObjectACL)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_kmsEncrypted :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_defaultStorageClass :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
updateSMBFileShare_fileShareName :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable access control list (ACL) on
--   the SMB file share. Set it to <tt>false</tt> to map file and directory
--   permissions to the POSIX permissions.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Using Microsoft Windows ACLs to control
--   access to an SMB file share</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_sMBACLEnabled :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether opportunistic locking is enabled for the SMB file
--   share.
--   
--   Enabling opportunistic locking on case-sensitive shares is not
--   recommended for workloads that involve access to files with the same
--   name in different case.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_oplocksEnabled :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
updateSMBFileShare_notificationPolicy :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_requesterPays :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_guessMIMETypeEnabled :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_readOnly :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The case of an object name in an Amazon S3 bucket. For
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client determines the case sensitivity.
--   For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the gateway determines the case
--   sensitivity. The default value is <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
updateSMBFileShare_caseSensitivity :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe CaseSensitivity)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SMB file share that you want to
--   update.
updateSMBFileShare_fileShareARN :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare Text

-- | UpdateSMBFileShareOutput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateSMBFileShareResponse</a> smart constructor.
