-- | Updates the SMB security strategy on a file gateway. This action is
--   only supported in file gateways.
--   
--   This API is called Security level in the User Guide.
--   
--   A higher security level can affect performance of the gateway.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateSMBSecurityStrategy</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy
UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy' :: Text -> SMBSecurityStrategy -> UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy
[$sel:gatewayARN:UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy'] :: UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy -> Text

-- | Specifies the type of security strategy.
--   
--   ClientSpecified: if you use this option, requests are established
--   based on what is negotiated by the client. This option is recommended
--   when you want to maximize compatibility across different clients in
--   your environment. Supported only in S3 File Gateway.
--   
--   MandatorySigning: if you use this option, file gateway only allows
--   connections from SMBv2 or SMBv3 clients that have signing enabled.
--   This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows Vista, Windows
--   Server 2008 or newer.
--   
--   MandatoryEncryption: if you use this option, file gateway only allows
--   connections from SMBv3 clients that have encryption enabled. This
--   option is highly recommended for environments that handle sensitive
--   data. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows 8,
--   Windows Server 2012 or newer.
[$sel:sMBSecurityStrategy:UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy'] :: UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy -> SMBSecurityStrategy

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBSecurityStrategy_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sMBSecurityStrategy:UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBSecurityStrategy_sMBSecurityStrategy</a> - Specifies the
--   type of security strategy.
--   
--   ClientSpecified: if you use this option, requests are established
--   based on what is negotiated by the client. This option is recommended
--   when you want to maximize compatibility across different clients in
--   your environment. Supported only in S3 File Gateway.
--   
--   MandatorySigning: if you use this option, file gateway only allows
--   connections from SMBv2 or SMBv3 clients that have signing enabled.
--   This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows Vista, Windows
--   Server 2008 or newer.
--   
--   MandatoryEncryption: if you use this option, file gateway only allows
--   connections from SMBv3 clients that have encryption enabled. This
--   option is highly recommended for environments that handle sensitive
--   data. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows 8,
--   Windows Server 2012 or newer.
newUpdateSMBSecurityStrategy :: Text -> SMBSecurityStrategy -> UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy

-- | Undocumented member.
updateSMBSecurityStrategy_gatewayARN :: Lens' UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy Text

-- | Specifies the type of security strategy.
--   
--   ClientSpecified: if you use this option, requests are established
--   based on what is negotiated by the client. This option is recommended
--   when you want to maximize compatibility across different clients in
--   your environment. Supported only in S3 File Gateway.
--   
--   MandatorySigning: if you use this option, file gateway only allows
--   connections from SMBv2 or SMBv3 clients that have signing enabled.
--   This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows Vista, Windows
--   Server 2008 or newer.
--   
--   MandatoryEncryption: if you use this option, file gateway only allows
--   connections from SMBv3 clients that have encryption enabled. This
--   option is highly recommended for environments that handle sensitive
--   data. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows 8,
--   Windows Server 2012 or newer.
updateSMBSecurityStrategy_sMBSecurityStrategy :: Lens' UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy SMBSecurityStrategy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateSMBSecurityStrategyResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateSMBSecurityStrategyResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateSMBSecurityStrategyResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

-- | Updates a snapshot schedule configured for a gateway volume. This
--   operation is only supported in the cached volume and stored volume
--   gateway types.
--   
--   The default snapshot schedule for volume is once every 24 hours,
--   starting at the creation time of the volume. You can use this API to
--   change the snapshot schedule configured for the volume.
--   
--   In the request you must identify the gateway volume whose snapshot
--   schedule you want to update, and the schedule information, including
--   when you want the snapshot to begin on a day and the frequency (in
--   hours) of snapshots.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateSnapshotSchedule

-- | A JSON object containing one or more of the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>UpdateSnapshotScheduleInput$Description</li>
--   <li>UpdateSnapshotScheduleInput$RecurrenceInHours</li>
--   <li>UpdateSnapshotScheduleInput$StartAt</li>
--   <li>UpdateSnapshotScheduleInput$VolumeARN</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateSnapshotSchedule</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateSnapshotSchedule
UpdateSnapshotSchedule' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Natural -> Natural -> UpdateSnapshotSchedule

-- | Optional description of the snapshot that overwrites the existing
--   description.
[$sel:description:UpdateSnapshotSchedule'] :: UpdateSnapshotSchedule -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to a snapshot. Each tag
--   is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
[$sel:tags:UpdateSnapshotSchedule'] :: UpdateSnapshotSchedule -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume. Use the ListVolumes
--   operation to return a list of gateway volumes.
[$sel:volumeARN:UpdateSnapshotSchedule'] :: UpdateSnapshotSchedule -> Text

-- | The hour of the day at which the snapshot schedule begins represented
--   as <i>hh</i>, where <i>hh</i> is the hour (0 to 23). The hour of the
--   day is in the time zone of the gateway.
[$sel:startAt:UpdateSnapshotSchedule'] :: UpdateSnapshotSchedule -> Natural

-- | Frequency of snapshots. Specify the number of hours between snapshots.
[$sel:recurrenceInHours:UpdateSnapshotSchedule'] :: UpdateSnapshotSchedule -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateSnapshotSchedule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateSnapshotSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>updateSnapshotSchedule_description</a> - Optional description of
--   the snapshot that overwrites the existing description.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:UpdateSnapshotSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>updateSnapshotSchedule_tags</a> - A list of up to 50 tags that can
--   be assigned to a snapshot. Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeARN:UpdateSnapshotSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>updateSnapshotSchedule_volumeARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the volume. Use the ListVolumes operation to return a list of
--   gateway volumes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startAt:UpdateSnapshotSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>updateSnapshotSchedule_startAt</a> - The hour of the day at which
--   the snapshot schedule begins represented as <i>hh</i>, where <i>hh</i>
--   is the hour (0 to 23). The hour of the day is in the time zone of the
--   gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recurrenceInHours:UpdateSnapshotSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>updateSnapshotSchedule_recurrenceInHours</a> - Frequency of
--   snapshots. Specify the number of hours between snapshots.
newUpdateSnapshotSchedule :: Text -> Natural -> Natural -> UpdateSnapshotSchedule

-- | Optional description of the snapshot that overwrites the existing
--   description.
updateSnapshotSchedule_description :: Lens' UpdateSnapshotSchedule (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to a snapshot. Each tag
--   is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
updateSnapshotSchedule_tags :: Lens' UpdateSnapshotSchedule (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume. Use the ListVolumes
--   operation to return a list of gateway volumes.
updateSnapshotSchedule_volumeARN :: Lens' UpdateSnapshotSchedule Text

-- | The hour of the day at which the snapshot schedule begins represented
--   as <i>hh</i>, where <i>hh</i> is the hour (0 to 23). The hour of the
--   day is in the time zone of the gateway.
updateSnapshotSchedule_startAt :: Lens' UpdateSnapshotSchedule Natural

-- | Frequency of snapshots. Specify the number of hours between snapshots.
updateSnapshotSchedule_recurrenceInHours :: Lens' UpdateSnapshotSchedule Natural

--   storage volume.
--

--   constructor.

--   operation to return a list of gateway volumes.

-- | Updates the type of medium changer in a tape gateway. When you
--   activate a tape gateway, you select a medium changer type for the tape
--   gateway. This operation enables you to select a different type of
--   medium changer after a tape gateway is activated. This operation is
--   only supported in the tape gateway type.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateVTLDeviceType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateVTLDeviceType</a> smart constructor.

--   select.

--   <tt>IBM-03584L32-0402</tt>

--   want to select.

--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when

--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.

createStorediSCSIVolume_diskId :: Lens' CreateStorediSCSIVolume Text

--   disk. Otherwise, set to <tt>false</tt> to create an empty volume.
--

createStorediSCSIVolume_preserveExistingData :: Lens' CreateStorediSCSIVolume Bool

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
createStorediSCSIVolume_targetName :: Lens' CreateStorediSCSIVolume Text

createNFSFileShare_cacheAttributes :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe CacheAttributes)

--   in the S3 bucket that a S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default
--   value is <tt>private</tt>.
createNFSFileShare_objectACL :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe ObjectACL)

--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createNFSFileShare_kmsEncrypted :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
createNFSFileShare_defaultStorageClass :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
createNFSFileShare_fileShareName :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
createNFSFileShare_notificationPolicy :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that maps a user to anonymous user.
--   
--   Valid values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>RootSquash</tt>: Only root is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>NoSquash</tt>: No one is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>AllSquash</tt>: Everyone is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   </ul>
createNFSFileShare_squash :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createNFSFileShare_requesterPays :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | File share default values. Optional.
createNFSFileShare_nFSFileShareDefaults :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults)

-- | The list of clients that are allowed to access the S3 File Gateway.
--   The list must contain either valid IP addresses or valid CIDR blocks.
createNFSFileShare_clientList :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.

--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createNFSFileShare_guessMIMETypeEnabled :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to the NFS file share.

--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
createNFSFileShare_tags :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare (Maybe [Tag])

--   to ensure idempotent file share creation.
createNFSFileShare_clientToken :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 File Gateway on which you
--   want to create a file share.
createNFSFileShare_gatewayARN :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare Text

-- | The ARN of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that an S3
--   File Gateway assumes when it accesses the underlying storage.
createNFSFileShare_role :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare Text

-- | The ARN of the backend storage used for storing file data. A prefix
--   name can be added to the S3 bucket name. It must end with a "/".
--   
--   You can specify a bucket attached to an access point using a complete
--   ARN that includes the bucket region as shown:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:s3:region:account-id:accesspoint/access-point-name
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you specify a bucket attached to an access point, the bucket policy
--   must be configured to delegate access control to the access point. For
--   information, see <a>Delegating access control to access points</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
createNFSFileShare_locationARN :: Lens' CreateNFSFileShare Text

--   target volume and detach the volume. The default is <tt>false</tt>. If

--   DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes operation to return to retrieve the
--   TargetARN for specified VolumeARN.
describeChapCredentials_targetARN :: Lens' DescribeChapCredentials Text

-- | An array of ChapInfo objects that represent CHAP credentials. Each
--   object in the array contains CHAP credential information for one
--   target-initiator pair. If no CHAP credentials are set, an empty array
--   is returned. CHAP credential information is provided in a JSON object
--   with the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>InitiatorName</b>: The iSCSI initiator that connects to the
--   target.</li>
--   <li><b>SecretToAuthenticateInitiator</b>: The secret key that the
--   initiator (for example, the Windows client) must provide to
--   participate in mutual CHAP with the target.</li>
--   <li><b>SecretToAuthenticateTarget</b>: The secret key that the target
--   must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the initiator (e.g.
--   Windows client).</li>
--   <li><b>TargetARN</b>: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage
--   volume.</li>
--   </ul>
describeChapCredentialsResponse_chapCredentials :: Lens' DescribeChapCredentialsResponse (Maybe [ChapInfo])

-- | The response's http status code.
describeChapCredentialsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeChapCredentialsResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
createTapes_kmsKey :: Lens' CreateTapes (Maybe Text)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createTapes_kmsEncrypted :: Lens' CreateTapes (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving.
--   The tape in this pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
createTapes_poolId :: Lens' CreateTapes (Maybe Text)

-- | Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> if the tape you are creating is to be configured
--   as a write-once-read-many (WORM) tape.
createTapes_worm :: Lens' CreateTapes (Maybe Bool)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to a virtual tape. Each
--   tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
createTapes_tags :: Lens' CreateTapes (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that represents the gateway to
--   associate the virtual tapes with. Use the ListGateways operation to
--   return a list of gateways for your account and Region.
createTapes_gatewayARN :: Lens' CreateTapes Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tapes that you want to create.
--   
--   The size must be aligned by gigabyte (1024*1024*1024 bytes).
createTapes_tapeSizeInBytes :: Lens' CreateTapes Integer

-- | A unique identifier that you use to retry a request. If you retry a
--   request, use the same <tt>ClientToken</tt> you specified in the
--   initial request.
--   
--   Using the same <tt>ClientToken</tt> prevents creating the tape
--   multiple times.
createTapes_clientToken :: Lens' CreateTapes Text

-- | The number of virtual tapes that you want to create.
createTapes_numTapesToCreate :: Lens' CreateTapes Natural

-- | A prefix that you append to the barcode of the virtual tape you are
--   creating. This prefix makes the barcode unique.
--   
--   The prefix must be 1-4 characters in length and must be one of the
--   uppercase letters from A to Z.
createTapes_tapeBarcodePrefix :: Lens' CreateTapes Text

-- | A list of unique Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) that represents the
--   virtual tapes that were created.
createTapesResponse_tapeARNs :: Lens' CreateTapesResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The response's http status code.
createTapesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateTapesResponse Int

createCachediSCSIVolume_tags :: Lens' CreateCachediSCSIVolume (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.

--   the Active Directory domain. The domain user account should be enabled
--   to join computers to the domain. For example, you can use the domain
--   administrator account or an account with delegated permissions to join

--   domain.

-- | Indicates the status of the gateway as a member of the Active
--   Directory domain.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACCESS_DENIED</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to an authentication error.</li>
--   <li><tt>DETACHED</tt>: Indicates that gateway is not joined to a
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINED</tt>: Indicates that the gateway has successfully
--   joined a domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINING</tt>: Indicates that a <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation
--   is in progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>NETWORK_ERROR</tt>: Indicates that <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to a network or connectivity error.</li>
--   <li><tt>TIMEOUT</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation
--   failed because the operation didn't complete within the allotted
--   time.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN_ERROR</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to another type of error.</li>
--   </ul>
joinDomainResponse_activeDirectoryStatus :: Lens' JoinDomainResponse (Maybe ActiveDirectoryStatus)

--   governance mode, accounts with specific IAM permissions are authorized
--   to remove the tape retention lock from archived virtual tapes. When
--   configured in compliance mode, the tape retention lock cannot be

-- | The files and folders on this share will only be visible to users with
--   read access.
createSMBFileShare_accessBasedEnumeration :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that will be granted
--   administrator privileges on the file share. These users can do all
--   file operations as the super-user. Acceptable formats include:
--   <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and
--   <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>.
--   
--   Use this option very carefully, because any user in this list can do
--   anything they like on the file share, regardless of file permissions.
createSMBFileShare_adminUserList :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for audit logs.
createSMBFileShare_auditDestinationARN :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are not allowed
--   to access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @
--   character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
createSMBFileShare_invalidUserList :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
createSMBFileShare_kmsKey :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are allowed to
--   access the file <a></a> share. A group must be prefixed with the @
--   character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
createSMBFileShare_validUserList :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe [Text])

--   uses to connect to Amazon S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
createSMBFileShare_vPCEndpointDNSName :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

--   default is <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt> | <tt>GuestAccess</tt>
createSMBFileShare_authentication :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

createSMBFileShare_cacheAttributes :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe CacheAttributes)

-- | A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects
--   in the S3 bucket that a S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default
--   value is <tt>private</tt>.
createSMBFileShare_objectACL :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe ObjectACL)

--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createSMBFileShare_kmsEncrypted :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
createSMBFileShare_defaultStorageClass :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
createSMBFileShare_fileShareName :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable access control list (ACL) on
--   the SMB file share. Set it to <tt>false</tt> to map file and directory
--   permissions to the POSIX permissions.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Using Microsoft Windows ACLs to control
--   access to an SMB file share</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createSMBFileShare_sMBACLEnabled :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether opportunistic locking is enabled for the SMB file
--   share.
--   
--   Enabling opportunistic locking on case-sensitive shares is not
--   recommended for workloads that involve access to files with the same
--   name in different case.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createSMBFileShare_oplocksEnabled :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
createSMBFileShare_notificationPolicy :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createSMBFileShare_requesterPays :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createSMBFileShare_guessMIMETypeEnabled :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
createSMBFileShare_readOnly :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the SMB file share stores
--   files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
createSMBFileShare_bucketRegion :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The case of an object name in an Amazon S3 bucket. For
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client determines the case sensitivity.
--   For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the gateway determines the case
--   sensitivity. The default value is <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
createSMBFileShare_caseSensitivity :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe CaseSensitivity)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to the NFS file share.
--   Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers

--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
createSMBFileShare_tags :: Lens' CreateSMBFileShare (Maybe [Tag])

--   name can be added to the S3 bucket name. It must end with a "/".
--   
--   You can specify a bucket attached to an access point using a complete
--   ARN that includes the bucket region as shown:
--   
--   <pre>

--   </pre>

-- | An array of strings where each string represents the Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of a stored volume. All of the specified stored volumes
--   must be from the same gateway. Use ListVolumes to get volume ARNs for
--   a gateway.
describeStorediSCSIVolumes_volumeARNs :: Lens' DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes [Text]

-- | Describes a single unit of output from DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes. The
--   following fields are returned:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ChapEnabled</tt>: Indicates whether mutual CHAP is enabled for
--   the iSCSI target.</li>
--   <li><tt>LunNumber</tt>: The logical disk number.</li>
--   <li><tt>NetworkInterfaceId</tt>: The network interface ID of the
--   stored volume that initiator use to map the stored volume as an iSCSI
--   target.</li>
--   <li><tt>NetworkInterfacePort</tt>: The port used to communicate with
--   iSCSI targets.</li>
--   <li><tt>PreservedExistingData</tt>: Indicates when the stored volume
--   was created, existing data on the underlying local disk was
--   preserved.</li>
--   <li><tt>SourceSnapshotId</tt>: If the stored volume was created from a
--   snapshot, this field contains the snapshot ID used, e.g.
--   <tt>snap-1122aabb</tt>. Otherwise, this field is not included.</li>
--   <li><tt>StorediSCSIVolumes</tt>: An array of StorediSCSIVolume objects
--   where each object contains metadata about one stored volume.</li>
--   <li><tt>TargetARN</tt>: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume
--   target.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeARN</tt>: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the stored
--   volume.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeDiskId</tt>: The disk ID of the local disk that was
--   specified in the CreateStorediSCSIVolume operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeId</tt>: The unique identifier of the storage volume,
--   e.g. <tt>vol-1122AABB</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeiSCSIAttributes</tt>: An VolumeiSCSIAttributes object
--   that represents a collection of iSCSI attributes for one stored
--   volume.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeProgress</tt>: Represents the percentage complete if the
--   volume is restoring or bootstrapping that represents the percent of
--   data transferred. This field does not appear in the response if the
--   stored volume is not restoring or bootstrapping.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeSizeInBytes</tt>: The size of the volume in bytes.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeStatus</tt>: One of the <tt>VolumeStatus</tt> values
--   that indicates the state of the volume.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeType</tt>: One of the enumeration values describing the
--   type of the volume. Currently, only <tt>STORED</tt> volumes are
--   supported.</li>
--   </ul>
describeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse_storediSCSIVolumes :: Lens' DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse (Maybe [StorediSCSIVolume])

-- | The response's http status code.
describeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse Int

-- | If this value is set to true, the operation disassociates an Amazon
--   FSx file system immediately. It ends all data uploads to the file
--   system, and the file system association enters the
--   <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> status. If this value is set to false, the
--   Amazon FSx file system does not disassociate until all data is
--   uploaded.

-- | The day of the month component of the maintenance start time
--   represented as an ordinal number from 1 to 28, where 1 represents the

-- | The day of the week component of the maintenance start time week
--   represented as an ordinal number from 0 to 6, where 0 represents
--   Sunday and 6 Saturday.
updateMaintenanceStartTime_dayOfWeek :: Lens' UpdateMaintenanceStartTime (Maybe Natural)

-- | Undocumented member.
updateMaintenanceStartTime_gatewayARN :: Lens' UpdateMaintenanceStartTime Text

-- | The hour component of the maintenance start time represented as
--   <i>hh</i>, where <i>hh</i> is the hour (00 to 23). The hour of the day
--   is in the time zone of the gateway.
updateMaintenanceStartTime_hourOfDay :: Lens' UpdateMaintenanceStartTime Natural

-- | The minute component of the maintenance start time represented as
--   <i>mm</i>, where <i>mm</i> is the minute (00 to 59). The minute of the
--   hour is in the time zone of the gateway.
updateMaintenanceStartTime_minuteOfHour :: Lens' UpdateMaintenanceStartTime Natural

-- | Undocumented member.
updateMaintenanceStartTimeResponse_gatewayARN :: Lens' UpdateMaintenanceStartTimeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateMaintenanceStartTimeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateMaintenanceStartTimeResponse Int

describeGatewayInformationResponse_tags :: Lens' DescribeGatewayInformationResponse (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The response's http status code.
describeGatewayInformationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeGatewayInformationResponse Int

-- | A comma-separated list of the paths of folders to refresh in the
--   cache. The default is [<tt>"/"</tt>]. The default refreshes objects
--   and folders at the root of the Amazon S3 bucket. If <tt>Recursive</tt>
--   is set to <tt>true</tt>, the entire S3 bucket that the file share has
--   access to is refreshed.
refreshCache_folderList :: Lens' RefreshCache (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A value that specifies whether to recursively refresh folders in the
--   cache. The refresh includes folders that were in the cache the last
--   time the gateway listed the folder's contents. If this value set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, each folder that is listed in <tt>FolderList</tt> is
--   recursively updated. Otherwise, subfolders listed in
--   <tt>FolderList</tt> are not refreshed. Only objects that are in
--   folders listed directly under <tt>FolderList</tt> are found and used
--   for the update. The default is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
refreshCache_recursive :: Lens' RefreshCache (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share you want to refresh.
refreshCache_fileShareARN :: Lens' RefreshCache Text

-- | Undocumented member.
refreshCacheResponse_fileShareARN :: Lens' RefreshCacheResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
refreshCacheResponse_notificationId :: Lens' RefreshCacheResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
refreshCacheResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RefreshCacheResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
updateNFSFileShare_kmsKey :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | specifies refresh cache information for the file share.
updateNFSFileShare_cacheAttributes :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe CacheAttributes)

-- | A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects
--   in the S3 bucket that a S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default
--   value is <tt>private</tt>.
updateNFSFileShare_objectACL :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe ObjectACL)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateNFSFileShare_kmsEncrypted :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
updateNFSFileShare_defaultStorageClass :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
updateNFSFileShare_fileShareName :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
updateNFSFileShare_notificationPolicy :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The user mapped to anonymous user.
--   
--   Valid values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>RootSquash</tt>: Only root is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>NoSquash</tt>: No one is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>AllSquash</tt>: Everyone is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   </ul>
updateNFSFileShare_squash :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateNFSFileShare_requesterPays :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default values for the file share. Optional.
updateNFSFileShare_nFSFileShareDefaults :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults)

-- | The list of clients that are allowed to access the S3 File Gateway.
--   The list must contain either valid IP addresses or valid CIDR blocks.
updateNFSFileShare_clientList :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateNFSFileShare_guessMIMETypeEnabled :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateNFSFileShare_readOnly :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share to be updated.
updateNFSFileShare_fileShareARN :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShare Text

updateNFSFileShareResponse_fileShareARN :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShareResponse (Maybe Text)

updateNFSFileShareResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateNFSFileShareResponse Int

describeSMBSettingsResponse_fileSharesVisible :: Lens' DescribeSMBSettingsResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Indicates the status of a gateway that is a member of the Active
--   Directory domain.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACCESS_DENIED</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to an authentication error.</li>
--   <li><tt>DETACHED</tt>: Indicates that gateway is not joined to a
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINED</tt>: Indicates that the gateway has successfully
--   joined a domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINING</tt>: Indicates that a <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation
--   is in progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>NETWORK_ERROR</tt>: Indicates that <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to a network or connectivity error.</li>
--   <li><tt>TIMEOUT</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation
--   failed because the operation didn't complete within the allotted
--   time.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN_ERROR</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to another type of error.</li>
--   </ul>
describeSMBSettingsResponse_activeDirectoryStatus :: Lens' DescribeSMBSettingsResponse (Maybe ActiveDirectoryStatus)

-- | The name of the domain that the gateway is joined to.
describeSMBSettingsResponse_domainName :: Lens' DescribeSMBSettingsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | This value is <tt>true</tt> if a password for the guest user
--   <tt>smbguest</tt> is set, otherwise <tt>false</tt>. Only supported for
--   S3 File Gateways.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
describeSMBSettingsResponse_sMBGuestPasswordSet :: Lens' DescribeSMBSettingsResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of security strategy that was specified for file gateway.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ClientSpecified</tt>: If you use this option, requests are
--   established based on what is negotiated by the client. This option is
--   recommended when you want to maximize compatibility across different
--   clients in your environment. Only supported for S3 File Gateways.</li>
--   <li><tt>MandatorySigning</tt>: If you use this option, file gateway
--   only allows connections from SMBv2 or SMBv3 clients that have signing
--   enabled. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows
--   Vista, Windows Server 2008 or newer.</li>
--   <li><tt>MandatoryEncryption</tt>: If you use this option, file gateway
--   only allows connections from SMBv3 clients that have encryption
--   enabled. This option is highly recommended for environments that
--   handle sensitive data. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft
--   Windows 8, Windows Server 2012 or newer.</li>
--   </ul>
describeSMBSettingsResponse_sMBSecurityStrategy :: Lens' DescribeSMBSettingsResponse (Maybe SMBSecurityStrategy)

describeSMBSettingsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeSMBSettingsResponse Int

--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class

--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
createSnapshot_tags :: Lens' CreateSnapshot (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume. Use the ListVolumes
--   operation to return a list of gateway volumes.
createSnapshot_volumeARN :: Lens' CreateSnapshot Text

-- | Textual description of the snapshot that appears in the Amazon EC2
--   console, Elastic Block Store snapshots panel in the <b>Description</b>
--   field, and in the Storage Gateway snapshot <b>Details</b> pane,
--   <b>Description</b> field.
createSnapshot_snapshotDescription :: Lens' CreateSnapshot Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume of which the snapshot was
--   taken.
createSnapshotResponse_volumeARN :: Lens' CreateSnapshotResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The snapshot ID that is used to refer to the snapshot in future
--   operations such as describing snapshots (Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
--   API <tt>DescribeSnapshots</tt>) or creating a volume from a snapshot
--   (CreateStorediSCSIVolume).
createSnapshotResponse_snapshotId :: Lens' CreateSnapshotResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
createSnapshotResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateSnapshotResponse Int

-- | Undocumented member.
updateSMBSecurityStrategy_gatewayARN :: Lens' UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy Text

-- | Specifies the type of security strategy.
--   
--   ClientSpecified: if you use this option, requests are established
--   based on what is negotiated by the client. This option is recommended
--   when you want to maximize compatibility across different clients in
--   your environment. Supported only in S3 File Gateway.
--   
--   MandatorySigning: if you use this option, file gateway only allows
--   connections from SMBv2 or SMBv3 clients that have signing enabled.
--   This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows Vista, Windows
--   Server 2008 or newer.
--   
--   MandatoryEncryption: if you use this option, file gateway only allows
--   connections from SMBv3 clients that have encryption enabled. This
--   option is highly recommended for environments that handle sensitive
--   data. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows 8,
--   Windows Server 2012 or newer.
updateSMBSecurityStrategy_sMBSecurityStrategy :: Lens' UpdateSMBSecurityStrategy SMBSecurityStrategy

-- | Undocumented member.
updateSMBSecurityStrategyResponse_gatewayARN :: Lens' UpdateSMBSecurityStrategyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateSMBSecurityStrategyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateSMBSecurityStrategyResponse Int

-- | The files and folders on this share will only be visible to users with
--   read access.
updateSMBFileShare_accessBasedEnumeration :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that have
--   administrator rights to the file share. A group must be prefixed with
--   the @ character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
updateSMBFileShare_adminUserList :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for audit logs.
updateSMBFileShare_auditDestinationARN :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are not allowed
--   to access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @
--   character. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can
--   only be set if Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
updateSMBFileShare_invalidUserList :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key
--   (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does
--   not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when
--   <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
updateSMBFileShare_kmsKey :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are allowed to
--   access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @ character.
--   Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>,
--   <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if
--   Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
updateSMBFileShare_validUserList :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies refresh cache information for the file share.
updateSMBFileShare_cacheAttributes :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe CacheAttributes)

-- | A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects
--   in the S3 bucket that a S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default
--   value is <tt>private</tt>.
updateSMBFileShare_objectACL :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe ObjectACL)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_kmsEncrypted :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_defaultStorageClass :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
updateSMBFileShare_fileShareName :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable access control list (ACL) on
--   the SMB file share. Set it to <tt>false</tt> to map file and directory
--   permissions to the POSIX permissions.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Using Microsoft Windows ACLs to control
--   access to an SMB file share</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_sMBACLEnabled :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether opportunistic locking is enabled for the SMB file
--   share.
--   
--   Enabling opportunistic locking on case-sensitive shares is not
--   recommended for workloads that involve access to files with the same
--   name in different case.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_oplocksEnabled :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
updateSMBFileShare_notificationPolicy :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_requesterPays :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_guessMIMETypeEnabled :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
updateSMBFileShare_readOnly :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The case of an object name in an Amazon S3 bucket. For
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client determines the case sensitivity.
--   For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the gateway determines the case
--   sensitivity. The default value is <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
updateSMBFileShare_caseSensitivity :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare (Maybe CaseSensitivity)

updateSMBFileShare_fileShareARN :: Lens' UpdateSMBFileShare Text

-- | The value that indicates the type of medium changer to use for tape
--   gateway. This field is optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>STK-L700</tt> | <tt>AWS-Gateway-VTL</tt> |
--   <tt>IBM-03584L32-0402</tt>
activateGateway_mediumChangerType :: Lens' ActivateGateway (Maybe Text)

-- | The value that indicates the type of tape drive to use for tape
--   gateway. This field is optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>IBM-ULT3580-TD5</tt>
activateGateway_tapeDriveType :: Lens' ActivateGateway (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that defines the type of gateway to activate. The type
--   specified is critical to all later functions of the gateway and cannot
--   be changed after activation. The default value is <tt>CACHED</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>STORED</tt> | <tt>CACHED</tt> | <tt>VTL</tt> |
--   <tt>FILE_S3</tt> | <tt>FILE_FSX_SMB|</tt>
activateGateway_gatewayType :: Lens' ActivateGateway (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags that you can assign to the gateway. Each tag
--   is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   that can be represented in UTF-8 format, and the following special
--   characters: + - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128
--   characters, and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256
--   characters.
activateGateway_tags :: Lens' ActivateGateway (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Your gateway activation key. You can obtain the activation key by
--   sending an HTTP GET request with redirects enabled to the gateway IP
--   address (port 80). The redirect URL returned in the response provides
--   you the activation key for your gateway in the query string parameter
--   <tt>activationKey</tt>. It may also include other activation-related
--   parameters, however, these are merely defaults -- the arguments you
--   pass to the <tt>ActivateGateway</tt> API call determine the actual
--   configuration of your gateway.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Getting activation key</a> in the
--   <i>Storage Gateway User Guide</i>.
activateGateway_activationKey :: Lens' ActivateGateway Text

-- | The name you configured for your gateway.
activateGateway_gatewayName :: Lens' ActivateGateway Text

-- | A value that indicates the time zone you want to set for the gateway.
--   The time zone is of the format "GMT-hr:mm" or "GMT+hr:mm". For
--   example, GMT-4:00 indicates the time is 4 hours behind GMT. GMT+2:00
--   indicates the time is 2 hours ahead of GMT. The time zone is used, for
--   example, for scheduling snapshots and your gateway's maintenance
--   schedule.
activateGateway_gatewayTimezone :: Lens' ActivateGateway Text

-- | A value that indicates the Region where you want to store your data.
--   The gateway Region specified must be the same Region as the Region in
--   your <tt>Host</tt> header in the request. For more information about
--   available Regions and endpoints for Storage Gateway, see <a>Storage
--   Gateway endpoints and quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: See <a>Storage Gateway endpoints and quotas</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Web Services General Reference</i>.
activateGateway_gatewayRegion :: Lens' ActivateGateway Text

-- | Undocumented member.
activateGatewayResponse_gatewayARN :: Lens' ActivateGatewayResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
activateGatewayResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ActivateGatewayResponse Int

-- | Undocumented member.
describeCache_gatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeCache Text

-- | Undocumented member.
describeCacheResponse_gatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of strings that identify disks that are to be configured as
--   working storage. Each string has a minimum length of 1 and maximum
--   length of 300. You can get the disk IDs from the ListLocalDisks API.
describeCacheResponse_diskIds :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | Percent use of the gateway's cache storage. This metric applies only
--   to the gateway-cached volume setup. The sample is taken at the end of
--   the reporting period.
describeCacheResponse_cacheUsedPercentage :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse (Maybe Double)

-- | Percent of application read operations from the file shares that are
--   served from cache. The sample is taken at the end of the reporting
--   period.
describeCacheResponse_cacheHitPercentage :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse (Maybe Double)

-- | Percent of application read operations from the file shares that are
--   not served from cache. The sample is taken at the end of the reporting
--   period.
describeCacheResponse_cacheMissPercentage :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse (Maybe Double)

-- | The amount of cache in bytes allocated to a gateway.
describeCacheResponse_cacheAllocatedInBytes :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | The file share's contribution to the overall percentage of the
--   gateway's cache that has not been persisted to Amazon Web Services.
--   The sample is taken at the end of the reporting period.
describeCacheResponse_cacheDirtyPercentage :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse (Maybe Double)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeCacheResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse Int

--   automatically create new tapes.
automaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo_automaticTapeCreationRules :: Lens' AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo (Maybe (NonEmpty AutomaticTapeCreationRule))

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to indicate that tapes are to be archived as
--   write-once-read-many (WORM). Set to <tt>false</tt> when WORM is not
--   enabled for tapes.
automaticTapeCreationRule_worm :: Lens' AutomaticTapeCreationRule (Maybe Bool)

-- | A prefix that you append to the barcode of the virtual tape that you
--   are creating. This prefix makes the barcode unique.
--   
--   The prefix must be 1-4 characters in length and must be one of the
--   uppercase letters from A to Z.
automaticTapeCreationRule_tapeBarcodePrefix :: Lens' AutomaticTapeCreationRule Text

-- | The ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving.
--   The tape in this pool is archived in the Amazon S3 storage class that
--   is associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
automaticTapeCreationRule_poolId :: Lens' AutomaticTapeCreationRule Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tape capacity.
automaticTapeCreationRule_tapeSizeInBytes :: Lens' AutomaticTapeCreationRule Integer

-- | The minimum number of available virtual tapes that the gateway
--   maintains at all times. If the number of tapes on the gateway goes
--   below this value, the gateway creates as many new tapes as are needed
--   to have <tt>MinimumNumTapes</tt> on the gateway. For more information
--   about automatic tape creation, see <a>Creating Tapes
--   Automatically</a>.
automaticTapeCreationRule_minimumNumTapes :: Lens' AutomaticTapeCreationRule Natural

-- | The average upload rate limit component of the bandwidth rate limit
--   interval, in bits per second. This field does not appear in the
--   response if the upload rate limit is not set.
bandwidthRateLimitInterval_averageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec :: Lens' BandwidthRateLimitInterval (Maybe Natural)

-- | The average download rate limit component of the bandwidth rate limit
--   interval, in bits per second. This field does not appear in the
--   response if the download rate limit is not set.
bandwidthRateLimitInterval_averageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec :: Lens' BandwidthRateLimitInterval (Maybe Natural)

-- | The hour of the day to start the bandwidth rate limit interval.
bandwidthRateLimitInterval_startHourOfDay :: Lens' BandwidthRateLimitInterval Natural

-- | The minute of the hour to start the bandwidth rate limit interval. The
--   interval begins at the start of that minute. To begin an interval
--   exactly at the start of the hour, use the value <tt>0</tt>.
bandwidthRateLimitInterval_startMinuteOfHour :: Lens' BandwidthRateLimitInterval Natural

-- | The hour of the day to end the bandwidth rate limit interval.
bandwidthRateLimitInterval_endHourOfDay :: Lens' BandwidthRateLimitInterval Natural

-- | The minute of the hour to end the bandwidth rate limit interval.
--   
--   The bandwidth rate limit interval ends at the end of the minute. To
--   end an interval at the end of an hour, use the value <tt>59</tt>.
bandwidthRateLimitInterval_endMinuteOfHour :: Lens' BandwidthRateLimitInterval Natural

-- | The days of the week component of the bandwidth rate limit interval,
--   represented as ordinal numbers from 0 to 6, where 0 represents Sunday
--   and 6 represents Saturday.
bandwidthRateLimitInterval_daysOfWeek :: Lens' BandwidthRateLimitInterval (NonEmpty Natural)

-- | Refreshes a file share's cache by using Time To Live (TTL). TTL is the
--   length of time since the last refresh after which access to the
--   directory would cause the file gateway to first refresh that
--   directory's contents from the Amazon S3 bucket or Amazon FSx file
--   system. The TTL duration is in seconds.
--   
--   Valid Values:0, 300 to 2,592,000 seconds (5 minutes to 30 days)
cacheAttributes_cacheStaleTimeoutInSeconds :: Lens' CacheAttributes (Maybe Int)

--   bootstrapping that represents the percent of data transferred. This
--   field does not appear in the response if the cached volume is not
--   restoring or bootstrapping.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeProgress :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Double)

-- | The size, in bytes, of the volume capacity.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeSizeInBytes :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Integer)

-- | The size of the data stored on the volume in bytes. This value is
--   calculated based on the number of blocks that are touched, instead of
--   the actual amount of data written. This value can be useful for
--   sequential write patterns but less accurate for random write patterns.
--   <tt>VolumeUsedInBytes</tt> is different from the compressed size of
--   the volume, which is the value that is used to calculate your bill.
--   
--   This value is not available for volumes created prior to May 13, 2015,
--   until you store data on the volume.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeUsedInBytes :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date the volume was created. Volumes created prior to March 28,
--   2017 dont have this timestamp.
cachediSCSIVolume_createdDate :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique identifier of the volume, e.g., vol-AE4B946D.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeId :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | One of the VolumeType enumeration values that describes the type of
--   the volume.
cachediSCSIVolume_volumeType :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
cachediSCSIVolume_targetName :: Lens' CachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

--

nFSFileShareInfo_fileShareName :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_role :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
nFSFileShareInfo_notificationPolicy :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_squash :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
nFSFileShareInfo_requesterPays :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_nFSFileShareDefaults :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe NFSFileShareDefaults)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_locationARN :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
nFSFileShareInfo_clientList :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
nFSFileShareInfo_guessMIMETypeEnabled :: Lens' NFSFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

--   <tt>false</tt>.

--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>

-- | Tape retention lock type, which can be configured in two modes. When
--   configured in governance mode, accounts with specific IAM permissions
--   are authorized to remove the tape retention lock from archived virtual
--   tapes. When configured in compliance mode, the tape retention lock
--   cannot be removed by any user, including the root account.
poolInfo_retentionLockType :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe RetentionLockType)

-- | Tape retention lock time is set in days. Tape retention lock can be
--   enabled for up to 100 years (36,500 days).
poolInfo_retentionLockTimeInDays :: Lens' PoolInfo (Maybe Natural)

--   characters, except '/' and '\'.

--   use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is archived
--   directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep
--   Archive) that corresponds to the pool.

-- | Specifies the DNS name for the VPC endpoint that the SMB file share
