--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
sMBFileShareInfo_vPCEndpointDNSName :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_authentication :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Refresh cache information for the file share.
sMBFileShareInfo_cacheAttributes :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe CacheAttributes)

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_objectACL :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe ObjectACL)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your
--   own KMS key, or <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3.
--   Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
sMBFileShareInfo_kmsEncrypted :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_fileShareId :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_fileShareARN :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by
--   the S3 File Gateway. The default value is
--   <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
sMBFileShareInfo_defaultStorageClass :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
sMBFileShareInfo_fileShareName :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_role :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, it indicates that access
--   control list (ACL) is enabled on the SMB file share. If it is set to
--   <tt>false</tt>, it indicates that file and directory permissions are
--   mapped to the POSIX permission.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Using Microsoft Windows ACLs to control
--   access to an SMB file share</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User
--   Guide</i>.
sMBFileShareInfo_sMBACLEnabled :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether opportunistic locking is enabled for the SMB file
--   share.
--   
--   Enabling opportunistic locking on case-sensitive shares is not
--   recommended for workloads that involve access to files with the same
--   name in different case.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
sMBFileShareInfo_oplocksEnabled :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | The notification policy of the file share.
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number of seconds to wait
--   after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before
--   generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification. Because clients
--   can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter
--   for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for
--   the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
sMBFileShareInfo_notificationPolicy :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost
--   associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3
--   bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost
--   of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
sMBFileShareInfo_requesterPays :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | Undocumented member.
sMBFileShareInfo_locationARN :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects
--   based on file extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   MIME type guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
sMBFileShareInfo_guessMIMETypeEnabled :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
sMBFileShareInfo_readOnly :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the SMB file share stores
--   files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
sMBFileShareInfo_bucketRegion :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The case of an object name in an Amazon S3 bucket. For
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client determines the case sensitivity.
--   For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the gateway determines the case
--   sensitivity. The default value is <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
sMBFileShareInfo_caseSensitivity :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe CaseSensitivity)

-- | A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the SMB file share, sorted
--   alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair. For a
--   gateway with more than 10 tags assigned, you can view all tags using
--   the <tt>ListTagsForResource</tt> API operation.
sMBFileShareInfo_tags :: Lens' SMBFileShareInfo (Maybe [Tag])

-- | An VolumeiSCSIAttributes object that represents a collection of iSCSI
--   attributes for one stored volume.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeiSCSIAttributes :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe VolumeiSCSIAttributes)

-- | One of the VolumeStatus values that indicates the state of the storage
--   volume.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeStatus :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | If the stored volume was created from a snapshot, this field contains
--   the snapshot ID used, e.g. snap-78e22663. Otherwise, this field is not
--   included.
storediSCSIVolume_sourceSnapshotId :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates if when the stored volume was created, existing data on the
--   underlying local disk was preserved.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
storediSCSIVolume_preservedExistingData :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Bool)

-- | Undocumented member.
storediSCSIVolume_kmsKey :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that indicates whether a storage volume is attached to,
--   detached from, or is in the process of detaching from a gateway. For
--   more information, see <a>Moving your volumes to a different
--   gateway</a>.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeAttachmentStatus :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage volume.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeARN :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | Represents the percentage complete if the volume is restoring or
--   bootstrapping that represents the percent of data transferred. This
--   field does not appear in the response if the stored volume is not
--   restoring or bootstrapping.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeProgress :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Double)

-- | The size of the volume in bytes.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeSizeInBytes :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Integer)

-- | The size of the data stored on the volume in bytes. This value is
--   calculated based on the number of blocks that are touched, instead of
--   the actual amount of data written. This value can be useful for
--   sequential write patterns but less accurate for random write patterns.
--   <tt>VolumeUsedInBytes</tt> is different from the compressed size of
--   the volume, which is the value that is used to calculate your bill.
--   
--   This value is not available for volumes created prior to May 13, 2015,
--   until you store data on the volume.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeUsedInBytes :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date the volume was created. Volumes created prior to March 28,
--   2017 dont have this timestamp.
storediSCSIVolume_createdDate :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique identifier of the volume, e.g., vol-AE4B946D.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeId :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the local disk that was specified in the
--   CreateStorediSCSIVolume operation.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeDiskId :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | One of the VolumeType enumeration values describing the type of the
--   volume.
storediSCSIVolume_volumeType :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was
--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.
storediSCSIVolume_targetName :: Lens' StorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | Tag key. The key can't start with aws:.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | Value of the tag key.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text

--   uploaded before archiving is complete.
--   
--   Range: 0 (not started) to 100 (complete).

--   associated with.

-- | The ID of the pool that contains tapes that will be archived. The
--   tapes in this pool are archived in the S3 storage class that is
--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
tape_poolId :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Text)

-- | If the tape is archived as write-once-read-many (WORM), this value is
--   <tt>true</tt>.
tape_worm :: Lens' Tape (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date that the tape is first archived with tape retention lock
--   enabled.

module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2013-06-30</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Storage Gateway Service
--   
--   Storage Gateway is the service that connects an on-premises software
--   appliance with cloud-based storage to provide seamless and secure
--   integration between an organization's on-premises IT environment and
--   the Amazon Web Services storage infrastructure. The service enables
--   you to securely upload data to the Cloud for cost effective backup and
--   rapid disaster recovery.
--   
--   Use the following links to get started using the /Storage Gateway
--   Service API Reference/:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>Storage Gateway required request headers</a>: Describes the
--   required headers that you must send with every POST request to Storage
--   Gateway.</li>
--   <li><a>Signing requests</a>: Storage Gateway requires that you
--   authenticate every request you send; this topic describes how sign
--   such a request.</li>
--   <li><a>Error responses</a>: Provides reference information about
--   Storage Gateway errors.</li>
--   <li><a>Operations in Storage Gateway</a>: Contains detailed
--   descriptions of all Storage Gateway operations, their request
--   parameters, response elements, possible errors, and examples of
--   requests and responses.</li>
--   <li><a>Storage Gateway endpoints and quotas</a>: Provides a list of
--   each Region and the endpoints available for use with Storage
--   Gateway.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Storage Gateway resource IDs are in uppercase. When you use these
--   resource IDs with the Amazon EC2 API, EC2 expects resource IDs in
--   lowercase. You must change your resource ID to lowercase to use it
--   with the EC2 API. For example, in Storage Gateway the ID for a volume
--   might be <tt>vol-AA22BB012345DAF670</tt>. When you use this ID with
--   the EC2 API, you must change it to <tt>vol-aa22bb012345daf670</tt>.
--   Otherwise, the EC2 API might not behave as expected.
--   
--   IDs for Storage Gateway volumes and Amazon EBS snapshots created from
--   gateway volumes are changing to a longer format. Starting in December
--   2016, all new volumes and snapshots will be created with a
--   17-character string. Starting in April 2016, you will be able to use
--   these longer IDs so you can test your systems with the new format. For
--   more information, see <a>Longer EC2 and EBS resource IDs</a>.
--   
--   For example, a volume Amazon Resource Name (ARN) with the longer
--   volume ID format looks like the following:
--   
--   
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-west-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/volume/vol-1122AABBCCDDEEFFG</tt>.
--   
--   A snapshot ID with the longer ID format looks like the following:
--   <tt>snap-78e226633445566ee</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Announcement: Heads-up  Longer Storage
--   Gateway volume and snapshot IDs coming in 2016</a>.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway

-- | API version <tt>2013-06-30</tt> of the Amazon Storage Gateway SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | An exception occurred because an invalid gateway request was issued to
--   the service. For more information, see the error and message fields.
_InvalidGatewayRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An internal server error has occurred because the service is
--   unavailable. For more information, see the error and message fields.
_ServiceUnavailableError :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An internal server error has occurred during the request. For more
--   information, see the error and message fields.
_InternalServerError :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | CancelArchivalInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelArchival</a> smart constructor.
data CancelArchival
CancelArchival' :: Text -> Text -> CancelArchival

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelArchival</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:CancelArchival'</a>,
--   <a>cancelArchival_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:CancelArchival'</a>, <a>cancelArchival_tapeARN</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape you want to cancel
--   archiving for.
newCancelArchival :: Text -> Text -> CancelArchival

-- | CancelArchivalOutput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelArchivalResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CancelArchivalResponse
CancelArchivalResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> CancelArchivalResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelArchivalResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeARN:CancelArchival'</a>,
--   <a>cancelArchivalResponse_tapeARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the virtual tape for which archiving was canceled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CancelArchivalResponse'</a>,
--   <a>cancelArchivalResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newCancelArchivalResponse :: Int -> CancelArchivalResponse

-- | A JSON object containing one or more of the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CreateStorediSCSIVolumeInput$DiskId</li>
--   <li>CreateStorediSCSIVolumeInput$NetworkInterfaceId</li>
--   <li>CreateStorediSCSIVolumeInput$PreserveExistingData</li>
--   <li>CreateStorediSCSIVolumeInput$SnapshotId</li>
--   <li>CreateStorediSCSIVolumeInput$TargetName</li>
--   </ul>

--   value can only be set when <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>.

--   <a>createNFSFileShare_vPCEndpointDNSName</a> - Specifies the DNS name
--   for the VPC endpoint that the NFS file share uses to connect to Amazon
--   S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheAttributes:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_cacheAttributes</a> - Specifies refresh cache
--   information for the file share.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectACL:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_objectACL</a> - A value that sets the access
--   control list (ACL) permission for objects in the S3 bucket that a S3
--   File Gateway puts objects into. The default value is <tt>private</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsEncrypted:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_kmsEncrypted</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt> to use
--   Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your own KMS key, or
--   <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultStorageClass:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_defaultStorageClass</a> - The default storage
--   class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by the S3 File Gateway.
--   The default value is <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareName:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_fileShareName</a> - The name of the file share.
--   Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationPolicy:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_notificationPolicy</a> - The notification policy
--   of the file share. <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number
--   of seconds to wait after the last point in time a client wrote to a
--   file before generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification.
--   Because clients can make many small writes to files, it's best to set
--   this parameter for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple
--   notifications for the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:squash:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_squash</a> - A value that maps a user to
--   anonymous user.
--   
--   Valid values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>RootSquash</tt>: Only root is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>NoSquash</tt>: No one is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>AllSquash</tt>: Everyone is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:requesterPays:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_requesterPays</a> - A value that sets who pays
--   the cost of the request and the cost associated with data download
--   from the S3 bucket. If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, the
--   requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3 bucket owner pays.
--   However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:nFSFileShareDefaults:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_nFSFileShareDefaults</a> - File share default
--   values. Optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientList:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_clientList</a> - The list of clients that are
--   allowed to access the S3 File Gateway. The list must contain either
--   valid IP addresses or valid CIDR blocks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_guessMIMETypeEnabled</a> - A value that enables
--   guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects based on file
--   extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable MIME type
--   guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value is
--   <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:readOnly:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_readOnly</a> - A value that sets the write
--   status of a file share. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to set the
--   write status to read-only, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketRegion:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_bucketRegion</a> - Specifies the Region of the
--   S3 bucket where the NFS file share stores files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>, <a>createNFSFileShare_tags</a> -
--   A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to the NFS file share.
--   Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_clientToken</a> - A unique string value that you
--   supply that is used by S3 File Gateway to ensure idempotent file share
--   creation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_gatewayARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the S3 File Gateway on which you want to create a file share.

--   - The ARN of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that an S3
--   File Gateway assumes when it accesses the underlying storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:locationARN:CreateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createNFSFileShare_locationARN</a> - The ARN of the backend storage
--   used for storing file data. A prefix name can be added to the S3
--   bucket name. It must end with a "/".
--   
--   You can specify a bucket attached to an access point using a complete
--   ARN that includes the bucket region as shown:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:s3:region:account-id:accesspoint/access-point-name
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you specify a bucket attached to an access point, the bucket policy
--   must be configured to delegate access control to the access point. For
--   information, see <a>Delegating access control to access points</a> in

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeChapCredentialsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:chapCredentials:DescribeChapCredentialsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChapCredentialsResponse_chapCredentials</a> - An array of
--   ChapInfo objects that represent CHAP credentials. Each object in the
--   array contains CHAP credential information for one target-initiator
--   pair. If no CHAP credentials are set, an empty array is returned. CHAP
--   credential information is provided in a JSON object with the following
--   fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>InitiatorName</b>: The iSCSI initiator that connects to the
--   target.</li>
--   <li><b>SecretToAuthenticateInitiator</b>: The secret key that the
--   initiator (for example, the Windows client) must provide to
--   participate in mutual CHAP with the target.</li>
--   <li><b>SecretToAuthenticateTarget</b>: The secret key that the target
--   must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the initiator (e.g.
--   Windows client).</li>
--   <li><b>TargetARN</b>: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage
--   volume.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeChapCredentialsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeChapCredentialsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newDescribeChapCredentialsResponse :: Int -> DescribeChapCredentialsResponse

--   operation failed due to an authentication error.</li>

--   joined a domain.</li>

--   associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to
--   eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class
--   (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.

--   with specific IAM permissions are authorized to remove the tape
--   retention lock from archived virtual tapes. When configured in
--   compliance mode, the tape retention lock cannot be removed by any

--   years (36,500 days).

--   of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to tape pool. Each tag is a
--   key-value pair.

--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,

--   associated with the new custom pool. When you use your backup
--   application to eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the

-- | CreateSMBFileShareInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateSMBFileShare</a> smart constructor.
data CreateSMBFileShare
CreateSMBFileShare' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CacheAttributes -> Maybe ObjectACL -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CaseSensitivity -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateSMBFileShare

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateSMBFileShare</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessBasedEnumeration:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_accessBasedEnumeration</a> - The files and
--   folders on this share will only be visible to users with read access.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adminUserList:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_adminUserList</a> - A list of users or groups in
--   the Active Directory that will be granted administrator privileges on
--   the file share. These users can do all file operations as the
--   super-user. Acceptable formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>,
--   <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>.
--   
--   Use this option very carefully, because any user in this list can do
--   anything they like on the file share, regardless of file permissions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:auditDestinationARN:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_auditDestinationARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the storage used for audit logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:invalidUserList:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_invalidUserList</a> - A list of users or groups
--   in the Active Directory that are not allowed to access the file share.
--   A group must be prefixed with the @ character. Acceptable formats
--   include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and
--   <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if Authentication is set to
--   <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_kmsKey</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a
--   symmetric customer master key (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side
--   encryption. Storage Gateway does not support asymmetric CMKs. This
--   value can only be set when <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>.
--   Optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validUserList:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_validUserList</a> - A list of users or groups in
--   the Active Directory that are allowed to access the file <a></a>
--   share. A group must be prefixed with the @ character. Acceptable
--   formats include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>,
--   <tt>@group1</tt>, and <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if
--   Authentication is set to <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vPCEndpointDNSName:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_vPCEndpointDNSName</a> - Specifies the DNS name
--   for the VPC endpoint that the SMB file share uses to connect to Amazon
--   S3.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authentication:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_authentication</a> - The authentication method
--   that users use to access the file share. The default is
--   <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt> | <tt>GuestAccess</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheAttributes:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_cacheAttributes</a> - Specifies refresh cache
--   information for the file share.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectACL:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_objectACL</a> - A value that sets the access
--   control list (ACL) permission for objects in the S3 bucket that a S3
--   File Gateway puts objects into. The default value is <tt>private</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsEncrypted:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_kmsEncrypted</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt> to use
--   Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your own KMS key, or
--   <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultStorageClass:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_defaultStorageClass</a> - The default storage
--   class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by the S3 File Gateway.
--   The default value is <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareName:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_fileShareName</a> - The name of the file share.
--   Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sMBACLEnabled:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_sMBACLEnabled</a> - Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to enable access control list (ACL) on the SMB file
--   share. Set it to <tt>false</tt> to map file and directory permissions
--   to the POSIX permissions.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Using Microsoft Windows ACLs to control
--   access to an SMB file share</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:oplocksEnabled:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_oplocksEnabled</a> - Specifies whether
--   opportunistic locking is enabled for the SMB file share.
--   
--   Enabling opportunistic locking on case-sensitive shares is not
--   recommended for workloads that involve access to files with the same
--   name in different case.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationPolicy:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_notificationPolicy</a> - The notification policy
--   of the file share. <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number
--   of seconds to wait after the last point in time a client wrote to a
--   file before generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification.
--   Because clients can make many small writes to files, it's best to set
--   this parameter for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple
--   notifications for the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:requesterPays:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_requesterPays</a> - A value that sets who pays
--   the cost of the request and the cost associated with data download
--   from the S3 bucket. If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, the
--   requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3 bucket owner pays.
--   However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_guessMIMETypeEnabled</a> - A value that enables
--   guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects based on file
--   extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable MIME type
--   guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value is
--   <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:readOnly:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_readOnly</a> - A value that sets the write
--   status of a file share. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to set the
--   write status to read-only, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketRegion:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_bucketRegion</a> - Specifies the Region of the
--   S3 bucket where the SMB file share stores files.
--   
--   This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon
--   S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point
--   alias that points to a VPC access point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:caseSensitivity:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_caseSensitivity</a> - The case of an object name
--   in an Amazon S3 bucket. For <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client
--   determines the case sensitivity. For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the
--   gateway determines the case sensitivity. The default value is
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>, <a>createSMBFileShare_tags</a> -
--   A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to the NFS file share.
--   Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_clientToken</a> - A unique string value that you
--   supply that is used by S3 File Gateway to ensure idempotent file share
--   creation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_gatewayARN</a> - The ARN of the S3 File Gateway
--   on which you want to create a file share.
--   
--   <a>$sel:role':CreateSMBFileShare'</a>, <a>createSMBFileShare_role</a>
--   - The ARN of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that an S3
--   File Gateway assumes when it accesses the underlying storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:locationARN:CreateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>createSMBFileShare_locationARN</a> - The ARN of the backend storage
--   used for storing file data. A prefix name can be added to the S3
--   bucket name. It must end with a "/".
--   
--   You can specify a bucket attached to an access point using a complete
--   ARN that includes the bucket region as shown:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:s3:region:account-id:accesspoint/access-point-name
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you specify a bucket attached to an access point, the bucket policy
--   must be configured to delegate access control to the access point. For
--   information, see <a>Delegating access control to access points</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
newCreateSMBFileShare :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateSMBFileShare

--

--   The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a
--   volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example,
--   specifying <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the
--   target ARN of
--   <tt>arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume</tt>.

--

--   previously used for this volume as the new target name.

--   specified gateway.

--   gateway on which to expose the iSCSI target. Only IPv4 addresses are
--   accepted. Use DescribeGatewayInformation to get a list of the network
--   interfaces available on a gateway.
--

--   constructor.

DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse' :: Maybe [StorediSCSIVolume] -> Int -> DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:storediSCSIVolumes:DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse_storediSCSIVolumes</a> -
--   Describes a single unit of output from DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes. The
--   following fields are returned:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ChapEnabled</tt>: Indicates whether mutual CHAP is enabled for
--   the iSCSI target.</li>
--   <li><tt>LunNumber</tt>: The logical disk number.</li>
--   <li><tt>NetworkInterfaceId</tt>: The network interface ID of the
--   stored volume that initiator use to map the stored volume as an iSCSI
--   target.</li>
--   <li><tt>NetworkInterfacePort</tt>: The port used to communicate with
--   iSCSI targets.</li>
--   <li><tt>PreservedExistingData</tt>: Indicates when the stored volume
--   was created, existing data on the underlying local disk was
--   preserved.</li>
--   <li><tt>SourceSnapshotId</tt>: If the stored volume was created from a
--   snapshot, this field contains the snapshot ID used, e.g.
--   <tt>snap-1122aabb</tt>. Otherwise, this field is not included.</li>
--   <li><tt>StorediSCSIVolumes</tt>: An array of StorediSCSIVolume objects
--   where each object contains metadata about one stored volume.</li>
--   <li><tt>TargetARN</tt>: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume
--   target.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeARN</tt>: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the stored
--   volume.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeDiskId</tt>: The disk ID of the local disk that was
--   specified in the CreateStorediSCSIVolume operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeId</tt>: The unique identifier of the storage volume,
--   e.g. <tt>vol-1122AABB</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeiSCSIAttributes</tt>: An VolumeiSCSIAttributes object
--   that represents a collection of iSCSI attributes for one stored
--   volume.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeProgress</tt>: Represents the percentage complete if the
--   volume is restoring or bootstrapping that represents the percent of
--   data transferred. This field does not appear in the response if the
--   stored volume is not restoring or bootstrapping.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeSizeInBytes</tt>: The size of the volume in bytes.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeStatus</tt>: One of the <tt>VolumeStatus</tt> values
--   that indicates the state of the volume.</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeType</tt>: One of the enumeration values describing the
--   type of the volume. Currently, only <tt>STORED</tt> volumes are
--   supported.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newDescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse :: Int -> DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse

--   <a>disassociateFileSystem_forceDelete</a> - If this value is set to
--   true, the operation disassociates an Amazon FSx file system
--   immediately. It ends all data uploads to the file system, and the file
--   system association enters the <tt>FORCE_DELETING</tt> status. If this

-- | RefreshCacheInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRefreshCache</a> smart constructor.
data RefreshCache
RefreshCache' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> RefreshCache

-- | Create a value of <a>RefreshCache</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:folderList:RefreshCache'</a>, <a>refreshCache_folderList</a> -
--   A comma-separated list of the paths of folders to refresh in the
--   cache. The default is [<tt>"/"</tt>]. The default refreshes objects
--   and folders at the root of the Amazon S3 bucket. If <tt>Recursive</tt>
--   is set to <tt>true</tt>, the entire S3 bucket that the file share has
--   access to is refreshed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recursive:RefreshCache'</a>, <a>refreshCache_recursive</a> - A
--   value that specifies whether to recursively refresh folders in the
--   cache. The refresh includes folders that were in the cache the last
--   time the gateway listed the folder's contents. If this value set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, each folder that is listed in <tt>FolderList</tt> is
--   recursively updated. Otherwise, subfolders listed in
--   <tt>FolderList</tt> are not refreshed. Only objects that are in
--   folders listed directly under <tt>FolderList</tt> are found and used
--   for the update. The default is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareARN:RefreshCache'</a>,
--   <a>refreshCache_fileShareARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the file share you want to refresh.
newRefreshCache :: Text -> RefreshCache

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRefreshCacheResponse</a> smart constructor.

--   symmetric customer master key (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side
--   encryption. Storage Gateway does not support asymmetric CMKs. This
--   value can only be set when <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>.
--   Optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheAttributes:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_cacheAttributes</a> - specifies refresh cache
--   information for the file share.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectACL:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_objectACL</a> - A value that sets the access
--   control list (ACL) permission for objects in the S3 bucket that a S3
--   File Gateway puts objects into. The default value is <tt>private</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsEncrypted:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_kmsEncrypted</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt> to use
--   Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your own KMS key, or
--   <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultStorageClass:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_defaultStorageClass</a> - The default storage
--   class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by the S3 File Gateway.
--   The default value is <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareName:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_fileShareName</a> - The name of the file share.
--   Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationPolicy:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_notificationPolicy</a> - The notification policy
--   of the file share. <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number
--   of seconds to wait after the last point in time a client wrote to a
--   file before generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification.
--   Because clients can make many small writes to files, it's best to set
--   this parameter for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple
--   notifications for the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:squash:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_squash</a> - The user mapped to anonymous user.
--   
--   Valid values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>RootSquash</tt>: Only root is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>NoSquash</tt>: No one is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   <li><tt>AllSquash</tt>: Everyone is mapped to anonymous user.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:requesterPays:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_requesterPays</a> - A value that sets who pays
--   the cost of the request and the cost associated with data download
--   from the S3 bucket. If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, the
--   requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3 bucket owner pays.
--   However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:nFSFileShareDefaults:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_nFSFileShareDefaults</a> - The default values
--   for the file share. Optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientList:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_clientList</a> - The list of clients that are
--   allowed to access the S3 File Gateway. The list must contain either
--   valid IP addresses or valid CIDR blocks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_guessMIMETypeEnabled</a> - A value that enables
--   guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects based on file
--   extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable MIME type
--   guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value is
--   <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:readOnly:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_readOnly</a> - A value that sets the write
--   status of a file share. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to set the
--   write status to read-only, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareARN:UpdateNFSFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateNFSFileShare_fileShareARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the file share to be updated.
newUpdateNFSFileShare :: Text -> UpdateNFSFileShare

--   the status of a gateway that is a member of the Active Directory
--   domain.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACCESS_DENIED</tt>: Indicates that the <tt>JoinDomain</tt>
--   operation failed due to an authentication error.</li>
--   <li><tt>DETACHED</tt>: Indicates that gateway is not joined to a
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINED</tt>: Indicates that the gateway has successfully
--   joined a domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>JOINING</tt>: Indicates that a <tt>JoinDomain</tt> operation
--   is in progress.</li>

--   operation failed due to a network or connectivity error.</li>

--   failed because the operation didn't complete within the allotted
--   time.</li>

--   security strategy that was specified for file gateway.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ClientSpecified</tt>: If you use this option, requests are
--   established based on what is negotiated by the client. This option is
--   recommended when you want to maximize compatibility across different
--   clients in your environment. Only supported for S3 File Gateways.</li>
--   <li><tt>MandatorySigning</tt>: If you use this option, file gateway
--   only allows connections from SMBv2 or SMBv3 clients that have signing
--   enabled. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows
--   Vista, Windows Server 2008 or newer.</li>
--   <li><tt>MandatoryEncryption</tt>: If you use this option, file gateway
--   only allows connections from SMBv3 clients that have encryption
--   enabled. This option is highly recommended for environments that
--   handle sensitive data. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft
--   Windows 8, Windows Server 2012 or newer.</li>

-- | CreateTapeWithBarcodeInput
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateTapeWithBarcode</a> smart constructor.
data CreateTapeWithBarcode
CreateTapeWithBarcode' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Integer -> Text -> CreateTapeWithBarcode

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateTapeWithBarcode</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:CreateTapeWithBarcode'</a>,
--   <a>createTapeWithBarcode_kmsKey</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of a symmetric customer master key (CMK) used for Amazon S3
--   server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does not support asymmetric
--   CMKs. This value can only be set when <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is
--   <tt>true</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsEncrypted:CreateTapeWithBarcode'</a>,
--   <a>createTapeWithBarcode_kmsEncrypted</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt> to
--   use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your own KMS key, or
--   <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolId:CreateTapeWithBarcode'</a>,
--   <a>createTapeWithBarcode_poolId</a> - The ID of the pool that you want
--   to add your tape to for archiving. The tape in this pool is archived
--   in the S3 storage class that is associated with the pool. When you use
--   your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is archived
--   directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Deep Archive) that
--   corresponds to the pool.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>GLACIER</tt> | <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:worm:CreateTapeWithBarcode'</a>,
--   <a>createTapeWithBarcode_worm</a> - Set to <tt>TRUE</tt> if the tape
--   you are creating is to be configured as a write-once-read-many (WORM)
--   tape.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateTapeWithBarcode'</a>,
--   <a>createTapeWithBarcode_tags</a> - A list of up to 50 tags that can
--   be assigned to a virtual tape that has a barcode. Each tag is a
--   key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: +
--   - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters,
--   and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:CreateTapeWithBarcode'</a>,
--   <a>createTapeWithBarcode_gatewayARN</a> - The unique Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) that represents the gateway to associate the virtual tape
--   with. Use the ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for
--   your account and Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeSizeInBytes:CreateTapeWithBarcode'</a>,
--   <a>createTapeWithBarcode_tapeSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in bytes, of
--   the virtual tape that you want to create.
--   
--   The size must be aligned by gigabyte (1024*1024*1024 bytes).
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeBarcode:CreateTapeWithBarcode'</a>,
--   <a>createTapeWithBarcode_tapeBarcode</a> - The barcode that you want
--   to assign to the tape.
--   
--   Barcodes cannot be reused. This includes barcodes used for tapes that
--   have been deleted.
newCreateTapeWithBarcode :: Text -> Integer -> Text -> CreateTapeWithBarcode

--   type of security strategy.
--   
--   ClientSpecified: if you use this option, requests are established
--   based on what is negotiated by the client. This option is recommended
--   when you want to maximize compatibility across different clients in
--   your environment. Supported only in S3 File Gateway.
--   
--   MandatorySigning: if you use this option, file gateway only allows
--   connections from SMBv2 or SMBv3 clients that have signing enabled.
--   This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows Vista, Windows
--   Server 2008 or newer.
--   
--   MandatoryEncryption: if you use this option, file gateway only allows
--   connections from SMBv3 clients that have encryption enabled. This
--   option is highly recommended for environments that handle sensitive
--   data. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows 8,
--   Windows Server 2012 or newer.

data DescribeVTLDevices
DescribeVTLDevices' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> DescribeVTLDevices

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeVTLDevices</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:DescribeVTLDevices'</a>,
--   <a>describeVTLDevices_marker</a> - An opaque string that indicates the
--   position at which to begin describing the VTL devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limit:DescribeVTLDevices'</a>, <a>describeVTLDevices_limit</a>
--   - Specifies that the number of VTL devices described be limited to the
--   specified number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vTLDeviceARNs:DescribeVTLDevices'</a>,
--   <a>describeVTLDevices_vTLDeviceARNs</a> - An array of strings, where
--   each string represents the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a VTL device.
--   
--   All of the specified VTL devices must be from the same gateway. If no
--   VTL devices are specified, the result will contain all devices on the
--   specified gateway.

--   the Active Directory that have administrator rights to the file share.
--   A group must be prefixed with the @ character. Acceptable formats
--   include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and
--   <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if Authentication is set to

--   in the Active Directory that are not allowed to access the file share.
--   A group must be prefixed with the @ character. Acceptable formats
--   include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and
--   <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if Authentication is set to
--   <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKey:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_kmsKey</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a
--   symmetric customer master key (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side
--   encryption. Storage Gateway does not support asymmetric CMKs. This
--   value can only be set when <tt>KMSEncrypted</tt> is <tt>true</tt>.

--   group must be prefixed with the @ character. Acceptable formats
--   include: <tt>DOMAIN\User1</tt>, <tt>user1</tt>, <tt>@group1</tt>, and
--   <tt>@DOMAIN\group1</tt>. Can only be set if Authentication is set to
--   <tt>ActiveDirectory</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheAttributes:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_cacheAttributes</a> - Specifies refresh cache
--   information for the file share.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectACL:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_objectACL</a> - A value that sets the access
--   control list (ACL) permission for objects in the S3 bucket that a S3
--   File Gateway puts objects into. The default value is <tt>private</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsEncrypted:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_kmsEncrypted</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt> to use
--   Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your own KMS key, or
--   <tt>false</tt> to use a key managed by Amazon S3. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultStorageClass:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_defaultStorageClass</a> - The default storage
--   class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by the S3 File Gateway.
--   The default value is <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>. Optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>S3_STANDARD</tt> | <tt>S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt> |
--   <tt>S3_STANDARD_IA</tt> | <tt>S3_ONEZONE_IA</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareName:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_fileShareName</a> - The name of the file share.
--   Optional.
--   
--   <tt>FileShareName</tt> must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in
--   <tt>LocationARN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sMBACLEnabled:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_sMBACLEnabled</a> - Set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt> to enable access control list (ACL) on the SMB file
--   share. Set it to <tt>false</tt> to map file and directory permissions
--   to the POSIX permissions.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Using Microsoft Windows ACLs to control
--   access to an SMB file share</a> in the <i>Storage Gateway User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:oplocksEnabled:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_oplocksEnabled</a> - Specifies whether
--   opportunistic locking is enabled for the SMB file share.
--   
--   Enabling opportunistic locking on case-sensitive shares is not
--   recommended for workloads that involve access to files with the same
--   name in different case.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationPolicy:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_notificationPolicy</a> - The notification policy
--   of the file share. <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> controls the number
--   of seconds to wait after the last point in time a client wrote to a
--   file before generating an <tt>ObjectUploaded</tt> notification.
--   Because clients can make many small writes to files, it's best to set
--   this parameter for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple
--   notifications for the same file in a small time period.
--   
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> has no effect on the timing of the
--   object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> on with
--   <tt>SettlingTimeInSeconds</tt> set to 60.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following example sets <tt>NotificationPolicy</tt> off.
--   
--   <pre>
--   {}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:requesterPays:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_requesterPays</a> - A value that sets who pays
--   the cost of the request and the cost associated with data download
--   from the S3 bucket. If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, the
--   requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3 bucket owner pays.
--   However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost of storing data.
--   
--   <tt>RequesterPays</tt> is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs
--   the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share
--   is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:guessMIMETypeEnabled:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_guessMIMETypeEnabled</a> - A value that enables
--   guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects based on file
--   extensions. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to enable MIME type
--   guessing, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>. The default value is
--   <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:readOnly:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_readOnly</a> - A value that sets the write
--   status of a file share. Set this value to <tt>true</tt> to set write
--   status to read-only, otherwise set to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:caseSensitivity:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_caseSensitivity</a> - The case of an object name
--   in an Amazon S3 bucket. For <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>, the client
--   determines the case sensitivity. For <tt>CaseSensitive</tt>, the
--   gateway determines the case sensitivity. The default value is
--   <tt>ClientSpecified</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileShareARN:UpdateSMBFileShare'</a>,
--   <a>updateSMBFileShare_fileShareARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the SMB file share that you want to update.

-- | A JSON object containing one or more of the following fields:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$ActivationKey</li>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$GatewayName</li>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$GatewayRegion</li>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$GatewayTimezone</li>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$GatewayType</li>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$MediumChangerType</li>
--   <li>ActivateGatewayInput$TapeDriveType</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivateGateway</a> smart constructor.
data ActivateGateway
ActivateGateway' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ActivateGateway

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivateGateway</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediumChangerType:ActivateGateway'</a>,
--   <a>activateGateway_mediumChangerType</a> - The value that indicates
--   the type of medium changer to use for tape gateway. This field is
--   optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>STK-L700</tt> | <tt>AWS-Gateway-VTL</tt> |
--   <tt>IBM-03584L32-0402</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tapeDriveType:ActivateGateway'</a>,
--   <a>activateGateway_tapeDriveType</a> - The value that indicates the
--   type of tape drive to use for tape gateway. This field is optional.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>IBM-ULT3580-TD5</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayType:ActivateGateway'</a>,
--   <a>activateGateway_gatewayType</a> - A value that defines the type of
--   gateway to activate. The type specified is critical to all later
--   functions of the gateway and cannot be changed after activation. The
--   default value is <tt>CACHED</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>STORED</tt> | <tt>CACHED</tt> | <tt>VTL</tt> |
--   <tt>FILE_S3</tt> | <tt>FILE_FSX_SMB|</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ActivateGateway'</a>, <a>activateGateway_tags</a> - A
--   list of up to 50 tags that you can assign to the gateway. Each tag is
--   a key-value pair.
--   
--   Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers
--   that can be represented in UTF-8 format, and the following special
--   characters: + - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128
--   characters, and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256
--   characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activationKey:ActivateGateway'</a>,
--   <a>activateGateway_activationKey</a> - Your gateway activation key.
--   You can obtain the activation key by sending an HTTP GET request with
--   redirects enabled to the gateway IP address (port 80). The redirect
--   URL returned in the response provides you the activation key for your
--   gateway in the query string parameter <tt>activationKey</tt>. It may
--   also include other activation-related parameters, however, these are
--   merely defaults -- the arguments you pass to the
--   <tt>ActivateGateway</tt> API call determine the actual configuration
--   of your gateway.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Getting activation key</a> in the
--   <i>Storage Gateway User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayName:ActivateGateway'</a>,
--   <a>activateGateway_gatewayName</a> - The name you configured for your
--   gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayTimezone:ActivateGateway'</a>,
--   <a>activateGateway_gatewayTimezone</a> - A value that indicates the
--   time zone you want to set for the gateway. The time zone is of the
--   format "GMT-hr:mm" or "GMT+hr:mm". For example, GMT-4:00 indicates the
--   time is 4 hours behind GMT. GMT+2:00 indicates the time is 2 hours
--   ahead of GMT. The time zone is used, for example, for scheduling
--   snapshots and your gateway's maintenance schedule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayRegion:ActivateGateway'</a>,
--   <a>activateGateway_gatewayRegion</a> - A value that indicates the
--   Region where you want to store your data. The gateway Region specified
--   must be the same Region as the Region in your <tt>Host</tt> header in
--   the request. For more information about available Regions and
--   endpoints for Storage Gateway, see <a>Storage Gateway endpoints and
--   quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General Reference</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: See <a>Storage Gateway endpoints and quotas</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Web Services General Reference</i>.
newActivateGateway :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ActivateGateway

-- | Storage Gateway returns the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the
--   activated gateway. It is a string made of information such as your
--   account, gateway name, and Region. This ARN is used to reference the
--   gateway in other API operations as well as resource-based
--   authorization.
--   
--   For gateways activated prior to September 02, 2015, the gateway ARN
--   contains the gateway name rather than the gateway ID. Changing the
--   name of the gateway has no effect on the gateway ARN.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivateGatewayResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ActivateGatewayResponse
ActivateGatewayResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> ActivateGatewayResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivateGatewayResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayARN:ActivateGatewayResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activateGatewayResponse_gatewayARN</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ActivateGatewayResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activateGatewayResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newActivateGatewayResponse :: Int -> ActivateGatewayResponse

--   identify disks that are to be configured as working storage. Each
--   string has a minimum length of 1 and maximum length of 300. You can
--   get the disk IDs from the ListLocalDisks API.

--   gateway-cached volume setup. The sample is taken at the end of the
--   reporting period.

--   cache. The sample is taken at the end of the reporting period.

--   <a>describeCacheResponse_cacheMissPercentage</a> - Percent of

--   from cache. The sample is taken at the end of the reporting period.

--   cache in bytes allocated to a gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheDirtyPercentage:DescribeCacheResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCacheResponse_cacheDirtyPercentage</a> - The file share's
--   contribution to the overall percentage of the gateway's cache that has
--   not been persisted to Amazon Web Services. The sample is taken at the
--   end of the reporting period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeCacheResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCacheResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDescribeCacheResponse :: Int -> DescribeCacheResponse

-- | Information about the gateway's automatic tape creation policies,

data AutomaticTapeCreationPolicyInfo
